loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda R. operates a small grocery store in their house that sells basic commodities. She is married to Nichomedes and blessed with one child. Her husband's main source of income is charcoal selling to other municipalities. They are already seven years in their economic activities that prove to be of good income sourcing activities.

She is applying for a loan in order to augment her working capital in her sari-sari store at the same time helping her husband in accumulating income to support their family.

She is a new member in the cooperative and really shows her willingness to cooperative activities. She establishes good credit record in their community.

loans.use: Additional Capital on Sari- sari Store

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy linen, silk, textiles, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Orlando Cornelio

texts.es: El señor Orlando B. de 54 años de edad,  trabaja como sastre desde hace 18 años, anteriormente trabajaba  el Trajes Gómez y Trajes Guido en la misma profesión, pero luego opto por trabajar por cuenta propia para tener mejores ingresos. Reside en el barrio Omar Torrijos de Enitel Jardines de Veracruz 1 ½ c abajo en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, e independientes. Es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual ha incrementado su inventario y ha podido tener su negocio estable con este crédito invertirá en la compra de tela variada, hilos, bordados, botones y otros para realizar su trabajo y ofrecer a sus clientes cada día lo mejor. Sus planes es poder pagar en tiempo y forma su crédito y poder terminar de completar su maquinaria necesita comprar otra maquina de coser adecuada para hacer los vestido modernos de esta moda actual. A si como poder mejorar su casa ya que es muy sencilla, partes están ya en mal estado  lo que es de madera y espera poder cambiar. Agradece a la institución por hacer posible el financiamiento.

loans.use: Comprar tela variada, hilos, bordados, botones y otros.

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr: Née en 1973, M. Aïcha est veuve et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Aïcha réside depuis huit ans au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Aïcha est une analphabète qui vit seule avec ses enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par elle seule. Aïcha vend des sacs de charbon de bois et divers produits depuis environs treize ans à son domicile à Sègbèya. Aïcha s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin. Aïcha a déjà obtenu à ALIDé, deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour élever plus le niveau de son activité afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Aïcha sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Aïcha M. is a widow and has two children, both of whom are in school. For eight years, Aïcha has lived in the Sègbèya district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Aïcha is illiterate and lives alone with her two children. The household expenses are taken care of by her alone. Aïcha has been selling bags of charcoal and and various other products for about thirteen years at her house in Sègbèya. Aïcha supplies herself at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Aïcha has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. To raise the level of her business so as to satisfy the demands of her customers and provide for her children, Aïcha is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Bishnu

texts.en:
Mrs. Bishnu L. lives in the village of Dolchoki, which is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region, making the lives of the people living there difficult. Almost all people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

There are six members in Bishnu's family, including herself. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and four children. She has one son and three daughters. All of her children are studying in primary school.

Both Mrs. L. and her husband Mr. Raj Kumar L. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Because the region is hilly, they face many problems in farming. Now Mrs. L. is requesting her first term loan of Rs 10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Fiorella Karina

texts.es:
La señora FIORELLA KARINA V. P. tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria,  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año de edad quien depende de ella. La socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y también realiza tratamientos faciales a sus vecinas, amistades y familiares en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, compró cosméticos como: labiales, cremas, colonias, polvos, rubores, etc.
Con este crédito de 500 nuevos soles, comprará cosméticos como: polvos, cremas, labiales, colonias, rimer, etc y también comprará tintes y cremas de cutis para realizar limpiezas faciales. Fiorella  sueña con tener su propio centro de belleza para así poder obtener mayores ganancias y poder  cubrir todas las necesidades de su bebe.
texts.en:
FIORELLA KARINA V. P. is 24 years old, and lives in the Salaverry district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. The member belongs to the “Enterprising Women for Success II” cooperative bank. She studied until the 5th year of secondary school, is married, and has a 1-year old child who depends on her. The member dedicates herself to selling cosmetics, and also provides facial treatments to her neighbors, friends, and acquaintances in her area. She used her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles to buy cosmetics such as: lipsticks, creams, colognes, talc, blushes, etc. With this loan of 500 soles, she will buy beauty products such as: talc, creams, lipsticks, colognes, etc., and also to buy skin potions and creams for facials. Fiorella dreams of opening her own beauty store in order to increase her earnings and support all of her baby’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics such as powders, creams, lipsticks, colognes, etc., and also skin potions and creams for facials.

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Mariam S., age 35, is a widow with two children, ages 17 and 11 years old. She has a small charcoal store, retail shop and video showplace. She opened the business in 2008 and works long daily hours from 6 am until 10 pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $113.

This will be Mariam’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to open the retail shop and the video showplace businesses, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes to get a loan to open a cafe and start selling milk and bites.

Mariam will share this loan with her 15 member group, "Sarafina". They hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. In the photo, Mariam is third from the right in an orange dress with shining beads in her hair.

loans.use: To open a cafe and start selling milk and bites

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Korng S., 53, is married with six children. She resides in Phnom Penh City with her husband and children. To make a living, she is involved in a business selling tobacco and betel leaves for older people at a local market in the town, earning an income of US $5 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently employed as a construction worker, earning an income of US $3 per day. These sources of income help cover the family expenses. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more tobacco and betel leaves for resale. With the remainder, she wants to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work at the construction site. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to cut back on public transportation expenses.

loans.use: buy tobacco and betel leaves for resale and a motorbike

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru: Бозоргул Бобоназарова проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 56 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. бозоргул имеет торговую точку на рынке, где занимается торговлей более 14 лет. В основном она торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bozorgul B. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. Bozorgul has a retail outlet at a market, where she has been involved in sales for over 14 years. She primarily sells food products. She is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Phạm Thị's Group

texts.en:
A. Phạm Thị (10105030025) is a 48-year-old woman who lives in the town of Đông A. - Hà nội. A. is the leader of a 6-member loan group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Hội Phụ (2).

A. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, A. operates a family member's manufacturing business where they make and sell bamboo products to local businesses and community members. A. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, A. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. A. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.028.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.014.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be A.'s 5th loan from SEDA. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1. Chử Thị T. (10105030027) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


2. Nguyễn Thị D. (10105030028) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business selling home products.


3. Đào Thị Thúy L. (10105030030) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


4. Nguyễn Thị H. (10105030029) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her retail store.


5. Vũ Thị T. (10105030026) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


A. Phạm Thị (10105030025) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông A. - Hà nội. A. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Hội Phụ (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doA. chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doA. nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. A. thực hiện công việc kinh doA. này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, A. kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2006, A. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doA. của cô ấy/ A. ấy. A. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.028.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên L. thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.014.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. Chử Thị T. (10105030027) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là vận hành công việc kinh doA. sản xuất.


2. Nguyễn Thị D. (10105030028) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là buôn bán hàng gia dụng.


3. Đào Thị Thúy L. (10105030030) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là vận hành công việc kinh doA. sản xuất.


4. Nguyễn Thị H. (10105030029) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là kinh doA. cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5. Vũ Thị T. (10105030026) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DoA. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La señora Maria Esther B. se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas suaves. Desde muy temprano se levanta para ir al molino dejando  el juego encendido para luego hacer las ricas tortillas que ofrece en la zona .antes de tener este negocio ella era ama de casa y los ingresos eran mínimos pero con los créditos que Ceprodel les brindo se le dio la oportunidad de generar nuevos ingresos en la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Esther B. earns a living making soft tortillas. She wakes up early to go the grain mill so that she can later prepare the scrumptious tortillas that she makes available in her area.

Prior to operating this business, Maria was a housewife who had minimal income prior to receiving loans from CEPRODEL. She is thankful for being given an opportunity to generate a new source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for making tortillas

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona V. is from the city of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Alona is married and has one young children. To make a living, Alona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Alona has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Alona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. This will be Alona's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.en:
Teodosia C. is from the village of Purok-Bularan, Miputak. She is 60 years old. Teodosia is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Teodosia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teodosia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In March 2006, Teodosia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teodosia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teodosia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Teodosia from PMPC and her third KIVA loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dougla Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Douglas Rene B. Solís, se desempeña como jardinero en un hotel de playa, su estado civil es casado, es padre de tres hijos, dos en edad escolar, los créditos que ha solicitado le han beneficiado en gran medida, ya que esta es la única forma  de hacer mejoras en su vivienda, gracias a estos financiamientos, su casa era cerrada con latones y hoy en día, la casa es de concreto.
texts.en:
Douglas Rene B. Solís works as a gardener at a hotel at the beach. He is married and the father of three children, two of them of school age. Douglas has taken out loans in the past, which have helped him greatly. This is the only way he can make improvements in his house. Thanks to these loans, the house is now enclosed and made of cement. This loan will be used for more construction materials, such as cement, sand, arena, gravel, iron and metal roofing.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, iron, and roofing

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: La Sra. Corina, es una D. nuestras nuevas emprendedoras, que al igual que muchas mujeres buscan generar ingresos a través D. empleos informales como la compra D. artículos D. ferretería al por mayor del interior del país como Oruro, y la entrega a ferreterías al por mayor. Ella cuenta con 3 hijos, que se encuentran en edad escolar y uno próximo a bachiller,  vive actualmente en la casa D. sus padres, junto a sus hermanos. Ante el incremento del desempleo en nuestro país su esposo  tuvo que dejar su familia  e ir en busca D. trabajo, y mientras el señor trataba D. buscar empleo en España la señora se vio obligada a buscar  actividades que le permitan sostener a su familia, inicialmente su madre le permitió  colocar una tienda D. barrio en su domicilio con el fin D. apoyarla, sin embargo no fue suficiente, ya que las necesidades D. sus hijos crecían D. acuerdo a su edad, por lo cual tuvo que buscar nuevas opciones como a la distribución D. artículos D. ferretería. Ella tiene el sueño D. poder incrementar su capital con el fin D. generar mayor ingreso para poder abastecerse y tener una ferretería propia. Con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor y despues entregar a sus pedidos a sus clientes, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Corina is one of our new enterprising women. Like many others, she needs to generate income through informal employment such as buying goods at wholesale prices from the markets in the country's interior in places such as Oruro, and reselling them at a profit. Corina has 3 children who attend school, one of whom will soon finish secondary school. Right now, they are living in the home of Corina's parents. With the increase in unemployment in the country, Corina's husband had to leave the family to look for work. While he looked for work in Spain, Corina realized it was her obligation to look for work that could help sustain the family. In the beginning, her mother allowed her to locate a small shop in her house, but this wasn't sufficient to generate the income needed. Corina needed to find new opportunities such as her wholesale business. Corina dreams of being able to increase her income so that she can open her own market. With the loan, she will purchase merchandise at wholesale prices and then resell it to her customers. Corina is grateful to the organization Emprender, and to Kiva, for the confidence they give to her in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to help grow her business.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah is widowed with six children and none of her children goes to school. It's only grandchildren who go to school.  She owns a ??? roomed house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Norah takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family.  She owns a stall in Nakawa selling yellow bananas Besieds this yellow banana business Norah also sells charcoal at the smae stall. Norah sells to all categories of people both retail and  wholesale. Norah doesn’t incur transportation charges as she buys from her place of work. She also owns rental houses.  She works seven days a week.  Norah receives at least 25 customers a day.  She has been in this business for over 20 years Norah‘s business challenges include thieves and the rainy season because she sells from an open place. She wants to use this loan  partly to buy more bunches of yellow bananas and another part to buy bags of charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow big and start going direclty to farmers. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was negotiable.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananasand charcoal

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 26 years old. Catherine is married and has a 2-year-old child. To make a living, Catherine owns & operates a general store where she sells rice and daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Catherine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Catherine from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy her own vehicle and to save up for her child's education. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosabel

texts.es: Rosabel  tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente en el agricultura, asimismo cría animales vacuno, siendo su método de trabajo, el comprar toros pequeños, que aun están por desarrollar o aquellos que no tienen buen peso, entonces se dedica a su alimentación para engordarlos lo suficiente para luego venderlos a un precio competitivo en el mercado. Por otro lado cuando cosechan papa, éstos son vendidos al por mayor, resultando estas actividades rentables e importante para el ingreso económico de su familia, es por eso que desea incrementar de más animal vacuno. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de abono y también de un toro pequeño.
texts.en:
Rosabel is 27 years old and lives with her husband and son in their own home. All her life she has worked hard in agriculture, she also breeds cattle and buys small bulls that are still developing or those that are underweight and she feeds them to fatten them up and sells them at a competitive price in the market. She also grows potatoes they are sold wholesale. She wants to increase her stock of cattle since it is more profitable and important for her family’s household income. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) she is very responsible with her payments and considers that it will be very helpful for her business to progress. With the loan she will buy fertilizer and a small bull.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a small bull and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
Don José es padre de familia de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 44 años, desde hace varios años trabaja con un taxi de su propiedad, pues ha sido su medio de trabajo para ayudar a sus hijos. Su esposa también le ayuda ya que con ahorro logro afiliarse con la Avon en donde vende una variedad de productos.
El señor José trabaja en turnos, las dificultades que se le presentan es el aumento de la gasolina cada día, y los pasajeros desean la carrera baja, lo que disminuye es la clientela que hay día que solo saca para la gasolina. A si como otros días buenos.
Mediante estos préstamos ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa, el cual cambiara techo ya que esta pasándosele el agua en esta época de invierno.
Es por eso comprara zinc, perlines para comenzar hacer la obra.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old and is the father of three children. He’s been driving his own taxi for several years and this has been the source of income with which he supports his children. His wife also helps by selling Avon products. José works in shifts. His biggest challenge is the daily increase in fuel prices, while his passengers expect to continue to pay low prices. On some days he only manages to bring in enough to cover fuel costs, but he has some good days as well. He’s been able to make improvements to his home through these loans. He will install a new roof, now that the current one has been leaking this winter. He is buying zinc metal sheeting in order to begin the job.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New roof

loans.name: Agakindo Group

texts.fr:
La cheftaine du groupe Agakindo est Hyacinthe M., alors que Mr. Jean de Dieu M. a été choisi pour créer le profil de ce groupe. Hyacinthe est celle qui a levé la main, et Jean de Dieu M. est le deuxième à la gauche.
M. Jean de Dieu, née à Bugesera l’Est du pays en 1975, marié avec sept enfants,son ainé a 11 ans et son cadet a 2 ans et il a étudié l’école primaire. Il vit avec sa famille à Sake Bugesera. Trois enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé AGAKINDO,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont agri-éleveurs et ils se garantissent mutuellement, M. et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals pour leurs enfants. M., lui fait  le commerce de boutique, le prêt lui permettra d'acheter le sucre, du sel, savons pour augmenter son capital. En fait, le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour vente de ses produits. Une partie des intérêts est réinvesti,une autre est épargné afin de préparer l’avenir.
texts.en:
The leader of the Agakindo group is Hyacinthe Mikantibazi, but Mr. Jean de Dieu M. was chosen to create this group's Kiva profile. Hyacinthe is the person raising her hand, and Jean de Dieu M. is the second from the right. Jean de Dieu M. was born in Bugesera -in the East part of the country- in 1975. He is married with seven children, of whom the eldest is 11 and the youngest 2 years old. He went to school at the primary level and lives with his family in Sake Bugesera. Three of his children attend school. He belongs to a solidarity group called AGAKINDO, whose members are mainly farmers and guarantee mutual support within the group. M. and his group work to improve their families’ living conditions and pay their children’s tuition fees. M. for his part operates a store. The loan will enable him to buy sugar, salt, and soap to increase his working capital. In fact, the group has contracted a loan within the Amasezerano Community Banking association for the sale of their products. Part of the loan interests are reinvested, and the remainder is put into savings in preparation for future needs. Concerning the group A group loan means that each member takes a share of the loan and makes use of it in their business. The advantage lies in that the group guarantees each member’s individual loan so that if a group member is unable to honor his commitments, the whole group will reimburse in his place.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap, salt and sugar for retail sales in his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cacao and orange plants to increase crops.

loans.name: Celfida Del Carmen

texts.es: Celfida del Carmen tiene 36 años de edad tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de tiste y frijoles cocidos, que son muy solicitados por su clientes y vecinos, pues desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar fuerte.  Ella tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual dio inicio buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos para su familia. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de frijoles y tiste. Su meta es continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para tener una fuente ingresos fija.
texts.en:
Celfida del Carmen is 36 years old and has 1 dependent child in her care. Her work is selling tiste [a traditional drink made from corn and cocoa] and cooked beans, which are very popular among her customers and neighbors. Since she was very young, she has enjoyed working hard. She has operated this business for 2 years; she started it because she was looking for an alternative source of income for her family. Her loan will be invested in buying beans and tiste. Her goal is to continue investing in the business so that she can receive a steady source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Florajaida

texts.en:
Florajaida R. is from the city of Labo Ozamiz City. She is 68 years old. Florajaida is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Florajaida owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like candies, toothpaste, soap and the like in the local community. Florajaida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florajaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. Florajaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Florajaida is requesting a new loan which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Florajaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Corocoreña Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Las Corocoreñas”, es un grupo que está iniciando el ciclo número 1, consta de ocho integrantes, a la cabeza  se encuentra la Mesa Directiva que está conformada por la señora María Benita como Presidenta, la señora Elizabeth como Tesorera y la señora Rosario como Secretaria de Actas.

La  señora presidenta, tiene como negocio la venta de hojas de coca, conocida medicina natural para el "sorojchi" o mal del altura y para aliviar el dolor de estómago, la señora María Benita cuenta con este negocio desde hace veinte años.  Actualmente tiene un puesto fijo de venta al frente del mercado Corazón de Cobre.  
Este primer crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercadería.

Las integrantes de la A.C. “Las Corocoreñas” tienen diferentes negocios de servicio y comercio: venta de hojas de coca, tienda de barrio, venta de pasancalla, fideos y tostados, venta de cosméticos y víveres, venta de leche PIL, venta de víveres a cuotas y tienda de joyería.
texts.en:
The community association 'Las Corocoreñas' is beginning its first loan cycle. The group is composed of eight members and headed by a board of directors. Señora María Benita is president, Señora Elizabeth treasurer, and Señora Rosario secretary. María Benita sells coca leaves, well-known as natural remedy for ‘soroche’ or altitude sickness, and for stomach ache. She has had this business for twenty years and currently has a stall opposite the Corazón de Cobre market. This first loan will be used to buy merchandise. The members of the group have a variety of service and commercial businesses: coco leaf selling; neighbourhood store; stall selling pasankalla (type of quinoa), pasta, and tostados; cosmetic and supplies sales; milk products sales; and jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina B. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 35 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Lucina owns and operates a business making and selling food,  primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Lucina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Lucina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lucina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Lucina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase inventory

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn V. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Kalubihan, Brgy. Libertad, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and food vending. Her husband Edgardo, who is 44 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are 2 months to 20 years old. Jocelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jocelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store and food vending businesses so that she can continue to pay for her daughter's school tuition. Jocelyn V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 28 años, es soltera y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “La Unión” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Maria alterna sus actividad del hogar con el pequeño negocio que tiene, ella tiene en su domicilio un establecimiento donde expende medicamentos como por ejemplo pastillas, antibióticos, pomada y muchas cosas más. 

Maria con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1000 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar medicamentos. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old, single and lives in the city of Cusco.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “La Unión” community bank for a long time.  Magdalena divides her time between her household duties and her small business.  She has a store in her home where she sells medicines such as tablets, antibiotics, ointment and a lot more besides.

Maria will use her loan for 1,000 nuevos soles to increase her business capital and to buy medicines.

She is is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her business capital and to buy medicines

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia vive en casa propia en la zona Pura Pura, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su  su hijo; es madre soltera. Claudia es empleada de una tienda de venta de joyas de fantasía, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene; el crédito que solicita será utilizado en la refacción de la fachada de la casa y el colocado de una puerta principal de entrada
Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, pues se la considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in her own home in Pura Pura district, in the city of La Paz with her child.  She is a single mother.  Claudia works in a shop selling costume jewelry.  She uses her income to support herself.  This loan will be used to refurbish the front of her house and to install a main entrance door.

Her background qualifies her to obtain a new loan since she is considered a good client.

loans.use: To refurbish the front of her house and install a front door

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. A. es una persona muy humilde y coordial ella siempre se habia dedicado a la criansa de sus hijos, en este momento ella esta separado de su esposo todos sus hijos se han casado ellos la siguen apoyando económicamente, pero a ella no le gusta atenerse a ellos es por eso empezo a colocar venta de ropa usada y vio que era un buen negocio a parte que le gusta mucho las ventas para relacionarse y conocer gente ya que ella es muy sociable. Ella desea el crédito para comprar mercancía y tener más surtido su puesto de venta de ropa y meter otros artículos de segundo uso.
texts.en:
Sra. A. is a humble and kind person who has always dedicated herself to raising her children. She is separated from her husband at the moment. All of her children are married and continue to support her financially. However, Sra. A. does not like being dependent on them so she started a business selling used clothing.

She found out that she was good at making sales because she gets to meet and become familiar with people since she is very sociable. Sra. A. needs a loan to buy merchandise so that her vending stand will be well-stocked with clothes and other secondhand goods.

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Angela Benedicta

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora  Ángela, ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación ha procreado tres niñas de 18, 17 y 8 años de edad, dos de ellas están en colegio y la menor en escuela. El esposo es estilista.

Ella se dedica a la producción y comercialización de dulces, todas las mañanas se levanta a las 5am a preparar los dulces, una vez preparado sus deliciosos dulces, los entrega a comerciantes que se los llevan a vender a otros cantones y ciudades del país, en esta labor le ayuda uno de sus hijos. Lleva en este negocio 10 años y dice que su mamá le enseño a preparar los dulces.

Este crédito es para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para la fabricación de los dulces como, azúcar, saborizantes, harina, huevos, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya 4 años, es la fiscal de reglamentos del Banco. Su sueño es  tener un buen local donde preparar y vender los dulces.
texts.en:
In Rocafuerte canton the members of the La Unión Hace La Fuerza (Unity Makes Strength) communal bank meet every two weeks.  This place is known for the delicious sweets the residents make that are renowned throughout the country.

We find Ángela, 35, here.  She is married and has three daughters who are 18, 17 and 8 years of age.  Two of them are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a hair stylist.

She makes sweets to sell.  She gets up every morning at 5am to make the sweets.  Once they are done she delivers them to merchants who take them to other cantons and cities in the country to sell.  One of her daughters helps her with this work.  She’s been in the business 10 years and she says her mother taught her how to make the sweets.

This loan is to buy the ingredients that are necessary to make the sweets like: sugar, flavoring agents, flour, eggs, etc.

She’s been in the communal bank for 4 years now and is the Financial Overseer of the bank’s rules.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can make and sell the sweets.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flavoring agents, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: El Buen Futuro 2 Group

texts.en:
Rafaela is the coordinator of her group El Buen Futuro 2 (The Good Future) 2. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.

Rafaela is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She operates a store that sells ice cream and juices. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing coconut, sugar, flavor, water, etc. She will use the profits to re-invest and to save, because she wants to finish building her house. She wants to have a nice and safe house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making ice cream and juice

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman who lives in Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling of fruits and a general store businesses. Her husband Antonio P., who is 61 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living.  They have two children who are 34 and 39 years old. And they have already a job of their own. Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 31,200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use to pay for more buy stocks of fruits to sell to a market so that she could continue to save up for future family needs. Cecilia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her fruits and general store to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon S. is from the village of Brgy. Quirino, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Corazon is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Corazon operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Corazon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing flour and wheat for cake production

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. lives in the Bubajjwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has two children, both of whom are in school. Sarah has a business of raising and selling poultry. She has been in this business for less than a year, and she works six days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market. Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more poultry feed and chicks. Sarah's goals are to buy a photocopy machine. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her monthly expenses are paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace A. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Mary Grace is married and has a baby. Mary Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store.The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoes from Natasha & Avon in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mary Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Mary Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and improve working capital. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts. This loan will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is 38 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is a widow and has three children aged 20, 19 and 13; they all live with her and are attending school. 

For three years she has been selling frozen chicken. She used to buy frozen chicken for herself and the owner of the store asked her if she wanted to sell on her own. Now she has a regular group of customers that she visits regularly to deliver frozen chicken. She sells on credit to some clients and sometimes is not able to collect all the money to pay for all the chicken. What she likes about the business is making her own money. 

Bindu has requested a loan to purchase more frozen chicken. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak P. is 66 years old and is a widow.  She lives with two of her children in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells fried bananas from home, earning US$1 per day. She is also receives support from two of her children who are employed in garment factories.  Prak P. needs a loan of US$1200 to fix her leaking roof and broken wood ladder.

loans.use: fix her leaking roof and broken wood ladder

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Josephine is widowed and has one adult child. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies, like banana cues, in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed, like bananas & sugar. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed, like bananas & sugar

loans.name: Merta Jati Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu will use the loan to buy a pig that will be prepared to be a sow, while the remaining money will be used to buy feed. By breeding the sow, she plans to sell piglets to her neighbors. 

Currently in her village it is difficult to find a young pig. She saw this as a business opportunity. She hopes to become the largest seller of piglets in the village.

This period, one of the members of her group resigned and was replaced by a new one.

loans.use: to buy a pig that will be prepared to be a breeding sow

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 54 years old and married with three children.

Rosenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items for her store to sell.

Rosenda has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 12 years.  She also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rosenda aspires to save enough money so she can raise more pigs and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her store to sell

loans.name: Lunsar Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Lunsar Group. They are petty businesswomen in the northern town of Magburaka. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leones each in order to expand their respective businesses both in terms of size and quality. 

The 35-year-old Isatu is the leader of the group. Isatu sells drinks, foodstuffs, batteries, soaps, etc. Isatu is requesting this loan in order to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, foodstuffs, batteries, soaps, etc., in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is a hardworking Filipina entrepreneur who for the past 25 years has bought and sold sea shells. She also earns more income from renting sound systems.

Nory has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more shells to sell.

Nory dreams of building and expanding her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Nueva Vida, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es de clima frió, es la tercera de más importancia económicamente del país, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, esta ciudad tienen una gran variedad en su gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Doña Narcisa tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 23, 21 y 18 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y estudian, su última hija está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Narcisa labora de lunes a viernes como cocinera y  su horario es de 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde, después de su trabajo se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual vende recorriendo y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ceviches.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 14 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener un mayor surtido.

Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a member of the village bank Nueva Vida. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate and is the third most economically important city in the country. The people there maintain their culture and traditions. The city has a varied gastronomy that captivates the palates of locals and foreigners.

Narcisa is 43 and a single mother of 3 children ages 23, 21 and 18. Her first two children work and study, and her youngest daughter is studying in a local high school. They don't own a home, so they rent.

Narcisa works Monday to Friday from 9am to 3pm as a cook. After work she travels selling clothes and on the weekends she sells ceviche. 

She has been a member of the village bank for 14 years and will invest her new loan in the purchase of clothes in order to have a larger stock.

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a bamboo weaving and "nipa" business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional bamboo and stocks of "nipa" to sell for bamboo weaving and "nipa" business.

Violeta has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from selling bananas & vegetables.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional bamboo and stocks of "nipa" (palm fronds used in making mats for constructing huts) to sell.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz is 65 years old and widowed with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Paz has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. Paz requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables and spices. She has been in her business for 11 years. In the future, she wants to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela Luz tiene 51 años D. edad  y su familia está conformada por ella su esposo y 03 hijos independiente. Actualmente Estela trabaja en una fábrica en el área D. mantenimiento (limpieza) llevando 5 años en dicho rubro, ella decido trabajar ya que con lo que ganaba su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Estela deciD. apoyar a su esposo, Ella se siente muy feliz ya que gracias a su trabajo a logrado que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar y ahora son profesionales. Su deseo D. Estela es D. terminar D. construir su vivienda ya que piensa instalar una bodega surtida D. abarrotes, ya que nos manifiesta que desea tener tranquilidad para su vejez. Con el crédito solicitado aportara para la construcción D. su vivienda.

Estela Luz junto a la Alcancía Comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” integrante es un grupo conformado por 07 personas responsables que desean seguir trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad,  Estela esta ubicada primera lado izquierda vestida polo color lila, chompa color beis. 

La señora Mari Luz no logro llegar a tiempo para la foto por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Estela Luz is 51 years old and her family is maD. up of her husband and her 3 children who have moved out. Currently Estela has been working in a factory doing maintenance (cleaning) for five years. She decided to work since what her husband was earning was not enough to cover the household expenses. This is how Estela decided to lend her husband support. Estela feels very happy since, thanks to her work, she has managed to have all her children finish their studies and become professionals. Estela’s wish is to continue constructing her home, since she is thinking of installing a shop stocked with groceries; she wants to have tranquility in her old age. With the requested loan, she will contribute to the construction of her home. She joined the “Uniendo Fuerzas” (“Uniting Forces”) communal bank, which including her is a group maD. of 7 responsible people that want to continue working with the “Prosperidad” Program. Estela is located in the first row on the left hand siD. dressed in a purple polo and a beige sweater. 

Mari Luz did not arrive in time due to reasons related to her work.

loans.use: to contribute to the construction of her home.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is married and has three children. For the past three years, he has been in the second-hand clothing business and he also makes liquid washing detergent. His monthly income is 10,000 KES. 

Ronald is requesting his first loan with KADET LTD to purchase clothing to sell and buy chemicals to make detergent. He was introduced to KADET through existing clients. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to pay school fees for his daughter who is entering secondary school. Ronald hopes to become a successful businessperson.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell and chemicals to make detergent

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
El joven Jose Félix tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Abajo de la ciudad de Nacaome, Jose esta casado con Yenni Xiomara y aun no tienen hijos, estan en planes de tenerlos.
El señor José Félix se dedica a la venta de mercaderia, su negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de buses del Amatillo, ahi vende todo tipo de productos para uso personal y tambien peliculas y cds grabados con musica.
Félix utilizara el credito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, desea surtirlo ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son mayores.
Su principal sueño es construir una casa, para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y a sus hijos que vendran en un futuro.
texts.en:
Sr. José Félix is a young man who is 27 years of age. He lives in the neighborhood of Abajo in the city of Nacaome. Jose is married to Yenni Xiomara and they have no children, but they plan to have them.

Sr. José Félix sells merchandise from his business which is located at the bus terminal in Amatillo. He sells all types of personal use products, as well as movies and music CDs. Félix will use this loan to buy merchandise for his business. He plans to restock according to the demands of his older customers.

His main wish is to build a house so that he can provide a better quality of life for his wife and any children they may have in the future.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, crèmes, talcum powders,  gels, nail polishes, earrings, lip pencils, hair clips, movie DVDs, and music CDs.

loans.name: Ter

texts.en:
Ter, 49 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province known for its ancient temples and tourism. Ter buys and resells recycled items, earning $3.50 per day. Her husband works for the government, earning $5 per day. The couple has six children: five are studying and one is a construction worker, earning $4 per day. Each month, Ter spends $80 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses.

Ter would like to request a loan of $500 to buy recycled items for resale. She can earn a good income with this job and therefore wants to extend it when she has enough money. Ter hopes to support her children to study and to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy recycled items for resale

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle lives in the barrio together with her husband and two young children. Her spouse works as 10-wheeler driver. To supplement their income, she established a retail store selling grocery items such as milk, sugar, canned goods and biscuits to the people in the barrio. She had been operating this for almost five years. 

She wants to increase her earnings so she needs to stock more items in her store. She is now asking for a loan of P15,000 in order to buy instant noodles, canned goods, beverages and soap to sell in her store.

In the future, she wants to keep making better sales and someday achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy instant noodles, canned goods, beverages and soap to sell in her store.

loans.name: Tiaina

texts.en:
Tiaina is 21 years of age and single with no children. 

Tiaina owns and operates a business venture, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Tiaina needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Tiaina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tiaina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Leta

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos um deles ja frenquenta a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Moamba para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida. É negociante ha bastante tempo e vende produtos de primeira necessidade e tem um rendimento de cerca 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, peixe, amendoim, sumos, e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 6.000.00mt e foi para o negocio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Leta was born in Moamba District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children; one of the children still goes to school. Leta finished third grade but did not continue because her parents had financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Moamba to move to Boane in search of better living conditions. Leta has been a businesswoman for quite some time and sells staple goods. She has an income of about 5,000 meticais which she uses for household expenses, and she saves some in her bank account.

Leta has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Leta's second Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy products (rice, fish, peanuts, juices and other items) to increase her inventory. The first loan was for 6,000 meticais and was for the business.

She promises to make her payments on time, and in the future she plans to expand her business. To do this, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, fish, peanuts, juices, etc.).

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has 6 dependents. Ekua sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) at Eguafo, which she has done for the past 15 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase bulk maize for the kenkey preparation. With the new profits, Ekua plans to expand her business

loans.use: purchase bulk maize for the kenkey preparation

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: La señora María Gabriela a sus 66 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. comidas rápidas y críspelas en un carro adecuado para esto. La señora María Gabriela venD. sus productos a las afueras D. los colegios. La señora María Gabriela desea comprar insumos para su negocio tales como panes, harina, carnes, salsas, maíz, entre otros, que le permitan tener abastecimiento D. materia prima con el fin D. no preocuparse por falta D. esta cuando las ventas son muy malas. Con lo anterior, la señora María Gabriela podrá aumentar sus ingresos y D. esta manera mejorar su calidad D. vida, la cual es delicada debido a los problemas D. salud que ella tiene. A futuro, la señora María Gabriela sueña con tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
María Gabriela is 66 years old. She sells fast food and popcorn in a car maD. for this. María Gabriela sells her products outsiD. schools. 

María Gabriela wants to buy supplies for her business such as bread, flour, meat, sauces, corn, and other items that would enable her to stock the basic items so as to not be worried about not having them whenever sales are very low. With this in mind, María Gabriela could increase her income and in this way better her quality of life, which is fragile due to the health problems she has.

In the future, María Gabriela dreams of having her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Nekuye B W G Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nekuye B W Group in Western Kenya! Judith is the facilitator of the Nekuye B W group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Judith takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Judith had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Judith was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Judith and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Judith will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nekuye B W group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Judith with her group members and the field officer who is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Essineta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Inhambane, de 49 anos, fez o ensino médio. E viuva Vive na casa própria com sua familia. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive em Inhambane.
Trabalha na Educação como Assistente Técnica ha mais de 14 anos auferindo mensalmente um valor que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Para alêm do seu ordenado tem uma pensão de viúvez e consegue  poupar 500.00mt mensalmente. Não tem empregados e conta com ajuda dos seus filhos.
Este é o seu quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar materiais de construcao ( areia , blocos, cimento e outros). Os anteriores de (3.500, 8.000.00, 7.000.00 e 5.000.00)mt todos foram para habitação excepto o segundo que foi para compra de um congelador. Futuramente pretende construir dependências de aluguer para garantir a sua reforma.
texts.en:
Essineta was born in the province of Inhambane. She is 49 years old and finished high school. She is a widow. She lives in her own home with her family. She also supports her mother, who lives in Inhambane.
She has worked in education as a technical assistant for more than 14 years, and uses her monthly salary to cover household expenses. Besides her salary, she also receives a widow's pension and is able to save 500 meticals a month. She doesn't have employees, but she can count on her children for help.
This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.). She used her previous loans (for 3500, 8000, 7000, and 5000 mt) to build her house, except for the second loan, which she used to buy a freezer. In the future, she'd like to build rental units to ensure her income.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cinder blocks, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Francisca quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas gustosas acepatron, ya que vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa. 
La sra. Franciscsa, es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas en general para damas, niños, caballeros. Esta Casada hace 22 años con el señor Anastacio  quien se dedica a la sastreria,  tienen cinco hijo estudiantes cuatro mayores de edad y uno menor en la primaria. Ella comenta que su sueño es poder tener un negocio grande donde ofrecer las prendas que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas para damas, caballeros y niños, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The contact who started the present committee was Señora Francisca,  who invited and organized her friends to form part of the Enterprising Women Committee program.  They pleasantly accepted, since they saw a great opportunity for progress in the program.  
Señora Franciscsa is the president of the group.  She is dedicated to the sale of clothes in general for ladies, children and gentlemen.  She married Señor Anastacio 22 years ago.  He is a tailor.  They have five sons who are students,  four of legal age and one younger in grade school.  She tells us that their dream is to be able to have a large business where they can offer the garments that she sells.  She requests the loan to purchase garments for ladies, gentlemen and children, with which she will be able  to be supplied and to have more variety to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy garments for ladies, gentlemen and children for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe wants a loan to buy more beans, millet and simsim to sell. She is a 47-year-old, widowed woman with six children living in Masindi, Uganda. She started by making local beer that she would produce on a small scale. After acquiring enough earnings, she ventured into the produce business. Her desire is to build a permanent house and move her business to a more permanent location despite challenges in limited capital.

loans.use: buy beans, millet and simsim for sale

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is 27 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is single and has two children between one and four years old. They live at home and the children attend school. For the past ten years she has been selling used clothes. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Suad

texts.en: Suad is a 22 year old woman from Jubeiha, Amman Jordan who supports one family member and owns a beauty salon. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to repaint the inside of her salon and decorate it. In the future she hopes that her family will take a part in developing her salon. Since Suad is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to her beauty salon

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is an optimistic, intelligent and working woman, she is 54 years old, and living in Tampico, Tamaulipas, she is married and has two children, her husband is a construction worker with a variable income, for that reason they could not cover all the family expenses .

Long time ago she decided to start a small business, cooking Mexican food as tamales, gorditas, taquitos and more selling them between her neighbors. Years later, she learned to cook a special kind of cookies and now she complements her family income with the Stanhome products sales.

Vicenta is requesting $650 USD to buy raw materials to produce her cookies and by other hand she wants buy merchandise to offer to her clients for the next Christmas season. She knows her sales are going to increase in December. She going to repay in a term of 5-10 months.

\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"
