Vicenta tiene 54 años, se considera una persona optimista, inteligente y trabajadora, vive en Tampico Tamaulipas y ella esta casada y tienen dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como albañil en la construcción por lo que tiene un ingreso variable y por esta razón no alcanza a cubrir todos los gastos familiares.

Hace mucho tiempo ella se decidió a iniciar un pequeño negocio, cocinando comida mexicana como tamales, gorditas, taquitos, etc. vendiéndola entre sus de donde vive. Años después ella aprendió a cocinar unas galletas especiales y ahora ella complementa el ingreso familiar con la venta también de productos Stanhome.

Vicenta requiere de $650 DLLS para la compra de materia prima y poder producir esas ricas galletas, además quiere surtir los productos Stanhome para su venta para la próxima temporada navideña. Ella esta consciente de que sus ventas se van a incrementar en Diciembre. Ella piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 5-10 meses.

loans.use: to buy raw material and home products

loans.name: Natia

texts.en: Natia S. is a 48 year old mother of 3 who won an award as one of the best business woman in the year 2006.  Natia’s business was a canteen shop at one of the schools and some of her goods she sells are sandwiches, hot dogs, pork cakes, pancakes and buns with coconut cream. Natia’s thanks goes out to the teaching of her church LDS that she was able to learn how to make the best goods in healthy ways that made her business the best selection for her customers. With her requested loan, Natia aims to start a cattle farm business, to use up their unused 12 acres of land. She’ll also still be running her canteen business.

loans.use: To buy 4 cattle

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo sells children clothes at the trading center Nuri Khujand, located in the center of Khujand. She brings her goods from wholesale market in Istaravshan as well as from wholesale traders who bring their goods from China. Her parents help her in the business by trading the clothes in her place while she is away acquiring new goods. Mostly her clothing items are for infants and kids up to 6-7 years old. She would like a loan to buy clothes for the upcoming warm season. In the future she would like to expand her business by adding children’s shoes.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing items

loans.name: Vung

texts.en:
Mr Vung P. is a widower of 46. He is a construction foreman and earns US$ 2.50 a day. He has 5 children. Three of them are still students. 
Mr. Vung P. needs tools such as an electric saw to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Srey Mauch

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Srey Mauch was married in 1997 and has 2 children. Since 1995, she ihas been in the business of weaving scarves by using semi-automatic machines at home . She learned from her old generation. She currently owns one machine and now wishes to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her business in scarf production. Her husband is a chief cook of wedding ceremonies in the Kean Svay district.

She is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1,200. She will use the loan to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her scarf production and to buy one motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: Purchasing one more scarf semi-automatic machine and one motorbike.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi A. is 40 years old and lives in the village of Atsèti in the Vo prefecture. She is married with five children. A devoted mother, she manages the household thanks to a small business selling rice. In fact, she cooks the rice and sells it on the street. The business makes her tired but it is very profitable. She has a lot of confidence and wants to build a shed in which to do the cooking and vary her menu. In addition, she needs to stock up on grocery items in order to satisfy her customers. To do this, she is asking for a loan of $600. This will enable her to improve her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Afi est âgée de 40 ans et vit dans le village d’Atsèti dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Très dévouée, elle participe à la gestion de son ménage grâce à son petit commerce de riz. En effet, elle prépare du riz qu’elle vend à la sauvette. C’est une activité qui la fatigue mais très rentable.Confiante, elle a voulu construire un hangar sous lequel elle fera sa restauration et diversifier son menu. Outre cette construction, elle doit faire un ravitaillement en produits alimentaires afin de pouvoir rassurer sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $600. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu.

loans.use: To build a shed and stock up on grocery items

loans.name: Adesuwa

texts.en: Miss. Adesuwa A. is 28 years old.  She is single and lives in Benin City.  She sells beauty products.  She trained in the business for 6 months and started her own in 2002.  She is requesting a loan to buy more stock for sale.  She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more products for sale

loans.name: Sofía Guadalupe

texts.es:
I have been selling clothes and home products throughout different areas in the city of Nuevo Laredo for 4 years. This business, in which my husband and I work, is my family’s sole source of income. We wish to invest in buying toys for the holiday season without losing profits. We are requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy new toys.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 4 años en la venta de ropa y artículos para el hogar en diferentes partes de la Ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia.En el negocio trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Queremos invertir en juguetes para esta temporada de navidad sin tener que descapitalizarnos. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de juguetes nuevos.

loans.use: Purchase of new toys

loans.name: Xiomara Argentina

texts.es:
Xiomara M. is a hardworking woman that has been devoted to food sales at home, in the city of León, for the past 10 years. She is married and mother of two children, who are her dependents.

She started her business when, as a homemaker, she noticed the needs of her family and the inadequacy of her husband's income to cover the household expenses. She thus decided to invest her savings (100 dollars) in the purchase of ingredients for food production.

She has requested loans to Ceprodel, which have been beneficial for the refurbishing of her store. She needed to invest in the purchase of plastic chairs and a table, so that her clients could enjoy their meals there.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Xiomara M. es una dama muy esforzada que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de comida en su hogar de habitación en León. Es madre casada y con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad.

Su negocio nace cuando se dedicaba a la labor de ama de casa. Al ver la necesidad de su familia y que los ingresos de su esposo no cubrían con los gastos del hogar, decide invertir sus ahorros (100 dólares) en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos.

Hoy en día ha solicitado créditos a Ceprodel, que le han beneficiado para la remodelación de su local, ya que era necesario que invirtiera en la compra de sillas plásticas y una mesa plástica para ubicarlas en su local, para que los clientes puedan disfrutar sus alimentos allí.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food elaboration.

loans.name: Neema's Subira Group

texts.en: Neema is 24 years old. She is married with two children, ages six and eight years old. She and her husband also take care of another child who is 17. Neema owns a small poultry store and also sells clothing. She started her business in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7:15 am to 6:30 pm. She can earn a monthly profit of about $50.00 from her sales. She would like a loan to buy more poultry and clothing to sell in her business. She will share this loan with subgroup member Janeth. Neema and Janeth belong to the loan group Subira, whose members ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more poultry and clothing to sell

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Mr. Meth M. lives in the village of Boeng Ka Erk in Kandal province and he is 32 years old. He is married with a child. His wife, Mrs. Sokheourn Soun, is a garment factory worker who can generate an income of around $2.50 a day.

Mr. Meth collects and resells recyclable products. He travels from one local village to another to buy waste, such as empty cans, bottles, and plastics. He resells the recyclables to a middle man for a small profit. . Mr. Meth intends to buy more recyclables to improve his business. He needs to apply for a loan in order to buy them. (His wife is in the picture instead of Mr. Meth M.).

loans.use: To buy more recyclables.

loans.name: Ariel Erasmo

texts.es:
Mr. Erasmo lives in the neighborhood of Cristo el Rosario. He is 49 years old, married, and has three children, aged 13, 12, and 4. His business is a general store that he started up with his own money after selling land he owned in the city of Boaco; his wife works in the store as a shopkeeper.

Mr. Erasmo has already been in business for four years, and the loan he is requesting would go toward supplying the store with all of the products needed for the Mother’s Day holiday season; his work as a mechanic provides a supplementary source of income. In the future he would like to set up a business as a wholesaler, doing the most that he can to help his children and improve their future.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Erasmo habita en barrio Cristo el Rosario, tiene 49 años de edad es casado y le tienen tres hijos de 13, 12, y 4 años de edad. Su esposa es comerciante y trabaja en el negocio .su negocio es una pulpería el cual comenzó con dinero propio cuando vendió un terreno que tenia en la ciudad de Boaco.

Su experiencia es ya de cuatro años y el préstamo que solicita es para surtir la pulpería con todos los productos de día festivo de la temporada de las madres, también tiene otros ingresos provenientes de mecánica. En un futuro desea establecerlo como una distribuidora, preparar al máximo a sus hijos, consolidar su futuro.

loans.use: Purchasing products for his business

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia is a married mother of an eight-year-old son. She started the business in order to help her husband with the family expenses because he was unemployed at the time. Before that, she had started helping someone sell clothing, which is why she decided to start her own business 5 years ago by purchasing a bundle of clothing. She later started making trips to Chinconcuac, in the state of Mexico, where she can obtain clothing at a cheap price.

She needs a loan of $525.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise because her sales have increased and she needs to offer more variety. With your help, her business will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ofelia es casada y tiene un hijo de 8 años. Inicio el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar ya que su esposo había quedado desempleado y antes de eso había empezado a ayudarle a un persona a vender ropa por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace 5 años comprando una paca de ropa, después empezó a irse en viajes a Chinconcuac, en el estado de México, donde puede conseguir ropa nueva mas barata.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $525 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía ya que sus ventas se han incrementado y requiere tener mas variedad. Con tu ayuda su negocio seguirá prosperando

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (apparel)

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Unemployed for a long time, the women in the Bok Jom group used their first UIMCEC loan of 250,000 CFA francs to start up a small business of selling various products, ranging from cosmetics to fish to fruits and vegetables. The success of their initial endeavor has led them to request another loan of 500,000 CFA francs to build up their business. They are all mothers who have experience in their respective fields. This second loan will allow them to build up working capital.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Longtemps au chomage, les femmes du groupe Bok Jom ont avec un premier pret de 250 000 f CFA obtenu de l'UIMCEC démarré une activité de petit commerce de divers prodiuts allant des prodiuts cosmétiques aux poissons en passant par les fruits et légumes. Le succes qu'a connu cette premiere opération leur a permis de solliciter un pret de 500.000 f CFA afin de renforcer leurs activités. Elles sont toutes meres de famille et ont une bonne experience dans le domaine d'activités respectives. Ce second credit leur permettra de renforcer leur fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Greetings from Gisenyi, Rwanda! Pascasie is 52 years old, married with 10 children and 6 adopted orphans from the 1994 Genocide in Rwanda.

She operates her small shop selling various home consumption items like cassava flour, maize flour, soap, salt, beans, paraffin, match boxes, etc. She earns about $ 60 every month. Through the profit from her business, Pascasie has been able to renovate her house. She employs 5 people in her business. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more stock for her business.

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 50 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells fruit in her community. She has been in this business since 2001. She needs the loan of $550 to buy more fruit for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale

loans.name: Maryam's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Maryam is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 2, 4, and 3. She also takes care of 2 other children, ages 6 and 8. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Maryam is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling snacks, mats, and clothes.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Saber

texts.en:
This is Saber. He is 35 years old, married, but he still doesn't have any children and he is still a student in the university. He is studying engineering; this is his last year of studying. He lives with his family in Shewa Nangarhar province. He is a very intelligent young man.

Saber has a one brother and two sisters. They live in his village but his house is small and he wants to build some rooms onto his house because his brother wants to get married. There is no room for him, therefore he has decided to request a 50,000AF (US$ 1,075) individual loan so he can solve his problems.

So he thought a lot. Finally, he requested a Kiva loan that changes lives. He wants Kiva lenders to give him an individual loan for 24 months. With this money he will buy materials to build an all-purpose room and a bathroom. He says many thanks in advance.

loans.use: buying materials for construction

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
En el mercado La Estación de la ciudad de León la señora Maura P. se destaca por ser una excelente cocinera ya que desde hace siete años se ha dedicado al negocio de elaboración y venta de comida.

A pesar que es madre soltera de cuatro hijos ha seguido esforzándose por mejorar su condición económica y es por eso que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos los cuales le sirvan para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar dichos alimentos. Es por esta razón que ella hoy en día un vez mas espera que su petición le sea otorgada y de esta forma adquirir el crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima y continuar destacándose como una excelente cocinera en el mercado de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
On “La Estación” market in the city of León, Maura P. is well known for being an excellent cook. She’s been working on the food making and selling business for seven years. Even though she is a single mother with four children, she makes the best effort to improve her household economy and for that reason she seeks for support from Ceprodel to obtain loans to buy raw material to prepare her famous food. She hopes she will receive another loan to buy more raw material, so people at the market of the city of León could still see her as an excellent cook.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food raw material

loans.name: Luciano Antonio

texts.es: El señor Luciano Antonio Martínez, tiene la edad de 66 años,  habita en el barrio reparto chic ubicado en la cuidad  de Managua, junto a su esposa y hijos, este señor tiene un pequeña finca ubicado en los ríos en el municipio de Ticuantepe el cual con mucho esfuerzos ha logrado establecer cultivos, la mayor parte del tiempo pasa en su finca ya que esta pendiente de cada cosa que pueda ocurrir ; la esposa le apoya en la casa , don Luciano tiene a su cargo dos niñas las cuales estudian , los hijos mayores de don Luciano le ayudan con los gastos del hogar , los planes de él es mejorar las condiciones de vida para brindarle un futuro mejor , Don Luciano desde hace veinte años se dedica a la agricultura , con la solicitud del préstamo va  a comprar fertilizantes para poder aplicárselo al producción de piña, y así vender una buena producción a mayor costo
texts.en:
Mr. Luciano Antonio Martínez is 66 years old and lives in the Reparto Chic neighborhood, located in the city of Managua, with his wife and children. He has a small farm, which he has managed to cultivate after much effort, located near the rivers of the municipality of Ticuantepe. He spends the majority of his time on his farm because he is keeping watch over anything that may happen. His wife supports him in their household. Mr. Luciano has two school age daughters under his care. His older children help him with the household expenses. He plans on improving his family’s living conditions so that he can offer them a better future. Mr. Luciano has been working in agriculture for 20 years. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizers to use on his pineapple crops so that he can sell more produce at a higher cost.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his crops

loans.name: Hortense

texts.fr: K. Hortense s’est mariée avec SOSSA Paul. Elle est née le 3 février 1963 et ils ont un enfant scolarisé de 15 ans. Elle a commencé son activité avec le charbon il y a trois ans. Actuellement, elle fait le stockage de charbon et les vivres comme le riz, le mais, les haricots, et la farine. En ce moment elle a vu les difficultés de vente. Heureusement avec ses autres crédits de Kiva, elle a pu mettre l’argent a coté, et dans le futur elle pense a acheter une parcelle. Au lieu d’acheter au Marché Tokpa, elle voudrait acheter les produits qui sont moins chers au village.
texts.en:
Ms. Hortense K. was born on February 3, 1963 and is married to Paul SOSSA. They have a 15-year-old in school. She started her charcoal business three years ago and now stocks charcoal and staples, such as rice, corn, beans, and flour. These days, she has seen difficulties in sales. With her other Kiva loans, she was fortunately able to put aside some money. Instead of buying goods at the Tokpa Market, she would like to buy goods that are less expensive in town. And in the future, she is thinking about buying a parcel of land.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple foods

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en: Mr. Sam Ol L. is a villager in Trapaing Trapaing village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Veak Sophorn, is a successful duck and pig breeder. Because the breeding business is going well, Mr. Sam Ol L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducklings, piglets, and pig feed. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is 33 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture to his right.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings, piglets, and pig feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. ELIZABETH V., es nuestra socia, Ella es natural de la comunidad de Urquillos en la provincia de Calca, está zona comprende el valle sagrado de los inkas; ella tiene 40 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18, 9 años, por lo que ella aún trabaja duro para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, el mayor esta en la universidad estudiando la carrera profesional de Agronomía, por lo que requiere mayor inversión.

La socia ELIZABETH, tiene como actividad principal la crianza de animales menores como los cuyes y la aves de corral, ella compra animales, los hace madurar y los vende a un mejor precio, también vende huevos y algunas verduras que ella misma cosecha en su pequeño huerto junto a sus casita; su esposo está dedicado a la agricultura, el vende papas al por mayor en los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, de este modo pueden seguir apoyando a sus hijos en su formación profesional.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y promete devolver el monto otorgado dentro de los plazos y términos estipulados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth V. is native to the community of Urquillos in the province of Calca, which includes the Sacred Valley of the Incas. Elizabeth is 40 years old and has three children, aged 20, 18 and 9. She works hard to provide for them and contribute to their studies. Her oldest child is in university studying agronomy, which is rather expensive. Elizabeth primarily raises small animals like poultry and guinea pigs. She buys animals, rears them and later sells them for a better price. She also sells eggs and vegetables that she grows in a little garden by her home. Elizabeth's husband focuses on agriculture; he sells potatoes wholesale in the markets of Cusco, which also allows them to continue supporting their children while they go through school. Elizabeth appreciates this loan, and she has promised to repay it within the specified time period.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.fr: Mme Comfort D. est née le 04 Janvier 1960 à Agbétiko dans le Bas Mono au sud du Togo. Veuve depuis quelques années, elle est seule à s’occuper de ses sept (07) enfants grâce à la vente des boules d’Akassa appelées  «Akpan». C’est une pâte à base de mais très appréciée. Actuellement Mme D. est confrontée à une mévente qui ralenti son chiffre d’affaires. Elle sollicite un financement pour rentabiliser son commerce par le stockage du mais et la construction d’un hangar sous lequel elle va vendre. Les profits tirés de son commerce lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Comfort D. was born on January 4, 1960 in Agbétiko, Bas Mono, in the south of Togo. A widow for some years now, she is raising her 7 children alone, supporting the family thanks to the sale of "akassa" balls called "Akpan". They are made of maize porridge and are much appreciated in her area. Presently, Mrs. D. is plagued by a lack of raw materials that is causing her sales to drop. She is requesting a loan to make her little business viable by stocking up on maize and building a shed that she can sell out of. The profit from her business allows her to improve her family's living conditions and ensure that her children will be educated.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking up on maize and building a shed

loans.name: Faalele

texts.en: Faalele T., 28, is married with three children. She has five years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public four days per week. Faalele has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 tala. SPBD loans are Faalele’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of this loan will be used by Faalele to make improvements around their home.

loans.use: To purchase knives, fertilizers, chemicals, timber, and iron

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio cultivates their 1.5-hectare rice and vegetable farm in their village; they harvest it twice a year.  According to him, he can earn a net income of PHP 15,000 every harvest.  He would like to increase his income and for this, he would like to borrow PHP 13,000 to purchase farm inputs they need and to avoid asking for credit from capitalists.  Some of the things he will purchase are fertilizer and a variety of vegetable seeds. He hopes that with his patience and sacrifices, he can increase his yield. "There is a reward ahead if there is patience”, Emilio added. 

Emilio is a simple farmer from Barangay Bangar Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. His wife is Erlinda and they were blessed with two children, both students.  They want to give them a better future by giving them the best education and for this, they have to work hard to achieve their goals.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Juan Antonio López Ríos tiene la edad de 27 años , habita en el barrio Los Ríos en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a sus padres , los cuales están a su cargo , el es soltero , no tiene hijos aun , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder terminar de construir su casa , desde hace 12 años , se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , junto al apoyo de su papá , durante este tiempo la mayor parte que le ha afectado es la falta de financiamiento y el precio de la piña que por temporadas baja su precio. Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Antonio L. R. is 27 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los R. in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his parents who are in his care. He is single and does not have children yet. His plans for his family are to be able to improve their living conditions and to be able to finish the construction of their house.

For 12 years he has worked as a farmer together with the support of his father. During this time the main thing that has affected him is the lack of financing and the price of pineapple which is seasonally low. With this loan he is going to purchase fertilizers and products for cultivation in order to have a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products and fertilizers to improve the harvest

loans.name: Maria Asunción

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Asunción D. is 56 years old and she has lived in San Ignacio for more than 25 years. She is married with two older children that are working professionals. Her spouse owns a truck which he uses as a taxi, in order to contribute to the family income.

Maria is the owner of "Casa Rodi," which has been open for more than 15 years. She is in charge of running the business, where she sells different clothing items and shoes such as t-shirts, jeans, sandals, sneakers, coats, and so on, for both children and adults. She has a high level of sales due to a good amount of attention the store brings and good prices.

She will use this loan to buy coats, pullovers, shirts and pants for the fall and winter seasons.

loans.use: To buy autumn jackets and pullovers.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim C.. Ibrahim sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been a businessman for over 15 years now. He has decided to apply for a loan in order to boost up his business. His business has been growing at a very slow pace, but with a loan he is sure to make more profit, expand his business and improve on his standard of living. This will be the first loan this entrepreneur is accessing from SMT/Kiva. He is requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000.

Ibrahim is age 50 and was born in Magburaka town, about 22 miles from Makeni City. He is married with five children. One of his children is in college and the rest are in secondary schools.

loans.use: To invest in clothing business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos  vive en el manzano “D” de la zona  Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es casado, vive junto a su esposa, la cual es ama de casa y sus pequeños hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
Trabajo como costurero en una pequeña fabrica de chompas, ubicada en la zona de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de material de construcción (estuco, pintura, arena) y con ello realizar arreglos en la habitación de sus hijos, que por motivos de asentamiento de terreno sufrió varias rajaduras
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives on block “D” in the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto. He is married. He lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and his two small school- aged children. He works as a sewer in a small sweater factory, which is located in the El Alto zone. The loan is to buy construction material (stucco, paint, sand) in order to fix his children’s room. The settling of the ground has caused various cracks. This is his first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation shows that he is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, stucco, and paint to refurbish his children's room

loans.name: Thioro

texts.fr: Thioro est une femme mariée de 53 ans qui s’active dans la plantation  et le commerce de bananes. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter du de l’engrais, de la paille, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le fonçage, les frais d’arrosage et de faire face à tous les frais pour la production et vente de banane.
texts.en:
Thioro is a married women of 53 who is active in planting and in the commerce of bananas. She wants to bolster her business. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy some fertilizer and straw and to pay for the labor for drilling, as well as for the costs of irrigation and those of producing and selling bananas.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting and the banana business

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Natalia es socia, del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estado civil soltera sin hijos y tiene estudios superiores, vive en el Jr. Atahualpa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 06 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas al por mayor, también nos cuenta que esta iniciando un negocio de farmacia.

Su sueño es agrandar y llenar su farmacia.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros además la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Natalia is a member of the Communal Bank “3 de Mayo II”, which is located in the district of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 49 years old, single, and does not have children. Sra. Natalia completed her high school education. She lives in Jr. Atahualpa.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for nearly 6 years. With her initial loan of 300 soles, she purchased groceries.

At the moment, Sra. Natalia is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase soft drinks wholesale. She also indicated that she is opening a pharmacy.

She hopes to enlarge and stock her pharmacy. Sra. Natalia enjoys her savings, her group meetings, as well as being punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo B. is 50 years old and a fisherman; at the same time he is a seaweed grower in Trinidad Bohol. He has six children and a very supportive wife who also helps him manage their fish and seaweed businesses.

He is requesting a loan of Php 20,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy fish to resell and seaweed seedlings to grow his farm and income.

He said that CEVI is comparably the best because they just charge a small interest rate of 2% a month.

loans.use: seaweed seedlings and fish

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery  es una mujer trabajadora  y entusiasta, ella tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y tienen dos hijos mayores de edad. Ella vende comida por las noches, en la vereda de su casa, la ayuda en esta actividad una de sus hijas. Su esposo la apoya siempre, él  es empleado de una agencia postal. Mery pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la implementación de su negocio, compró algunos insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus alimentos.
Con este préstamo de 1000, comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite; también comprará otra mesa para atender a su público. La meta de Mery es tener una tienda  de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mery is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband. They have two grown children. Mery sells food at night on the sidewalk in front of her house, and her daughter helps her. Her husband always supports her – he works at a postal agency. Mery has belonged to the “Las Heroínas” community bank for the past two years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in the implementation of her business. She bought supplies to make her foods.

With this loan of 1000 PEN, Mery will purchase rice, sugar, pasta, and oil. She will also buy another table to wait on the customers. Mery’s goal is to have a household goods store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, oil, and another table

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the quality and range of her products

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es comerciante y se dedica a la compra y venta de carbón, el cual distribuye en los mercados y las churrasquerías de la ciudad de La Paz. Su esposa le ayuda en la comercialización del carbón ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que sostiene la canasta familiar.
Vive en la zona de Llojeta Bajo de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de carbón y pago de transporte, para la compra y distribución)
Es tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, es un cliente con calificación 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a businessman and works in the buying and selling of charcoal, which he distributes in the markets and barbecue stalls. His wife helps him in the selling of the charcoal since this is the only source of income for the family. They live in the Llojeta Bajo zone of the city of La Paz, in their own home. The loan will provide them working capital ( purchase of charcoal and payment of transportation costs for the purchases and distribution). This is his third request for a loan from Impro. He is a customer with qualification #1, which means he has a good payment record of his installments.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and payment of transportation costs for his business of selling bagged charcoal.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Armando F. nasceu em Massinga na província de Inhambane a sul de Moçambique, tem 48 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 15 e 17 anos de idade. Fez 4ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras, vive na casa própria em Boane e para alem dos filhos sustenta também a mãe e seus irmãos enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Saiu de Massinga para Maputo quando tinha 33 anos de idade transferido pelos serviços para trabalhar em Boane onde se encontra a residir com a sua família.
Trabalhou como tractorista na Empresa Estatal em Boane e em 2005 decidiu trabalhar por conta própria e mais tarde adquiriu um camião com o qual presta serviços de carregamento de areia, cimento pedra e outros bens. Faz 08 horas diárias e não tem empregado apenas contracta algumas pessoas em cada carregamento. O seu rendimento mensal varia de 14.000,00mt a 16.000,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e poupa algum para investir na manutenção da viatura e na sua obra.

Este e o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca tinha trabalhado com nenhuma outra instituição financeira. Conheceu a Hluvuku através do seu primo que também e cliente da instituição tendo aproximado e solicita o presente empréstimo no valor de 20.000,00mt para compra de material de construção (cimento, ferros, chapas de zinco e blocos) com intuito de dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo sem para poder aceder a outros financiamentos para construir uma mercearia e ferragem e iniciar com actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Armando F. was born in Massinga in the province of Inhambane in the south of Mozambique. He is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children ages 15 and 17. He attended school until 4th grade, but dropped out due to a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home in Boane, and besides his two children he also supports his mother and siblings, sending them money monthly. He left Massinga for Maputo when he was 33 years old due to a job transfer and moved to Boane, where he currently lives with his family. He worked as a tractor operator for the State in Boane, and in 2005 he decided to work for himself. He later acquired a truck that he uses to provide services hauling sand, cement block, and other goods. He works 8 hours a day and does not have any employees. He contracts people for each load. His monthly earnings vary between 14.000,00 MT and 16.000,00MT per month, which he uses to support his family, and to save for maintenance on his vehicle and his construction project. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and he has never worked with any other financial institution. He learned about Hluvuku through his cousin who is also a client of the bank. He is requesting a long for 20.000,00MT to purchase construction material (cement, iron, zinc panels, and blocks) to continue construction on his home. He is committed to paying back the loan without any problems so that he can have access to future loans to build a locale where he can open a hardware store.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, etc. )

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for plowing and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Baby Consolacion

texts.en:
Baby Consolacion D. V., from the village of Divisoria, is 44 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Baby Consolacion owns and operates a recycling business whose income derives primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Engaged in her business for a year, she earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Baby Consolacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 10000 PHP, her fourth, to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients consists mainly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida B. is from the village of Dolipos. She is 57 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Florida owns and operates a business selling soft drinks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Florida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Florida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 18th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Attallah

texts.en:
Attallah is a 43-year-old married man with three children. He is a courageous man who fights to provide for the needs of his family. He works as a construction worker, specialized in floor tiles.

Today, he is requesting a loan of US$ 3000 in order to buy a floor tile polisher .

loans.use: To buy a floor tile polisher

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian L. is from the village of Guinsiliban in the Camiguin province. She is 38 years old. Lilian is married and has three school-aged children. To earn a living, Lilian owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconuts in the local community. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lilian from HSPFI. Lilian successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. Her first loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Viccia Ester

texts.es:
Viccia Merchán de 56 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es chofer de un colectivo, con el tiene 3 hijos de 25, 26, 28 años.

Viccia empezó con un puesto de chifles y caramelos afuera de su casa, poco a poco con los ingresos que obtuvo implemento más productos.

Ahora Viccia tiene en su casa tiene su propia tienda, trabaja todos los días desde las 05h00 hasta el anochecer vendiendo azúcar a $0.28 la libra, arroz a $0.35 la libra, aceites a $1.25, bebidas etc. Una de las frecuentes complicaciones que ella tiene son los borrachos de su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, legumbres, arroz para tener más productos para su tienda. En el futuro quiere agrandar el local.
texts.en:
Viccia M., 56, lives on the outskirts of the Ecuadorean city of Guayaquil, in a house with all basic services. Her husband drives a bus and they have 3 children, 25-, 26-, and 28-years old. Viccia started out with a stall, outside her house, selling candy and snacks and, over time, she used the money that she earned to add new products. She now has a store, in her house, where she works every day from 5:00 in the morning to late in the evening. She sells sugar for $0.28 a pound; rice for $0.35 a pound; cooking oil for $1.25, bottled drinks, etc. One of the regular obstacles that she faces is the many drunks in the neighborhood. With the loan, she will buy bottled drinks, vegetables and rice so that she will have more products to sell. In the future, she wants to expand the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Ema Lorenda

texts.en:
Ma. Ema Lorenda J. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Ma. Ema Lorenda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Ema Lorenda owns & operates a business venture providing motorcycle services to local community members (this motorcycle business is done/managed by her husband). Ma. Ema Lorenda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Ema Lorenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Ema Lorenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Ma. Ema Lorenda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ma. Ema Lorenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mr. Ry K. is a 30-year-old clothing merchant. He also leaves home to sell clothing in bulk for a few days or a week in provinces around Cambodia. This action is the main point of making a profit in order to help be responsible for his family. 

Ry K. is married with two school-aged kids, who are dependent on their parents. His wife weaves cotton hats and sells them in bulk to middlemen who then take them to resell at the market. 

Ry K. is running his clothing enterprise very well. Recently he got purchase orders from his customers but his products are not adequate to serve them, so he is applying for a loan to buy clothes in order to satisfy his customer’s needs. (Ry K. was not available on that day so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy clothes in order to satisfy his customers' needs

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Selling fruit and vegetables is the main activity of Mrs. Asuncion D., 50 years of age, who is married to Mr. Bartolome D., a resident of Baluc, Tangub City. They are blessed with five kids, now mostly adults.

Asuncion started this banana and vegetables business ten years ago to help her husband in supporting their family. Now she earns an average net income of not less than P4,000 a month. Her husband is presently cultivating a little parcel of farmland and also doing some trading in pigs, goats, chickens and other farm animals.

As a good member and an active center chief of Paglaum MPC under its PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program, Asuncion is given the privilege of obtaining her 4th loan of P14,900. The proceeds of this loan will be used to add to the capital of her existing business and the income will be used for their daily needs and loan repayment.

Asuncion is very thankful to PMPC for the trust given to her and also she is enjoying the other products and services offered to its members.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Basilia

texts.fr: Née en 1967 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique, G. Basilia vit depuis environs 22 ans à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à VIGNIGBE Sévérin, un chauffeur, Basilia est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Basilia est secondée par son mari pour assurer les dépenses familiales. En effet, pour contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants, Basilia exerce comme activité, la vente de maïs, soja et mil dans sa boutique située non loin de son domicile. Basilia effectue ses achats au marché de Bembèrèkè, dans le nord du Bénin. Basilia n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais exerce depuis fort longtemps son activité. Basilia a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité afin d’accroître ses revenus pour s’acquérir une parcelle, Basilia sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Allada in Benin's Atlantique department, Basilia G. has spent the last 22 years living in Agla, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Basilia is married to Sévérin Vignigbe, a chauffeur, and she has four children, all of whom attend school. The couple live together with their children. Basilia's husband helps her out with the family expenses. To contribute towards her children's school fees, Basilia sells corn, soya beans and millet in a store near her home. She buys her goods in the market at Bembèrèkè in the north of Benin. Basilia did not attend school, but has been conducting her business activity for a long time. She has already had one loan from ALIDé, which she has fully repaid. Basilia is now requesting a second loan from ALIDé with the intention of strengthening her business in order to increase her revenue and buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, soya beans and millet.

loans.name: Gnogodeme Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf femmes du groupe Gnogondeme sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames  à Siekourani un village de la sous préfecture de LOULOUNI   région de Sikasso 3 e région du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’accroitre leur chiffre d’affaire. 
Ce groupe de femme exerce le commerce de pagnes, de condiments alimentaires et de céréales telle le riz   avec Mawa O. 
Mawa O. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  3 sacs de 50 kg de riz . Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Loulouni et dans les foires des villages voisins. 
Le riz est revendu en détail au marché de Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The nine women of the Gnogondeme group are all married, average 39 years of age and have an average of four children. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Siekourani, a village in the sub-prefecture of LOULOUNI, in the region of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are taking out their third loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of increasing their turnover. This group of women trade in "pagnes" (colourful West African fabric), condiments and, in the case of Mawa O., cereals such as rice. Mawa O. is planning to buy three 50kg bags of rice with her loan. She gets her supplies at the market in Loulouni and in fairs in neighboring villages. The rice is resold on a retail basis at the market in Loulouni, to a customer base made of men and women, for cash. She envisages making an average monthly profit of 7,000FCFA, of which part will be saved for social purposes and the rest invested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Claire Eileen

texts.en:
Claire Eileen B. is from the town of Talibon. She is 27 years old, married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Claire Eileen owns and operates a fishing business. She makes "panggals", fishing baskets which her husband uses to catch fish. She also sells these baskets to other fishermen. She sells her husband's catch in the market. She has been engaged in this business for over two years now.

In 2008, Claire Eileen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Claire Eileen is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan which she has taken out from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 49 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace varios años que posee una carpintería donde  realiza todo tipo de muebles y mangos a base de madera, para instrumentos de trabajo, como: picos y palas, que son muy utilizados por los agricultores. En épocas anteriores la venta de estos elementos no tenía mucha demanda por lo que decreció su negocio, es así que empezó con el diseño de muebles que sean económicos y durables, que sean de fácil salida por los clientes. Es por ello que en adelante espera crecer su negocio e implementar con mejores equipo e instrumentos su taller. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de madera al por mayor.
texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and shares her life with her husband. Together they live in their own home. For several years, Elena has owned a carpentry workshop where she makes all types of furniture as well as handles for work implements such as picks and shovels, the tools frequently used by farmers. Previously there was not much demand for these items, so her business slowed down. Elena decided to start designing furniture that was durable and affordable so that they can be easily sold to customers. For this reason, she hopes to grow her business and acquire better equipment and tools for her workshop.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Elena is confident that she will be responsible with her payments, since she considers the loan to be useful in advancing her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of wood in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Jhean

texts.es: Jhean , de 30 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de su pareja Justina (24) y sus 4 pequeños hijos.Ser el mejor productor de la zona, es una de sus aspiraciones que lo motiva a trabajar con dedicación, junto a su esposa. Cada día desde tempranas horas de la mañana sale a cultivar y así mantiene limpias sus plantaciones de plátanos, café y maíz, trabaja con la tierra, desde hace 15 años. Empezó a comprar sus terrenos desde muy joven, asegura que de la agricultura todo le gusta, porque es un oficio muy rentable, que hasta hoy le permite vivir sin pasar necesidades, y sobre todo puede cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Para mas adelante tiene planeado cumplir sus metas en la vida, además plantará mayor cantidad de naranjas y café, porque considera que de esa manera asegurará el futuro de sus hijos.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ante los integrantes de su banco comunal, se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.Jhean tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en comprar decenas de plantas cítricas y 3 sacos de fertilizantes, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, pues de esta manera quiere seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Jhean, 30, lives in his own home with his life partner, Justina, 24, and their four small children. He aims to be the area’s best farmer and this motivates him to work hard alongside his wife. He goes out every day very early in the morning to cultivate and maintain his banana, coffee and corn crops clean; he has been a farmer for 15 years. He started out buying farmlands from a very young age. He assures us that he loves everything about farming because it’s a profitable occupation. To date, it has made it possible for him to live without lacking anything; above all, it has allowed him to pay for his children’s education. For later on he plans to meet his life goals; he will plant larger amount of oranges and coffee because he believes this is the way to insure his children’s future. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to his fellow group members to make his payments punctually. Jhean plans to use the requested funds to buy several citrus plants and three sacks of fertilizer that he will spread among his plants so that he can continue to progress this way.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy citrus plants and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Nadar Herman

texts.fr: N. Nadar Herman est né le 26 Septembre 1972 et est marié à DOSSOU Sophie, une revendeuse. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Herman s’est installé au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Herman n’a fait que l’école primaire. Depuis dix ans, Herman mène comme activité, la vente de produits de SOBEBRA (société béninoise de brasserie), ce qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Herman s’approvisionne dans les dépôts de SOBEBRA à Cotonou, et vend ses produits à son domicile. Herman a déjà obtenu de ALIDé, deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Herman désire augmenter ses stocks de produits et mieux faire face à la demande des clients. C’est pourquoi Herman sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Nadar Herman N. was born on 26 Septembre 1972 and is married to Sophie DOSSOU, a re-seller of clothes. The couple have two children, both of whom attend school. 12 years ago Herman settled in the Fidjrosse neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where he lives with his wife and children. The couple share the family's expenses. Herman only attended primary school. For the last ten years, Herman has been selling SOBEBRA (Benin brewery organization) products (alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks), which provides him with revenue to feed his family and attend to their needs. Herman stocks up in the SOBEBRA warehouses in Cotonou, and sell the products from his home. Herman previously received two loans from ALIDé, both of which were repaid. In order to address the demands of his customers, Herman is asking for a third loan to increase the stock of products he offers.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Jucuapa, departamento de usulutan, es casado, tiene dos hijas de 14 y 6 años, tiene un taller de carpintería.
tiene veinte años de experiencia en el trabajo, fabrica muebles para el hogar, es una persona que le gusta el trabajo que realiza, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra una cierra y el resto para compra de madera de cedro,clavos, pegamentos de madera. Este crédito le permitirá adquirir una herramienta que le permitirá realizar mejor el trabajo, contar con madera para fabricar muebles, y luego venderlos.
Los objetivos de José son fortalecer el taller, ofrecer a los clientes muebles, para generar ingresos y mejora el sistema de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 42, lives in Jucuapa in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Usulutan. He is married and has two daughters who are 14 and 6 years old, respectively. He makes furniture in a carpentry shop that he has operated for twenty years. Jose is a man who enjoys what he does. He is applying for a loan, partly to buy a saw and partly to buy cedarwood, nails and wooden pegs. The loan will allow him to buy a tool that he needs to improve his work and the raw materials he needs to build the furniture that he sells. Jose's goals are to strengthen the business and provide his customers with products that will increase his income and, in turn, his family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools and raw materials for furniture manufacturing business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La Sra. Angela es cliente antigua, ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos y accesorios de transporte, en la zona chasquipampa y en la Feria de la ciudad de El Alto, ella trabaja solo con Emprender, la señora vive con su esposo y sus hijos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar,los creditos que saca los invierte en la compra de mercadería, como llantas, tapa aros, parrillas, etc. el esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de autos, y de esa manera él la traslada a la Feria de la 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. es una cliente responsable y puntual en sus pagos, esta muy agardecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Angela is a longstanding client. Her business is selling spare parts and accessories for vehicles, in the area of Chasquipampa and at the market in the city of El Alto. She works individually with Emprender. She lives with her husband and her young children, who are of school age. She has invested her loans in buying merchandise, such as tires, hubcaps, grilles, etc. Her husband's work is buying and selling cars. He transports her to the "July 16" market in the city of El Alto. Angela is a responsible client who is punctual with her payments. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying auto parts for her business

loans.name: Lomialagi

texts.en: Lomialagi S. is 50 and married with four children whose ages range from 5 to 22 years. She owns a business venture to sell both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lomialagi has four years of experience in this business. Lomialagi needs a loan of 1,250 Samoan talas to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 360 talas or about $150 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2007, Lomialagi joined SPBD. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lomialagi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago tiene 65 años de edad vive en casa con sus familiares no tiene hijos, el se dedica a la producción de labrillo desde hace 3 años aproximadamente, negocio en el cual obtiene grandes ganancias un promedio de 300 soles semanales, el desea invertir este crédito en la compra de tierra que le permita incrementar su producción del ladrillo y tener asegurado la producción para todo un año, Santiago sueña con ampliar su vivienda y para ello se esfuerza cada vez más para lograr su gran sueño, el tiene muchos clientes porque a todos los atiende con gran simpatia, se le propone el crédito por contar con capacidad de pago y buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Santiago is 65 and lives in a home with relatives. He has no children. He has been making bricks for about the last 3 years, a business in which he has good earnings with an average of 300 sols a week. He wants to use the loan to buy earth so that he can increase his brick production and have it assured for the whole year. Santiago dreams of enlarging his home and for this he works harder and harder to succeed with his goal. He has many customers because he takes good care of them. His credit request is submitted because he can repay it and he has good personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for his work

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim M., 36, is a professional tailor, making $1.50 USD each day in the Takeo province. She is married and has three children living at home to support. Her husband, Khun Nisay, pictured here, makes approximately $2 USD every day, making rice wine. Kim M. would like a loan of $600 USD to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mercedes Marinelly

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

La señora Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya siete años y le gusta mucho por la labor social que realizan. Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos dos mayores de edad, uno es independiente y dos viven con ella. Su esposo tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio en el que realiza muchos trabajos.

Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas de Romanel. Trabaja todos los fines de semana, entrega a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días de acuerdo a lo que sus clientes prefieran, trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 15h00, sus productos las adquiere en el Centro Comercial de Portoviejo, en una distribuidora.

Este crédito lo va a emplear la mitad para comprar Romanel y la otra parte para el negocio del esposo ya que todo es para el bien familiar.

Su sueño es tener un gran bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
There are records of Picoaza as one of the aboriginal settlements of the Manta people. It is an urban parish, situated just 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, and it is full of history. It is also where the members of the María Asunción Communal Bank meet every 5 days.

Señora Mercedes has been a member of the Collunal Bank for 7 years, and likes it very much because of the work they have done together in the community. She is 42 years old, and is married with 3 children: 2 of them are grown up now, with one living independently and the other two living with Mercedes. Her husband has a workshop where he makes aluminium and glass products. 

She dedicates her time to selling Romanel jewellery. She works every weekend, accepting payment by credit and receiving payments every week or 5 days, as her customers prefer. She works from 8am till 3pm. She gets her products from a wholesaler in the commercial centre of Portoviejo.

She will use half of this loan to buy Romanel products and the other half she will put into her husband's business, with which she is very familiar.

Her dream is to have a large gift shop within her house.

loans.use: To buy Romanel jewellery products, and aluminium and glass.

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq A. is 60 years old and is married with three children. Rafiq sells seasonal fruit and vegetables in the local central market. He has had this business for more that 10 years. Fresh fruit and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday life. Every hostess has some in store in case guests arrive at the house. 

Considering the constant demand for his goods, Rafiq 's business is quite successful and brings in a stable income for his family. Rafiq has a large and friendly family who always try to help each other. Now, he wants to increase his stock of goods to meet customer demand. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN. He will spend the loan on the purchase of more items to increase the range of goods he has for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to increase his income

loans.name: Wilfredo Enrique

texts.es:
Wilfredo Enrique de 30 años de edad, su familia esta conformada por su esposa que se dedica a los quaceres del hogar y a cuidar de sus dos  hijos menores de edad; habitantan en comarca el Nispero, toda su vida se ha dedicado a labores del campo en su unidad de producción en la que realiza actividades pecuarias con su inventario ganadero, como  tambien actividades agricolas, siendo sus principales fuentes de ingreso. 

Necesita este financiamiento con la ayuda de Kiva para invertirlo en establecimiento de pasto mejorado y asi poder brindar mejor alimentacion a su hato bovino.  

La mayor intencion de este cliente es tener una finca con buenas condiciones de pasto para mejorar la produccion de leche, logrando mejorar su ingreso economico en el nucleo familiar, en su comunidad lo consideran como un hombre progresivo, trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Enrique is 30 years old.  His family is comprised of his wife and their two minor children.  His wife does the household chores and takes care of the children.  They live in the Nispero area.  He has been doing farm work all of his life.  He works in his production unit doing farm work with his inventory of livestock.  He also does agricultural work as these are his main sources of income.

He needs this loan with Kiva’s help to establish a better pasture.  Then he will be able to provide better feed for his herd of cattle.

His biggest goal is to have a farm with a pasture that is in good condition in order to improve milk production.  That way he will manage to improve the family income.  In his community he is considered to be a progressive, hard-working, and responsible man.

loans.use: To cultivate the pasture

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Fe Esperanza” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por once integrantes, diez mujeres y un varón.  Los negocios que desempeñan son variados: Artesanía (tejido de chompas de lana), tienda de barrio,  elaboración de mantas de lana de angora, tejido de ropa de bebé, tienda de barrio, compra- venta de deportivos, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, venta de comida, tejido a mano de mantas.

La señora presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Julia, casada, madre de cuatro hijos, comenta que este es su primer ciclo,  indica que forma parte del B.C. “Fe y Esperanza” gracias a la invitación de los promotores de Pro Mujer, quienes fueron a su zona para dar a conocer de los servicios de Pro Mujer.  La señora Julia abrió hace cuatro meses una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, por iniciativa propia, la tienda está abierta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, para su atención cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos. Su crédito de Bs. 1000.-, este monto será invertido en la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta trabajar con las señoras y el consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope) Community Bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer. It is part of the Senkata central office. Fe y Esperanza is a new group formed to access credit, training, and health education, and is composed of ten woman and one man. They run several businesses: crafts (knitting wool sweaters), neighbourhood shops, making ponchos from angora wool, knitting baby clothes, sportswear sales, cosmetics sales, vegetable sales, food sales, and weaving ponchos by hand.

Señora Julia is president of the group. She is married and has four children. This is her first loan cycle. She became part of the group after being invited by the development officers of Pro Mujer who were in the neighbourhood to explain the program. Four months ago Sra. Julia opened a store in her house. It is open from 7 am to 9 pm. Her children help her run the store. She plans to buy more stock with her loan. 

Of the advantages offered by Pro Mujer, Julia most likes working with the other women and having access to health services.

loans.use: to buy staples such as rice, pasta etc.

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Charlito R. is from the village of Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. He is 47 years old. Charlito is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Charlito owns & operates a business planting & harvesting rice for sale. Charlito has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Charlito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlito has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Charlito is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Charlito from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Verónica; ella tiene 18 años de edad, soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, la socia vende en el mercado de huancaro, a la vez la socia estudia ingles en un instituto por el centro de la ciudad. La socia es una persona muy emprendedora y con las ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de verduras para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Verónica belongs to the “Patron de Santiago” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Verónica is 18 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling fruit and vegetables.  She sells her products in Huancaro market.  At the same time, she is studying English at an institute in the city center.  She is a very enterprising person with a desire to get ahead.

Verónica is requesting this loan so that she can buy vegetables for her business.  She is happy to receive the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 29 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridas hijas Luz y Britney, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. El salón de belleza de Rosa es uno de los visitados de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella tiene un talento natural para cortarle el cabello a sus clientes, pero su fama principal y el motivo por el cual la buscan sus clientes, es por los novedosos cambios de looks que realiza y es que tiene un muy buen ojo para sacar la belleza de la gente a relucir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre cuales son los estilos que están de moda, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el fuerte olor que despiden  los químicos con los que trabaja, aun así espera sacar adelante su salón de belleza y convertirla en la mejor de la ciudad de Kimbiri. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza para realizar un mejor trabajo en sus clientes.
texts.en: 29 year old Rosa is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her two beloved daughters Luz and Britney, who are the primary motive for all her efforts. Rosa’s beauty salon is one of the salons visited from those from the city of Juliaca. She has a natural talent for cutting hair, but her main fame and reason why clients seek her is for the contemporary styles she creates and she really has a good eye to discover the beauty in everyone. What she most likes about her work is counseling her clients about the cuts that are in style. She has been doing this for 4 years and considers having to put up with the strong odor by some of the chemicals she works with to be the most difficult part. She hopes to continue growing her beauty salon and converting it to the best in the city of Kimbiri. This is the ninth credit with MFP, and she is prepared to make all her payments on time, as she feels that she has a responsibility to the members of her communal bank, where she is very respected for the order she brings to the meetings. With the thousand nuevos soles from the loan, she will buy more beauty products in order to do better work with her customers.

loans.use: Buy more beauty products

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
