Mrs. Sok S. is the elected president of a village bank loan, composed of nine people in Roka village in Kandal province. The members will uS. their portion of this group loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sok S. is a widow who is a Khmer cake seller in the local village. Since she has only one business, she does not have enough money support her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and ducks to start a new business. She hopes to be able to support her family well. Mrs. Sok S. has only one child, who is a student in the local village.

loans.use: To buy piglets and ducks to start a new business

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.en:
Inocenta Mariscola and her husband are still childless. They are farmers and till a small parcel of land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. It is their dream to continue their business so that when they have a child they will be able to send their child to school.

Inocenta would like to apply for a loan at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. She chose CEVI because of the Micro Insurance package as the added value in their membership in CEVI.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita W. sells a local dish called “piwa” (made of corn and served with cooked beans) in Dompoase, near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is divorced and lives with her 4 children. Rita has acquired senior high school education. She is able to provide for the family's basic needs with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy extra quantities of corn and beans. Her business goal is to build a small restaurant. In this picture, Rita is showing the cooked beans used to serve the "piwa".

loans.use: to buy extra quantities of corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.es: Doña Isabel Maria C. T., es casada, tienen 34 años D. edad, cursos el cuarto grado D. educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos que estan estudiando, se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. consumo diario y a la crianza D. animales, tiene 8 años D. experiencia con el negocio D. tienda que tiene, inicio con un pequeño capital prestado, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es agricultor. DeciD. reunir a 10 compañeras mas para solictar un prétamo que les servirá para ampliar el capital D. trabajo D. cada una D. ellas. Cada una D. las integrantes se dedican a diversas actividades productivas como: servicio D. tienda D. consumo diario, venta D. refacciones, elaboración D. calzados, venta D. juguetes y crianza D. animales. Esperan mejorar sus ganancia y condición D. vida con el prestamo que hacen con ASDIR.
texts.en: Isabel Maria C. T. is married, 34-years-old, finished the fourth graD. in primary school, and has four children that are in school.  She works selling everyday items and raising animals and has eight years of experience in her store that she began with a small amount of loaned capital.  She has the support of her husband who works in agriculture.  She decided to get together ten other friends in order to request a loan that will help them to increase the working capital available to each one of them.  Each one of the members works in different areas such as: a store with everyday items, selling of spare parts, shoe-making, selling toys, and raising animals.  They hope to improve their profits and their standard of life with this loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is 28 years old and married with a four month old son. He runs a retail shop where he sells spare parts. He has been running the business for four years. He hopes to establish his business and open other outlets of his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access business loans. This has helped him to improve his business. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy alternators, starters, and distributors.

loans.use: to buy alternators, starters, and distributors

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el departamento de Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y perfumes. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 1 año, en su propio domicilio, lugar situado en la avenida principal, siendo muy concurrido y con clientela ya establecida.  Los ingresos que percibe en esta actividad le ayuda para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Con su crédito, Mercedes desea comprar más mercadería de ropa, zapatos y perfumes. Con esta inversión, desea incrementar sus ventas diarias y de esta manera sus ingresos. Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 44 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children.  They live in their own home in Piura Department, which is located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque Department.

Mercedes makes her living selling clothing, shoes and perfumes.  She has had this business for more than a year.  It is run out of her own home, which is situated on the main thoroughfare.  Her business is very busy and she has an established clientele.  The income that she receives from her business helps to support her family financially.

With the loan, Mercedes would like to purchase more merchandise such as clothes, shoes and perfumes. She would then be able to increase her daily sales.  This is why she thinks it is beneficial to obtain a loan of 1000 nuevos soles ($375 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as clothing, shoes and perfumes.

loans.name: Los

texts.en: Los F., 53, resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. F. and her husband sell dry cow meat, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 73 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. Los is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuan T. T. is 41 years old with 2 children. She is the group leader of a 5-member group. Xuan T. T. is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables. These agricultural products are used to feed her family and are also sold in the local market to earn a daily income. Xuan T. T. hopes to use this 5,014,000 VND loan to buy more fertilizer and seeds to improve productivity.

Mai T. N. is 30 years old with 2 children. She runs a hair cutting shop at her house. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more clothes.

Hang T. N. is 48 years old with 2 children. She grows rice and vegetables in a paddy of 4,500 square meters and raises 100 chickens for meat. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy chicken feed.

Duoc T. N. is 41 years old with 2 children. She runs a small grocery shop. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more kinds of products to meet her customers' demand.

Doi T. N. is 40 years old. She grows rice and vegetables to sell in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to improve productivity.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells provisions and soap in Elmina near Nkontrodo. She is divorced and has two children. She sees to the wellbeing of her home.

Ama’s loan will be used to buy more soap to sell. She hopes to reinvest any profits.

loans.use: to buy more soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with one parent and two siblings. 

She has been working as a bread and rosewater producer since 2007. Her work is based at her house. She sells her goods to customers from her community. She works hard to support her family financially. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products. She says that the loan will help her increase her business productivity and therefore her sales. In the future, she is planning to open a small shop and start her own trading business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products needed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is widow with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elsie is 62 years old.   She has a meat vending business in the Philippines.  Elsie has been in this business for 5 years.   She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en: Teofilo is 47 years old, married, and a responsible husband/father to his wife and four children. He's has been a rice farmer for almost 25 years. He's asking a loan for 25,000 Philippine pesps to purchase fertilizer and insecticide for his rice farm. Teofilo hopes to raise his family's living standards through hard work and would like to be able to earn more so that he can supplement the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for rice farming

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a hardworking, 34-year-old business man. He is married and blessed with an 8-year-old child who is going to school. For the past 7 years, Moses has been running a hotel so that he is able to provide for his family. He supplements income from this venture with earnings he gets from engaging in the transport business. In the next 5 years he wants to open up a well-furnished restaurant. His dream is to build rental houses. Moses is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy maize, wheat flour and rice. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching him business management skills.

loans.use: to buy maize, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Oliva in a patient and hard worker who is committed to provide her family with the necessities of life. She is 27 years old, married, has one child and is married to a farmer who grows rice and corn in the Philippines. For the last three years, she has earned a living by raising pigs. She has encountered many challenges in her work and life, but did not lose her hope to survive and prosper. Oliva is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more piglets to raise and feed for them to eat. Her goal is to increase her income and become even more successful, because this will allow her family to have a good, rewarding life.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Sirley Johanna

texts.es: Sirley vive al sur de la ciudad con sus dos hijos de 7 años y un bebe de menos de un año de edad. Allí se dedica al tradicional oficio de elaborar prendas de vestir  en tejido de punto como camisetas, camisilla y también trabaja a terceros mediante el sistema de maquila. Sirley proveniente de la ciudad ganadera de Colombia, Montería e incondicionalmente ha recibido el apoyo de su padre para salir adelante como madre y como persona. Su desafío es contar con un capital de trabajo para proyectar el crecimiento de su negocio, pues con el que cuenta es muy limitado para potenciar una creciente clientela con la planea trabajar. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con la cual comprará materiales e insumos para incrementar su inventario de productos terminados e impactar visualmente a sus clientes con nuevos diseños. Su sueño mas adelante es tener una casa propia y continuar ampliando su negocio hasta lograr tener un local que posicione sus diseños. Mientras esto ocurre continua manejando un margen de utilidad del 30% y una liquidez 3 a 1, desde las cuales planea su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Sirley lives to the south of the city with her two children, a seven-year-old and a baby who is less than a year old. She engages in the traditional craft of making cross-stitched garments, such as t-shirts and undershirts. Sirley also performs piecemeal work using a system of machines. She is from the city of Montería, a Colombian city known for its cattle. Sirley receives unconditional support from her father so that she can succeed in her role as a mother and as a person. Her challenge is having enough operating capital to grow her business. However, she is limited in her ability to attract more customers in order for this plan to work. For this reason Sirley is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy materials and supplies so that she can increase her inventory of finished products and visually impact her customers with new designs.

Her dream going forward is to have her own house and to continue expanding her business until she obtains her own store where she can show off her designs. In the meantime, Sirley continues to maintain a profit margin of 30% and a liquidity ratio of 3:1, which are indicators of her plans for growth.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for producing her finished products.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and married with three children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Helen has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Helen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

loans.name: Segunda Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Segunda tiene 65 años y es socia del Banco Comunal "Tesoro Escondido“. Su esposo es auxiliar D. contabilidad.  Tienen tres hijos, todos independientes.

DesD. hace 10 años que tiene su negocio, el que inició con un préstamo inicial D. S./ 300.00, ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas y bebidas en la entrada D. su casa y además cría y venD. gallinas. También tiene una chacra dónD. cosecha café y cacao. 
Su sueños es construir encima D. esta chacra una casa D. campo y un parque infantil, para mostrar a los visitantes la flora bonita D. la región. 
Una parte D. su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 va a invertir en la chacra y con la otra parta va a comprar nuevos productos para su negocio en casa.
Josefa, como la llaman, ya lleva muchos años con Manuela Ramos y le agradece mucho su apoyo. Ahora es presidente en su Banco Comunal, función que le gusta cumplir por la importancia del cargo.
texts.en:
Segunda is 65 years old and a member of the Tesoro Escondido [Hidden Treasure] Community Bank. Her husband is an accounting assistant. They have three children who are all independent.

She has run her business for ten years, which she started with an initial loan of 300 PEN [$110]. She sells sweets and drinks from the entryway of her house, and also raises and sells chickens. She also owns a small farm where she harvests coffee and cocoa.
Her dream is to build a country house and a playground on her small farm, and be able to share the beautiful flora of the region with visitors.
She will invest part of her new 3000 PEN [$1100] loan in her farm, and will use the rest to purchase new products for her home business.
Josefa, as she is called, has worked for years with Manuela Ramos, and is very grateful for her help and support. Now she is the president of her Community Bank, which is a position she is happy to fill due to the importance of its responsibilities.

loans.use: to invest in her small farm and to purchase cookies and other sweets.

loans.name: Neing

texts.en:
Neing, 27 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province known for its ancient temples and tourism. She sells drinks, earning $4 per day. Her husband is a driver in a company, earning $3 per day. The couple has three children: two are studying and one is too young for school. Each month, Neing spends $50 on food, $10 on school fees, and $15 on other expenses. 

Neing would like to request a loan of $300 to buy clothes and drinks to sell. She previously sold postcards, and other things with some drinks but now she wants to sell clothes and more kinds of drinks so that she can make more income. She plans to sell food for the tourists when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy clothes and drinks to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 27 years old and is married. He has three young children. To make a living, he sells fruits, vegetables and ice cream to people in the village where he lives together with his wife. He is now asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more ice cream, bananas, tomatoes and cabbages to sell. He would like to improve his sales.

In the future, he would like to keep making better sales to save for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more ice cream, bananas, tomatoes and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. 

Rachel has a shop that makes and sells sleeping pillows. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan for PHP 26,000 to buy materials she needs for making her pillows, like cottons and cloth.

Rachel has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rachel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making pillows, like cottons and cloth.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a young married woman with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Her business is selling bananas. She transports them to Kampala for resale.  She started by purchasing ten bunches of bananas but now she purchases a lorry. Her challenge is the high cost of bananas.

Her dream is to educate her children and build a permanent house. Victoria needs the loan to buy bananas for resale.

loans.use: to buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a single parent and has 6 dependents. Faustina has been selling provisions for the past 11 years now at Dompoase.  She uses her income to provide for her children's need. She will use her loan to purchase more provisions for sale.  Flaustina hope to use the profits she makes to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for sale

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
El Sr. Agustín es de ciudad del este está casado, tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales los 3 aun son pequeños y están en la escuela primaria. Comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle un buen futuro a sus hijos, ya que ellos son su razon de ser, de él y de su esposa.
Tienen una despensa bien surtida  donde trabajan desde muy tempranas horas, tanto el como su esposa. Se iniciaron en la actividad con una platita que recibió Agustín como parte de una indemnización de un trabajo anterior. 
Agustín  además de su despensa trabaja con una huerta  donde planta lechuga, mandioca y otras hortalizas para que con la venta de ellos  pueda ayudar a abastecer su despensa. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, fideos, arroz, enlatados y demás insumos para poder abastecer su almacén.
texts.en:
Agustín is from Ciudad del Este.  He’s married and has three children all of which are still little and going to elementary school.  He comments that all his efforts are aimed at providing a better future for his children since they are his and his wife’s reason for living.

They have a well-stocked store where they work from very early in the day, both he and his wife.  They started the business with a little money Agustín got as part of a severance pay from a previous job.

In addition to working in his store, Agustín also has a farm where he grows lettuce, manioc and other vegetables and with earnings from their sales he’s able to stock his store.  He is a very responsible person who very much wants to get ahead.  He has a jovial, enterprising spirit and there’s no doubt that he will reach all the goals he’s set for himself.

He is requesting the loan to buy beverages, noodles, rice, canned goods and other supplies to stock his store

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Chingwe1 Group

texts.en:
Needmore is 28 years old and married, with two children aged two and nine. Her other source of income is the salary of her spouse, who is a teacher.

The group is composed of business people in the crossborder flea market business. They all operate from licenced premises in the Masvingo urban area. They have no employees and the businesses have been operational for more than two years.

Needmore faces the challenge of customers failing to pay. She would like to operate an outlet in the central business district in five years. This loan will improve her standard of living and she will be able to send her children to better schools.

loans.use: to buy flea market products.

loans.name: Vanis

texts.en:
Vanis, 39, is married and has five children between the ages of two and 24. She runs a farm supplies shop that has been in operation for the last three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 50,000.

This is her fifth loan with KADET LTD, and she has successfully repaid the previous loans. She will use the funds to buy more stocks of animal feeds. Vanis hopes to own a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Lakounlé Prospère

texts.fr: Lakounlé Prospère est âgé de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Lakounlé Prospère a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Lakounlé Prospère est marié à une marchande du nom de Charlotte. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Lakounlé Prospère répare depuis neuf ans les pneus. Lakounlé Prospère achète ses produits au Bénin et au Nigeria. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Lakounlé Prospère contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Lakounlé Prospère sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Lakounlé Prospère ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Lakounlé Prospère is 33 years old and lives in Benin. He attended primary school. He is married to a merchant named Charlotte, and they have four dependent children, some of whom go to school. The children live with their parents, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

To support himself and his children, Lakounlé Prospère has been repairing tires for the past nine years. He buys his supplies in Benin and Nigeria. The income generated through this activity enables him to provide for his family. 

To meet the needs of a growing customer base, Lakounlé Prospère is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. The two previous credits he received were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy supplies for repairing tires.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en: Achol is 32 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are in school. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling food. She is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy beans and rice to sell to her customers. She will use the extra income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Pheat

texts.en:
Pheat is a 36-year-old married mother with five children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. For the past 16 years, Pheat has been a farmer who plants cassava and grows rice. To supplement her income, she also works for others for a fee. Pheat earns about 80,000 KHR per day and she can save about 40,000 KHR for future needs. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid her previous loan. 

Pheat is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and fix her hand-tractor. She hopes to grow more cassava and rice so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel is 31 years old. For the last nine years, he has worked as a clown. Before that, he used to work for an agency. Now he is independent.

He performs at both children's and adult events. He also does some street advertisement for some small businesses. He is asking for a loan to renew his audio equipment. He needs the equipment for his job. His biggest accomplishments are growing his business and acquiring a car. His next goal is to buy or build a house.

loans.use: to renew audio equipment used in children's parties.

loans.name: Bobohon

texts.ru: Бобохон житель города Душанбе. Ему 42 лет. Он родился и вырос в городе Душанбе. Бобохон семейный мужчина. У него двое детей в возрасте 17 и 11 лет. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Бобохон заботливый и честный отец. Он всегда поддерживает детей и помогает им в учебы. Бобохон занимается перевозом людей. Он занимается таксистом более 5 лет. Бобохон хороший водитель в своем деле и он хорошо знает свой родной город. Он идет по стопам отца. Бобохон давно мечтал капитально отремонтировать свой дом и улучшить жилищные условия семью. С такими планами Бобохон обратился за кредитом.  Он надеется на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для ремонта дома.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by buying more poultry chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase carpentry equipment and raw materials needed to expand business

loans.name: Laurette

texts.en: A. Laurette is a brave 46-year-old woman who has three children (two daughters and a son) and lives in Yopougon, a big township in the north of Abidjan. A. works with her first daughter, who did not have chance to go to school and thus stayed with her mother to manage their cassava cakes business. With the revenue generated from this busines, A. has helped her husband, a carpenter, send the other children to school. A. has been working with AE&I since June 2005 and has already experienced the benefits of several small loans that she reimbursed without problem.  A. has applied for a loan of USD 550.

loans.use: Abia Laurette will use the loan to develop her cassava cakes business.

loans.name: Bil

texts.en: Mrs. Bil P. is 41. She lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She makes wine and raises pigs. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables. They earn 4 dollars a day. They have 2 children and one of them works with his parents. They want to increase their business by purchasing pig feed and rice used to make wine. In the future, they would like to purchase more pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and rice used to make wine

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.en:
Everything seemed to have ended when 44-year-old Hortensia lost her husband, who left her with four children. She realized she needed to start a business so she could raise money to take care of these children. After attending training in tailoring, she opened a workshop. However, she had difficulties because she did not have enough capital to invest.

She was then led to join GHAPE and received training in business skills. With a first loan of $100, she plans to sew and sell clothes so she can use the profit to pay school fees for her children. Over time, her community will also benefit, because she plans to train an apprentice.

Hortensia plans to repay her loan in 15 months. Her first installment repayment will be made on the date her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and thread, and pay rent

loans.name: Roxana Arezon

texts.es:
Roxana is a young mother and has a very young three year-old daughter, whom she gives her love and shares with her the sweat and fruits of her labor. For various years, with the support of her relatives in the dressmaking business, she obtained work in haute couture like dressmaking and designing various items of clothing. By profession, she is tailor; it took her three long years to prepare and make beautiful articles of clothing to satisfy her very demanding clients. Given her excellent work, she has become one of the best and sought after dressmakers in the region. She likes to make each item with extreme care and in line with each client's style.Currently, she makes beautiful,exquisite articles of clothing that are ready to be sold and/or rented. She offers additional services like mending or does any other tailor-related work at request. Her busiest season is from December to February because of the various festivities and holiday parties that happen in her area. She is seeking a loan of $350 to buy windows and-or counters to display her designs, so that she can be ready for the massive orders that are coming her way and increase her output. Let´s support the delicate and beautiful labors of this young woman who continue to complete and provide each and every one of her daughter´s dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Roxana es una joven madre de una pequeña niña de tres años a la cual cada día le da su amor y siempre comparte con ella la noble labor que desempeña desde hace varios años con el apoyo de sus familiares en su pequeño centro de confecciones en el que realiza trabajos de alta costura como vestidos de promoción y prendas de vestir.Ella es costurera de profesión y le ha tomado tres largos años prepararse para confeccionar hermosas prendas para satisfacción de su exigente cartera de clientes y debido a su excelente desempeño se ha convertido una de las mejores y solicitadas costureras de su zona, le gusta elaborar cada prenda con sumo cuidado y de acuerdo al estilo de cada uno de sus clientes.Ahora está confeccionando hermosísimas prendas con finísimos acabados para venderlos y/o alquilarlos además de ofrecer adicionalmente el servicio de remiendo y otros trabajos de costura que le envíen o soliciten.El tiempo en que ella recibe mayores pedidos es desde el mes de diciembre hasta el mes de febrero por las diferentes festividades que acontecen en su localidad y para abastecer la enorme cantidad de pedidos que se avecinan e incrementar su producción solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares para comprar vitrinas y mostradores para exponer sus diseños.Colaboremos con la delicada y bellísima labor de esta joven madre para que continúe brindándole finos acabados a cada uno de los sueños de su pequeña niña.

loans.use: To buy windows and/or counters to exhibit fine designs

loans.name: Iim

texts.en: Iim is 46 years old and lives only with her husband since her children have married and live separately. She sells clothes on credit. She usually earns US$ 30 profit per month and it's just enough to cover their daily needs. She is requesting a loan of IDR 900,000 (US$ 100)  to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business selling clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more raw materials and a display cabinet to keep her products in

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Martha del Socorro is a lady who, for the past 15 years, has dedicated herself to the sale of vegetables at the market in León, Nicaragua. From a young age, she has been known to be very hardworking as well as the caring mother of three children for whom she must provide healthcare, education, and a safe place to live.

She started her activities with a small sum received from spousal support, and has been able to bring about an improvement in her financial situation. Despite this, she still needs to invest in her business and has turned to Ceprodel for loan assistance (39 loans). These, she tells us, have greatly helped her in the purchase of her products as well as meeting her family's needs. Her immediate goal is to purchase more vegetables to sell, so she can continue caring for her three children and help them complete their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha del Socorro es una dama que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en el sector del mercado la Terminal en León Nicaragua. Desde muy joven se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y además, es madre de tres pequeños que tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles salud, educación y un techo digno donde habitar.

Inició su actividad con un bajo monto obtenido por aporte de sus esposo, hoy en día, ha logrado mejorar su situación económica pero aun necesita invertir mas en su negocio y para esto ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel (39 créditos) y según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente en la adquisición de los productos y además en la manutención de su núcleo familiar. Su necesidad actual es la adquisición de las verduras para continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar y permitir así que sus tres hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Rita

texts.fr:
Mrs. Rita N. was born in the year 1967 in the north of BENIN. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She sells clothing articles for women and children in a large shopping center of COTONOU. Every day she logs in an important number of customers because her items are of very good quality. However, the number of items she has available does not allow her to cope with the demand. She is requesting a loan to stock up in order to meet her clients’ demand.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née vers les années 1967 dans le nord du BENIN , Dame N. Rita est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend des articles vestimentaires pour femmes et pour enfants dans un grand centre commercial de COTONOU. Ces articles étant de très bonne qualité, elle enregistre chaque jour un nombre important de clients alors que les articles dont elle dispose ne lui permettent pas de faire face à cette demande. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour s’approvisionner afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use:
5 bales of clothing articles

5 bals d’articles vestimentaires.

loans.name: Zainabu's Jitihada Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is a single woman with 1 child, age 7. She also takes care of 1 other person, age 50. Zainabu owns a small shop, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es:
In addition to her business Pabla is a primary school teacher in her neighborhood. She has worked with our institution for about ten years and has received 8 loans that she has invested in working capital to stock her business. This client has improved her quality of life. She has done so also with the help of her life partner who is a farmer. She has two children who are in secondary school.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Esta cliente ademas del negocio es profesora de primaria en una escuela de la localidad, trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos diez años donde ha obtenido ocho créditos los que ha invertido en capital de trabajo donde ha surtido su negocio, se ve que la cliente ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida, esto tambien con la ayuda de su compañero de vida quien es agricultor, ella tiene dos hijos los que estan en la secundaria .

loans.use: The loan will be used as working capital to buy shoes, clothing and other products.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan C. is 28 years old, single and has no children. He was born and raised in the city of Caaguazú but four years ago he came to live in Encarnación for work. All of his family continues to live in the other city that is seven or eight hours away and there is no direct way to get there, but even so he tries to go every weekend to visit his family.

Juan works for the Binacional Yacyreta (one of the two hydroelectric companies in the country) he transports construction materials such as sand, bricks and rubble, among other things, because Yacyreta is carrying out a relocation of homes in that city. Thanks to previous loans and his good earnings he has purchased a truck.

Juan is a very hardworking and sacrificing man, he works for more than 10 hours a day and he handles everything by himself because he doesn’t have anyone living with him or parents close by.

At this time Juan is asking for a new loan to purchase new truck tires for his vehicle, because it is his primary tool for work.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Juan C. tiene 28 años, él es soltero y no tiene hijos. El nació y se crió en la ciudad de Caaguazú pero hace 4 años vino a vivir a Encarnación por motivos de trabajo. Toda su familia sigue viviendo en la otra ciudad que queda a siete u ocho horas además de que no existe una forma directa de llegar, aún así trata de ir todos los fines de semana para visitar a su familia.

Juan trabaja para la Binacional Yacyreta (una de las dos hidroeléctricas del país), el hace transportes de materiales de construcción como arena, ladrillos, escombros entre otras cosas ya que Yacyreta esta llevando acabo una reubicación de viviendas en esa ciudad. Gracias a créditos anteriores y sus buenas ganancias el ha comprado un camión.

Oscar es un hombre muy trabajador y sacrificado, trabaja mas de 10 horas al día y se maneja totalmente solo ya que no tiene a nadie viviendo con él ni parientes cercanos.

Oscar hoy día esta solicitando un crédito nuevo para poder comprar cubiertas nuevas a su vehículo, que es su principal herramienta de trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase tires for a truck

loans.name: Comite La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
This group is currently in its 5th loan cycle, with 15 members, 3 of whom just started this cycle. The members are engaged in various activities including the selling of food, drinks, a food kiosk, as well as selling fruit in general. 
This is a regular group with some occasional problems; however, they are obtaining positive results thanks to their leaders,who are looking for alternatives so that  every endeavor can be a success. And they are achieving this little by little.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuff

loans.name: Ntabanganyimana

texts.en:
Greetings from Rwanda! C. is 31 years old. She is married with three children. 

In 2005, C. started selling fish and charcoal. She earns about $45 every month from her business. She employs seven people. C. is requesting a loan of 300,025 Frw to increase her capital and expand her business. In the future, C. plans to expand her business in another area. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Increase her working capital and to expand her business

loans.name: Sri Handayani

texts.id: Pinjaman kali ini sudah merupakan pinjaman yang kedua bagi Sri Handayani (39). Pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar Rp.700.000 sudah dipakai sebagai modal usaha. Pada pinjaman kali ini Sri ingin menambah jumlah pinjaman menjadi Rp.1.000.000, dan akan dipergunakan untuk menambah omzet penjualannya. Usaha warung makanan yang dijalaninya saat ini menjual nasi goring, cap tjai dan makanan laut. Sekarang ini klien juga menambah dengan jualan pisang goring dan tahu goreng. Pada pagi hari Sri handayani menjual nasi kuning. Usaha yang dilakukan klien ini cukup berhasil dan dia berharap bisa terus mengembangkan usahanya dengan bantuan modal usaha dari KIVA dan DINARI. Saat ini Sri Handayani masih tinggal di Sidakarya Denpasar bersama suaminya Made Lubis dan anak tunggalnya Melly (9).
texts.en:
This is 39-year old Sri Handayani's second loan. Her previous loan of Rp.700.000 (US$ 75) was used as working capital for her business. Sri wishes to borrow Rp.1.000.000 (US$ 108) this time around, intending to use it to increase sales turnover. At present, the food stall that she runs sells fried rice, sauteed vegetables and seafood. Now, since the addition of fried bananas and fried tofu to her menu, she is seeing an increase in customers. In the early morning Sri Handayani sells yellow rice. Her business is reasonably successful and she hopes it can continue growing with the help of a loan from KIVA via DINARI. At this time Sri Handayani still lives in Sidakarya Denpasar with her husband Made Lubis and her only child, 9-year old Melly.

Translated from Indonesian by Aarati Sivasubramanian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Elmeddin

texts.en:
Elmeddin R. is 23 year old. Elmeddin has been working in the livestock sector since he was 15 years old. Currently he has two cows. His main source of income is selling dairy products, such as milk and yoghurt. His mother helps him in the business. 

The business generates the main income for the family. His father is on pension and he needs special care and medicine. That’s why he is not helping in currently business, althought he is always ready to give advice to his son. 

Elmeddin applied for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase one cow, one calf, and fodder. This is a first loan for Elmeddin and he is sure he will be able to pay it back on time. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase one cow, one calf, and fodder

loans.name: Hursan

texts.ru: Рузиева Хурсан жительница района Шахринау.Возраст 54 года, замужем , имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей фруктов.Она торгует на центральном рынке города Регар.Занимается бизнесом уже 35 лет.Бизнес является основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Так как муж клиентки пенсионер.На полученный кредит хочет закупить больше  качественного  товара.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hursan R. lives in the Shahriaw District. She is 54 years old, married, and has five children. She completed secondary education. This entrepreneur sells fruit at the central market in the city of Regar. She has been in this business for 35 years already. The business is the primary source of income for her large family, since her husband is retired. She wants to use the loan to buy higher quality produce. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Savuth P. is a 49-year-old villager in Kul Kup Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is widow with five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. In an effort to improve her living condition, she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Riel to hire construction workers to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To hire construction workers to build a new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a room in her home

loans.name: Mouhinatou

texts.fr: K. Mouhinatou est née le 3 aout 1962. Elle s’est marié avec HOUNKONNOU Edmond.  Elle a fini les études jusqu’au secondaire. Elle a 3 enfants – 22, 15, et 7 ans, tous scolarisés. Elle a mené son activité depuis 27 ans. Elle achète le lait aux éleveurs, et elle fabrique le fromage. Elle vend sa fromage a Tokpa. Elle aussi vend les fruits comme les avocats, les bananes, et les tomates fraiches sur places. Elle a une troisième commerce en vendant les chaussures dans le quartier Aglas. Elle a besoin d’acheter a crédit pour gérer ses activités. Avec ses crédits de Kiva, elle a pu mieux économiser. Dans l’avenir elle voudrait acheter en gros, acheter une maison pour louer, et rendre le refinancement des prêts plus rapide.
texts.en:
Mouhinatou K. was born on the 3rd August 1962. She is married to Edmond Hounkonnou. She finished her high school studies and has 3 children, aged 22, 15 and 7, who have all attended school. She has worked for 27 years buying milk from farmers and making cheese, which she sells in Tokpa. She also sells fruit such as avocados, bananas and fresh tomatoes. She has a third business selling shoes in the Aglas district. She buys on credit to manage her businesses. With her loans from Kiva she has been able to make more savings. In the future she would like to be able to buy products in bulk, to buy a house to rent and to repay her loans more quickly.

Translated from French by Holly Miller, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit

loans.name: Loeb

texts.en:
K., 37, has been farming for more than nine years. She has much experience and grows green beans on her own farmland. This is a skill, she learned from her grandfather. She lives in the rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. 

K. is married and the mother of three children. All are teenagers and attend school. Her husband's name is Kanhga, age 37, and he helps his wife with growing green bean. As green bean growing is the main source of income for the family, K. is asking for a loan to buy more bean seeds and a cow to serve on the farm.

loans.use: To buy more bean seeds and a cow to serve for plowing

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en: N. Immaculate is a 53-year-old widow who cares for 7 children and 4 grandchildren. She is a businesswoman who makes a local brew that she sells wholesale from her home. She also runs a retail bar at her home where she sells beer and wine to customers. This combination provides her with more income. Immaculate also has a retail shop that sells snacks, sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour and paraffin to people in her community. She needs a loan to restock her shop and to buy beer to sell from her bar.

loans.use: Buy beer and restock retail shop.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La señora Bernarda es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 05 hijos y posee estudios primaria incompleta (segundo grado). 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 años, se dedica a engorD. D. ganado menor, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. ganado como cerdos y ovejas, para luego engordarlo y venderlo.  
Ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1600.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se compromete a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales, el dinero lo invertirá en la compra D. ganado (vaca, ovejas y lechones),para poder venderlo en las ferias D. Zepita, Yunguyo.
Su anhelo es construir su casa en Copani, asimismo desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y es por ello que viene trabajando con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a member of the "Central Urban" Community Bank and lives in the district of Copani, department of Puno, Peru. She is a 46-year-old married mother of five and has a second-graD. education. She was worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for five years and makes a living raising small livestock. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she invested it in the purchase of livestock such as pigs and sheep to then fatten and sell. She is requesting a loan of 1,600 soles and promises to repay it in four months. She will invest the money in the purchase of livestock (cows, sheep, suckling pigs) in order to sell them at the outdoor markets in Zepita and Yunguyo. Her goal is to build her home in Copani and for her children to be successful. It is for them that she works with so much effort.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock (cows, sheep, suckling pigs)

loans.name: Bibi Najeba Group

texts.en:
Bibi Najeba is the group leader of Bibi Najeba. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses.
Bibi Najeba and Sahelah want to take a loan for their tailoring business; they want to buy a new machine for their business. Palwasha wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store business. They are very happy with this loan in Afghanistan. 
With this loan, they can increase their business, support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for their tailoring business

loans.name: Richlie

texts.en:
A 31-year-old businesswoman from Talic, Oroquieta City, is battling the odds with her shoe-making business. Richlie T. is married to Ronel, who is her greatest aid in their shoe-making business. The business was started by her husband with only an initial capital of php 300. Her husband was a shoe-shine man before. Because of hard work and the service he rendered, he had already gained regular customers.They decided to open a shoe-making business. Her husband is the shoemaker.

They were able to send their three children to school. To support the needs of the family, they work hard to sustain their business. They also accept shoe repairs for additional income. Richlie holds the belief that by helping each other, the business will prosper. They have taught their children to cooperate and most especially to do well with their studies.

Recently, she applied a loan of PHP 7,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, a Kiva partner. It will be used to purchase additional shoe rubber shoe and materials for shoe-making.

The couple wish to own a stall in the public market. They feel that the Lord has blessed their business. They want to see their business grow, but nothing is more fulfilling than to see their children earn their diplomas.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for shoemaking

loans.name: San Nicolas Group

texts.es:
Banco Comunal "San Nicolás" esta compuesto por doce socias entre ellas existe un varón el cual se dedica a la cerrajería, las socias que integran el banco comunal San Nicolás ingresaron a su 5do ciclo cumpliendo con todas las obligaciones pactadas con el contrato que firmaron con Agrocapital, Muchas de las socias trabajan con artesanías entre ellas están el tejido de mantas, el macramé, venta de víveres a crédito y al contado, algunas de las socias cuentan con puestos fijos en diferentes ferias que se realizan en el Alto pero la mas importante y donde la mayoría se concentra es la feria 16 de julio participando con la venta  de producto que ellas mismas elaboran o también revendiendo productos obtenidos a bajos precios. Ellas necesitan el crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo y surtir sus mercaderías, la competencia que tienen por el sector donde trabajan es accesible para una buena venta por que la zona mencionada esta alejada del centro de la ciudad, por lo que las señoras o vecinas prefieren hacer su mercado en la misma zona y como cuentan con ferias diarias es mucho mas factible el movimiento de sus producto y obtener mayores ingresos.
Este grupo ingresa a su quinto ciclo, cumpliendo con responsabilidad y puntualidad en su pagos  por lo que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda su confianza.
texts.en:
The “San Nicolás” community bank is comprised of twelve members. Among them there is one man, a locksmith. The San Nicolás community bank members entered their fifth loan cycle. They have met all of the obligations agreed upon in the contract they signed with Agrocapital. Many of the members work as crafts people. Some of them weave blankets, make macrame, and sell supplies on credit and for cash. Some of the members have fixed stalls in different fairs in El Alto. The most important, and where most of them assemble, is the 16th of July fair. They sell products they make themselves or resell products at low prices. They need a loan to augment their working capital and stock their merchandise. The competition that they have in the sector where they work is open for a good sale because they are far from the center of the city. The women and neighbors prefer to do their marketing in the same zone. Because they rely on daily fairs, it is easier to move their products and get better income. This group is in its fifth loan cycle. The Agrocapital foundation trusts them because they make their payments responsibly and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Isabel Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Irenia del Carmen L., Ignacia  de los Santos P. y Flora Isabel S. A..

 Este grupo tiene su domicilio en  la ciudad de Masaya en comarca Las conchitas, estas tres mujeres tienen actividades comerciales diferentes, se conocen desde hace muchos años y tienen una gran confianza una en la otra. 

Doña Irenia vende perecederos en el mercado de Masaya, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene un hijo de 12 años que va a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.

Doña Ignacia es la coordinadora del grupo, ella tiene un puesto de perecederos en el mercado donde ofrece productos como: chayotes,  ayotes , sandías etc., sueña con terminar la casa que están construyendo en terreno propio y muy pronto trasladarse a vivir ahí.
No tiene dependientes ni esposo, ella vive con su mamá y se propone hacer crecer el negocio para salir adelante.

Doña María Isabel al igual que las otras dos se dedica a la misma actividad, ella es la más joven y tiene tres hijos pequeños, vive con su esposo y están terminando de comprar un terreno para un día construir su casa.
Ella invierte el crédito en comprar verduras que vienen de la zona norte del país.

Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.
texts.en:
Photograph from left to right: Irenia del Carmen L., Ignacia de los Santos P. and Flora Isabel S. A.. This group is domiciled in the city of Masaya, in the Las Conchitas region. These three women undertake different commercial activities, have known each other for many years, and have great confidence in each other. Irenia sells perishables in the market of Masaya. She sells fruit that she buys at wholesale, and then sells at retail during the day. She has one son who is 12 years old and in school. Her husband is a merchant at the same market, where they transport their products, and helps with the household expenses. She has dedicated herself from a young age to her commercial activities, and she plans to make her business grow so she can one day make improvements to her house. Ignacia is the coordinator of the group, and has a stand of perishable goods at the market where she offers products such as: chayotes, ayotes, watermelons, etc. She dreams of finishing the home they are building on land they own, and move there very soon to live. She has no dependents or husband. She lives with her mother, and she proposes to make her business grow so she can get ahead. María Isabel dedicates herself to the same activity as the others. She is the youngest member, and has three small children. She lives with her husband, and they are completing the purchase of some land where they can one day build their house. She invests her loan into purchasing vegetables that come from the northern part of the country. They express that Adim has taught them how to better manage their businesses utilizing the help they receive, and also how to advance on a personal level. It is hoped that this financing will allow them to benefit from access to electrical power, which will help improve their standard of living and afford them part of the evening hours to tend to household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Chinie

texts.en:
Chinie S. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Chinie is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Chinie owns & operates a business selling beverages including fruit juices & soft drinks in the local community. Chinie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Chinie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Chinie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used as additional working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Chinie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa trabaja vendiendo chamarras, carteras en su puesto, su esposo es chofer taxista.
Vive en la zona D. Irpavi II D. la ciudad D. La Paz, en casa D. sus suegros.
El crédito será destinado para capital D. trabajo ( compra D. mercadería chamarras, carteras).
Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo D. Kiva.
Es una persona responsable por lo cual le califica como cliente bueno en el pago D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosa sells jackets and wallets in her stand. Her husband is a taxi driver. She lives in the Irpavi II area in the city of La Paz in the house of her in-laws. The loan will be used for capital for her business, to buy merchandise like jackets and wallets. This is the seventh time that she has requested a loan from Impro and the third time that she has requested the support of Kiva. She is a responsible person, who qualifies as a good client in terms of making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for investment

loans.name: Anielka De La Concepcion

texts.es: Anielka de la Concepción G. D. tiene 24 años. A pesar de su corta edad Anielka ha obtenido cierta experiencia en su negocio, lo que le ha dado el empeño necesario para salir adelante. Es una digna actividad que nace hace 3 años. Porque esto se lo enseño su Mama. Y fue con el paso del tiempo que Anielka le tomo cariño a su actividad económica como es la venta de cosmeticos y fue así que decide seguir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, body y pinturas de uñas. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle condiciones a su vivienda, para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Anielka de la Concepción G. D. is 24 years old. In spite of her young age, Anielka has already gained significant experience in her business, which gives her the incentive to get ahead. Anielka sells cosmetics for a living. She began her business three years ago after her mother taught her how to and has grown to love it. The loan is for working capital to buy perfumes, creams, and nail polish. She would love to be able to make improvements to her home so she can continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing cassava

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth E. is from the city of Pagadian. She is 37 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities

In 2008, Lilibeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,800 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lilibeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, tiene 39 años de edad, esta divorciada de su esposo, es madre de familia de 4 hijos mayores de edad, todos  independientes, ellos la ayudan a seguir adelante. Se dedica a preparación y venta de juanes (arroz envuelto en hojas), ella vende sus productos en una empresa de transportes, también se dedica a vender prendas de vestir, para esto cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas quien vende para ella. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace 9 años, empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de insumos para vender comida. 
Este crédito de 1800 soles, piensa invertirlo en mercadería como son sábanas, toallas, edredones  y algunas prendas de vestir.  La meta de Reyna es tener un restaurante bien implementado .
texts.en:
Reyna is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial woman. She is 39 years old and is divorced from her husband. She is the mother of 4 adult children who are all independent from her and all help her out. Her business is making and selling juanes (rice wrapped in leaves). She sells her product at a bus company. She also sells clothing items with the help of one of her daughters, who sells them for her. She has been a member of the “Las Heroínas” communal bank for 9 years. She started with a loan of 300.00 PEN, which she invested in ingredients for the food she sells. This loan is for 1,800.00 PEN. She plans to invest it in merchandise such as sheets, towels, blankets, and some clothing items. Reyna’s goal is to have a well-run restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sheets, towels, blankets, and some clothing items.

loans.name: Havila Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Havila  está conformado por Yahosca Evienig M. R., Olga Marina R. R. y Ana María C. A., ellas son del barrio san Judas de Managua. 

Yahosca Evienig M. R. de 23 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella comenzó comprando pequeñas piezas de ropa para luego venderlas, hoy en día  compara al por mayor ya sea docenas o cajas de ropa mixta. Su meta es tener su propio tramo en el mercado.


Las otras integrantes del grupo son Olga Marina R. Rodríguez ella vende cosméticos de belleza, mientras Ana María C. A. comercializa cosméticos y vende comedida en su casa.
texts.en:
The Havila Group is comprised of Yahosca Evienig M. R., Olga Marina R. Rodríguez, and Ana María C. A.. They are from the San Judas de Managua neighborhood. Yahosca Evienig M. R., 23, is the coordinator of the group. She started buying small pieces of clothing to later sell. She now buys wholesale by the dozen or in boxes of mixed clothing. Her goal is to have her own space in the market. Another member of the group, Olga Marina R. Rodríguez, sells cosmetics. Ana María C. A., a group member, sells cosmetics and sells food in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy styles of clothing

loans.name: Embajadores 3 Group

texts.en:
Zoraida is the coordinator of her group Embajadores (Ambassadors). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) clients more generally. Her group is based in the area surrounding La Romana where the economy centers around the sugarcane harvest. Running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home with her four children as a single mother.

She is excited to take her first loan with Esperanza and we are excited to see her business grow. Her business plan is to improve her already existing business selling underwear to the women in her community. She plans to purchase 12 pairs of panties and 12 brassieres of varying styles. She will use the extra money to continue improving her home and saving towards her goal of having a "fantasia" (store that sells various products that cater towards women). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Underwear and Brassieres to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Lady

texts.es: La señora Lady  es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 35 años y es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura. Lady se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas, actividad que lo realiza en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Carmen Cabrejos” desde hace tres años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de golosinas para vender en su casa. Actualmente requiere un crédito de 2500 soles que será utilizado para comprar mercadería como prendas de vestir y zapatos, que los traerá de la ciudad de Lima para vender en Pucallpa. La meta de Lady es  tener una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida en su casa.
texts.en:
Lady is an active and hard working member, who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 35 years old and has four young children. She has the support of her husband who works in agriculture. Lady sells drinks and candy, a job she does from home. She has been a member of the "Carmen Cabrejos" communal bank for three years. The first loan she obtained was 300 soles which she used to purchase candy to sell from home. Currently she requires a 2500 soles credit that will be used to purchase merchandise like clothing and shoes, which she will bring from Lima to the city of Pucallpa. Lady's goal is to have a well stocked grocery store at home.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase clothing and shoes in Lima

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel G. de 43 años está casada con el señor Jorge Isacc Morales él es policía y su salario no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos. Es entonces que ella decide abrir su propio negocio y empieza a  vender ropa de esta manera contribuye en el hogar y es más independiente.  
Isabel invertirá el crédito la compra de mercadería de ropa tanto en trajes, pantalones, camisas, ropa de niño, ropa interior etc.
texts.en:
Isabel G. is 43 years old and married. Her husband, Jorge Isacc Morales, is a policeman and his salary is not sufficient to cover the expenses. This is why Isabel has decided to open her own business and begin to sell clothes to contribute to the household and to be more independent.

Isabel will invest this loan in buying clothes such as dresses, pants, shirts, children's clothes, underwear etc. for merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm S., 49, is a widow and lives with one of her children in the Battambang province. To earn a living, she selling rice and dessert and makes about $5 profit a day.  She is also aided by her child who operates a moto-taxi business. On average, he makes $2.50 a day.  Morm would like to take out a loan of $500 to rebuild her stand and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Rebuild stand and reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity W. T. is thirty-nine years old, is married, and has three children. Her husband is a taxi driver and their children are in school.

Charity’s business is located at Eastleigh in Nairobi where she engages in selling tailoring accessories to the local tailors. Previously she was selling materials for making ladies’ dresses and had a dream to supply tailoring accessories in future.

Charity’s major challenge is her products not being able to move as fast as she would like because of the escalating prices. As such she is using her loan to expand her business to reach more tailors to increase her income. She also hopes to give her children an education to university level. She is hardworking and calm.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring accessories

loans.name: Camila

texts.en:
Camila A. is from the village of Fatima. She is 58 years old. Camila is widowed and has seven grown children. To make a living, Camila owns and operates a business, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Camila has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $113 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Camila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Camila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Camila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.es:
Eudomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito D. Mostaza.
Eudomilia es casada y tiene 65 años, Eudomilia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Eudomilia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. bebidas, golosinas y arroz.
texts.en:
Eudomilia, 65, is a member of the Granito D. Mostaza (Little Mustard Seed) communal bank. She is married and runs a store in her home where she sells groceries and beverages every day. Eudomilia needs a 2000 sol loan to buy beverages, sweets and rice.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, sweets and rice.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en: This group has four people who live in Pongro village in Takeo province. Mrs. Keo K. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. The group members will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns 3-hectares of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family's living. Her husband, Mr. Sok Horn, is a duck breeder. This family has a problem in the rice field, because their farming is with infertile soil and they do not have money to improve it. Thus, Mrs. Keo K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of a child who is too small to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mrs. So R. owns a machine that she uses to squeeze sugar cane juice, which she sells to the people for a profit. From this business she earns approximately $1.50 a day, which she uses to solve the family’s financial problems. She has a life partner in her husband (he appears in the photo), who owns a few pieces of equipment to provide a vehicle repair service, earning $10 each day. So R.’s husband requires more vehicle repair equipment to perform a good service, but he doesn’t have cash yet. Therefore, So R. is requesting a loan to buy the required articles. The couple are the parents of six children.

loans.use: To buy vehicle repair equipment.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Mrs. Isabel L. is from the village of Banisilon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old, married and blessed with 3 adult children. She owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for more than 4 years, earning 3,200 PHP monthly from her business. In 2000, she joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the said co-op. She's availing herself of her 8th loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP which will be used for house repairs. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°14 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba Seck, pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Ainsi, le sous groupe Femme Commerçantes N°14 est composée de 5 femmes qui habitent dans un même quartier Cité Lamy de Thiès. Il est dirigé par Madame Coumba N., une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est, en effet, vendeuse de produits de mer (poissons séchés, poissons fumés, crustacés…) depuis 9 ans. Mère de six enfants, Madame Coumba N. entend comme ses collègues, s’approvisionner en marchandises avec sa part du crédit. Ses collègues sont entre autre Madame Coumba Aïcha S. vendeuse d’habits pour enfants depuis 5 ans, Madame Sokhna N.  qui gère sa propre table de légumes chez elle, Madame Diaretou B. commerçante ambulante d’habits unisex et Madame Fatou N.  trésorière du sous groupe et vendeuse de mil, pain de singe et bissap (oseille)
texts.en:
The group “Femmes Commerçantes” (F.C.), as its name indicates, is a network of women who are active in commerce. It is based in Grand Thiès and was founded in 1992 by Ms. Maty Niakh, the network’s current president. She got the idea of forming the network after participating in a training session run by the NGO OXFAM in Thiès. She is therefore quite knowledgeable about group management, entrepreneurship, etc. The network members are extremely devoted and meet once a month.  Beyond a membership fee, each member must pay 200 francs CFA monthly into a solidarity fund. Desiring financing, they decided to join U-IMCEC. This is why their network was split into nineteen sub-groups of five persons each to ensure a better profit outcome. For the second time, they are requesting a loan of 100,000 francs per member, that is 500,000 francs per sub-group, to develop their various businesses. However, payments are made at the monthly meetings to the group president, assisted by the group treasurer, Ms. Coumba Seck, who are then responsible for reimbursing U-IMCEC. In the words of its president, the network has only one single, noble objective: to fight family poverty. The network currently numbers nineteen sub-groups, each with its own president and treasurer. Desiring financing, they decided to join U-IMCEC. This is why their network was split into nineteen sub-groups of five persons each to ensure a better profit outcome. For the second time, they are requesting a loan of 100,000 francs per member, that is 500,000 francs per sub-group, to develop their various businesses. However, payments are made at the monthly meetings to the group president, assisted by the group treasurer, Ms. Coumba Seck, who are then responsible for reimbursing U-IMCEC. In the words of its president, the network has only one single, noble objective: to fight family poverty. The network currently numbers nineteen sub-groups, each with its own president and treasurer. Thus, the sub-group Femme Commerçantes N°14 is composed of five women who live in the same district, Cité Lamy of Thiès.  The group is headed by Ms. Coumba N., a 41-year-old woman.  She has in fact been a vendor of seafood products (dried fish, smoked fish, shellfish...) for nine years.  The mother of six children, she intends, as her colleagues are doing, to supply herself with merchandise with her share of the loan.  Her colleagues include Ms. Coumba Aïcha S., a vendor of children's clothing for five years; Ms. Sokhna N., who has her own table of vegetables at her home; Ms. Diaretou B., an itinerant merchant selling unisex clothing; and Ms. Fatou N., the treasurer of the group and a vendor of millet, monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree) and bissap (dried hibiscus flowers). 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Sabali Kagni Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe SABALIKAGNI sont toutes mariées,  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames  à Siekourani un village de la sous préfecture de LOULOUNI   région de Sikasso 3 e région du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’agrandir leurs activités et leur chiffre d’affaire. 
Ce groupe de femme fait le commerce de céréales, d’habillements, de fruits et légumes, de condiments et des tubercules tels l’igname avec  avec Mariam Konaté.
