MARIAM K. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  30 sacs de 50 kg  d’igname. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Loulouni et  dans les foires des villages voisins. 
L’igname est  revendu en détail au marché de Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.. 
 Elle  envisage   réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités commerciales.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Sabalikagni group are all married with two children each, and an average age of 37. They mainly live in polygamous families in Siekourani, a village in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, Sikasso - the third largest region in Mali. They are on their third collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, with the aim of boosting business activities and revenue. The group members, such as Mariam Konaté, sell cereals, clothes, fruit and vegetables, condiments and tubers such as yams. She aims to use her loan to purchase thirty 50kg bags of yams; her goods are sourced from the Loulouni market and from the neighbouring villages. The yams are sold for cash at the Loulouni market to a male and female customer base. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA - a proportion of this will be saved for social ends and the rest re-invested in the business.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchasing yams

loans.name: Sosan Yaqoobi Group

texts.en:
Ziba is the daughter of M. H. and the leader of the Sosan Yaqoobi group. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, and is 75 years old. She is married and has six children, three daughters and three sons. She has a needlework business and works in her own home. Ziba has been involved in this business for more than three years. Now she would like to expand her business and buy necessary items such as a frame, etc. for her needlework business.

Therefore, she has requested a loan for this purpose. She is very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy necessary items such as a frame, etc. for her needlework business

loans.name: Eliud

texts.es:
El señor Eliud  R. y su familia están agradecidos por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual podo terminar la construcción.
Están solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto al frente de la casa ya que lo quieren acondicionarles para un estudio, ya que desean ponerles a sus dos pequeños hijos un lugar privado para que realicen las tareas de la escuela.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes en el área de documentado.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Olga Lidia Pérez esposa del señor Elidid R., ya que el se encontraba en su empleo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Eliud and his family are very appreciative of their previous loan which helped finish construction. He is requesting a loan for the construction of a room in the front of the house, which he wants to set up as a private space for his children to complete their schoolwork. He plans to pay back his loan with his income from his job at a transportation company. The person in the photo is Eliid's wife, Olga Lidia Pérez, as he was working the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to construct a home in the front of his house

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 34 años, enviudó hace 3 años, y vive solo con sus dos pequeños hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 6 años cultiva café, plátano, maíz y frutas cítricas, en sus terrenos propios y también en algunos arrendados. Labora con la ayuda de operarios, quienes mantienen limpias sus chacras, y de esta manera puede obtener una cosecha a tiempo. Aprendió las técnicas de la agricultura, gracias  a las enseñanzas de su padre, que según refiere, no quería que su hija dependa de ningún varón. Y lo que más le gusta de su oficio es comercializar sus cosechas en los mercados de la ciudad donde vive, porque siempre ahorra el dinero que gana, por ello con esfuerzo  compró los bienes que ahora tiene. Como es una mujer emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado plantar en mayor cantidad café y plátanos.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y desde sus primeras reuniones asegura que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, porque le han  incentivado en el ahorro, además aprende nuevas actividades con las constantes charlas educativas.Karina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en pagar a operarios, para que limpien las  dos hectáreas de terreno que compró, además adquirirá  dos bolsas de abono que necesita para asegurar sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Karina, age 34, was widowed three years ago. She lives alone with her two small children in her own house. For six years she has been growing coffee, bananas, corn, and citrus fruits on her own fields. She also has some rented fields. She works with the help of workers who keep the fields on her farm cleared. That way she is able to get her harvest on time. She learned farming techniques thanks to her father’s lessons. He did not want his daughter dependent upon any man. What she likes most about her occupation is selling the harvests in the markets in the city where she lives. She saves the money that she earns. With effort she bought the possessions that she now has. As an enterprising woman she plans to later plant a greater quantity of coffee and bananas. This is her first loan with MFP. Ever since her first meeting she was sure that she liked working with her communal bank. She likes it because they have given incentives to save. Also, she learns new activities with the ongoing educational talks. Karina plans to use the requested money to pay for the workers to clear two hectares of land that she bought. She will also get two bags of fertilizer, which she needs to assure her next crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pay laborers to improve her crops

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday G. is currently in the business of selling weaving materials and treating hair at the beauty salon and is requesting a loan to stock more weaving materials.  Sunday is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has one child who does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more hair weaving materials

loans.name: María Violeta

texts.es:
María Violeta tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Tranca Sasape del distrito de Mórrope, lugar caracterizado por encontrarse conformado por un pueblo central en donde se concentra todo el comercio y por varios caseríos aledaños en donde vive gente humilde y muy trabajadora, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, gracias a esta actividad ayuda asu esposo a solventar los gastos familiares. Actualmente ella cría aves de corral en un ambiente instalado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

María desea adquirir aves pequeñas para ampliar su negocio y alimento balanceado para terminar de criarlas de modo que pueda captar mas ingresos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir apoyando a su esposo para que sus hijos puedan seguir adelante. En la zona donde viven ella es conocida por ser una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Maria Violeta is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Tranca Sasape area of the district of Mórrope, a place with a characteristic form, with a center city where all the business is concentrated and various neighboring clusters of houses where the common, hard-working people live. The region is part of the province of Lambayeque and is located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Maria raises and sells small animals. Thanks to this activity she helps her husband pay their family expenses. Now she is raising barn-yard fowl in a space at the back part of her house. When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the business people who always visit the area where she lives. Maria wants to acquire small birds to increase her business and balanced feed to complete raising them in such a way that she can get more income. For this reason, she has applied for the first time to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 PEN, which will help her reach her goal. Maria is an ambitious and hard-working woman. Her greatest desire is to continue helping her husband so that their children can advance. In the area where she lives, she is known to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small birds and balanced feed to increase her business of raising and selling poultry

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto se dedica a la pesca artesanal hace ya varios años, el vive en casa con su esposa, no tiene hijos en edad escolar, el sueña con poder implementar su negocio de la pesca, para lo cual debe comprar redes que le permitan realizar su actividad y tener mayores ingresos y asi poder darle a su esposa una mejor calida de vida, se le otorga el crédito por contar con capacidad de pago y buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Roberto has worked as a small-scale fisherman for several years now. He lives in a house with his wife, and they do not have children of school age. He dreams of being able to expand his fishing business. For this purpose, he needs to buy nets that would let him do his work, earn a better income, and thus give his wife a better quality of life. The loan has been offered to him because he has shown that he has the ability to pay and good personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying nets for his fishing business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria T. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 54 years old, married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as noodles, soap, and shampoo in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victoria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Señora G. de 38 Años es casada con el señor Octaviano Calel Madre de 6 hilos es muy trabajadora, trabaja en la elaboracion de trajesitos para bebe y luego le surgio la idea de elaborar telas para bardar guipiles para eso compro un telar de pedal para tejer telas y venderlos por mayor, toda su familia trabaja y le apoya en su negocio, se siente feliz porque su deceo es promocionar de varias formas su negocio y poder vender a otros lugares ella sueña con tener a sus hijos profecionales y tener une bonita casa, le agradece a Dios Y a fape por brindarle su apoyo con el credito
texts.en:
G. is 38 years old and is married to Octaviano Calel. She is the mother of six and is a very hard working woman. She makes baby clothing and someone has suggested that she weave cloth to make guipiles (a type of blouse); this is why she bought a foot powered loom, so that she can weave cloth and sell it for a profit. Her entire family works for and supports her business and she is happy because her desire is to promote the various forms of her business and be able to sell in other locations. She wants her children to have professional careers and to have a nice house. She is thankful to God for giving her support and help with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cloth

loans.name: Kat

texts.en: Kat S., 56, is married and lives with her husband and two of her children in Takeo province. Since 1990, she has been making and selling brooms at the local market, typically earning a profit of US$1 every day. Her husband stays at home and helps her make brooms to sell. Two of her children are employed as garment factory workers. Since her children spend a lot on transportation, Kat S. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.en:
Rahmon is a businessman who successfully combines running his business and taking care of his family of three people. He has two children. Rahmon is originally from Isfara, a city in the south of Tajikistan. He started his business 15 years ago, after a desperate period of unemployment when his family didn’t get enough for their most basic needs. Today, he offers his services as a woodworker. Rahmon has a perfect credit history. He has already repaid one loan from IMON International without any delinquencies. This time, Rahmon is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase wood products like bold timber, plank timber for his production. We believe this loan will also be repaid promptly. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of wood products like bold timber, plank timber for his production.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been in the modeling industry for over 20 years and has turned that experience into a successful business. After four years of building her business, she has cultivated successful relationships with several large corporations and expanded her business into nine different states. Her modeling business has also received several minority awards and has become a staple of the Atlanta community. 

Rose originally approached ACCION USA when commercial banks were not willing to give her loans and she did not want to see four years of successful small business destroyed. This is Rose’s second loan from ACCION USA. She used her previous loan to help her gain new business, especially after several of her contracts were pulled due to the downturn in the economy. She will use this loan to provide her business with a cushion so she can focus on rebuilding many old contracts and pursuing new and exciting ventures. 

Rose is very proud of her business and has worked very hard to achieve the status her agency currently enjoys. She looks forward to growing into the future and continuing to build her reputation as a formidable businesswoman. 

Also take a look at Rose’s website http://www.umodelinc.com

loans.use: To rebuild contracts and expand into new contracts

loans.name: Yaneth Karina

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas II”, ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y no tiene hijos, la señora tiene estudios de educación superior completa.

Yaneth viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 meses,  nos cuenta que su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de calzados.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar insumos para su negocio de venta de calzados.
	
Su sueño es tener una empresa más grande y tener maquinarias para la fabricación.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el apoyo entre socias.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a member of the "Mujeres Activas II" community bank, located in the Juliaca district, San Roman province, Puno department. She is 23 years old, lives with her boyfriend and does not have children. She has completed her higher education studies.

Yaneth has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six months. She tells us that her initial loan was for 500 new soles that was used to increase the capital for her business selling shoes.

She will request a new loan of 800 new soles, which will be used to buy stock for her shoe-selling business.

Her dream is to have a larger business and have fabrication machines.

What she likes most about her community bank is the ease of the loan and support among members.

loans.use: Buy stock for her business selling shoes.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva tiene 54 años, vive con el menor D. sus 6  hijos en su casa propia. DesD. que era niña a aprendido todo las técnicas agrarias, desD. entonces siembra hortalizas, verduras pero principalmente la papa y el maíz, que son productos que más venD.. Su trabajo es diario pero con el paso D. los años se ha dado cuenta que la compra y venta D. animales es un negocio es muy rentable, esta actividad complementa sus ingresos, ya que debe tomar tiempo D. espera hasta que sus productos estén listos para la cosecha, así que los fines D. semana lleva a vender estos animales a feria ganadera y lo que no llega a vender lo lleva a su establo que lo utiliza para su propio consumo. Durante estos años D. trabajo ha visto que la venta D. animales tiene menores riesgos y mayores ganancias por lo que su deseo es incrementar su capital D. trabajo e intensificar en la crianza D. animales. Es el crédito número 7 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más animales como cerdos y ovejas.
texts.en:
Elva is 54 years old.  She lives with the youngest of her 6 children in her own home.  She started learning agricultural techniques when she was a little girl.  Since that time, she has been growing vegetables; some greens but mainly potatoes and corn which are the products which sell most.  Her work is daily but over the years she has come to realize that the buying and selling of animals is a very profitable business.  This activity complements her income since it takes time for her crops to be ready for harvest.  On weekends she sells her animals at the livestock market and what she doesn't manage to sell she takes home to her stable and uses it for her own consumption.  Over her  working life, she has seen that the sale of animals has less risks and makes more profits.  For this reason, she would like to increase her working capital and put more time and effort into raising animals.

This is Elva's 7th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She would also like to thank everybody who helps fund her loan because it will be very useful for her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more animals such as pigs and sheep.

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep

loans.name: Fredesman

texts.es:
Fredesman es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja como agricultor.

El desea adquirir alimentos para sus aves ya que la demanda aumenta durante la temporada navideña, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Fredesman es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Fredesman, 32, is a father living with his wife and two children in Hualtaco, part of the agricultural Tambogrande district, an agricultural area located in Piura region more than four hours from Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

He raises small farm animals and barnyard fowl.  He raises chickens, ducks, and turkeys in his back yard and when they reach a proper level of growth he sells them to merchants who visit his place of residence.  He also works as a farmer.

He wants to acquire feed for his fowl because demand for them rises during the Christmas season.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan.

Fredesman is a father who is quite devoted to his family and is always watchful of their wellbeing and development.  People who know him hold him in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: To buy fowl feed.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a sus padres en el caserío Cruz del Médano del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola poblada principalmente por personas humildes y trabajadoras. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque.

Ella trabaja confeccionando prendas de vestir, las cuales son solicitadas por un comerciante que suele visitar la zona en donde vive realizando pedidos y recogiendo la mercadería una vez que esté lista. El negocio demanda mucha creatividad y paciencia y ella los realiza con mucho gusto, para realizarlo tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Susana desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más materiales como hilos y telas para poder cumplir con algunos pedidos pendientes, asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Susana is 25 years old.  She is married and lives with her parents in the village of Cruz del Médano, in Mórrope district, an agricultural area whose residents are mainly modest and hard-working people.  The area is located in Lambayeque province.

Susana makes clothes which are requested by a salesman who usually visits the area where she lives making orders and collect the merchandise once it is ready.  Her business requires a lot of creativity and patience and she enjoys her work a lot.  She has a small workshop in her home.  Susana also raises and sells animals.  She uses the profits that she makes from these activities to cover her personal expenses and help her family to get ahead.

Susana would like to expand her business, acquiring more materials such as thread and fabric so that she can fill some pending orders.  She would also like to acquire balanced animal feed to expand her business raising and selling animals.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand her dressmaking business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 34 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Luis de 36 años y sus 2 pequeñas hijas; juntos se esfuerzan mucho por salir adelante. Hace más de 4 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la fabricación de polos y estampados en prendas de vestir, en el taller que tiene en su casa. En su negocio  produce junto a su hermana y esposo, es por esta razón que esta  muy satisfecha pues vende los polos al por mayor a los grandes emporios comerciales de la ciudad, y obtiene regulares ganancias. Para el futuro tiene pensado ampliar el negocio, pues algún día sueña con empezar  a exportar sus prendas, pues sabe que son de alta calidad. Lo que no le gusta de su labor es que a veces le falta material para cumplir con tanta demanda que tiene. Además paralelamente durante las mañanas se dedica a la enseñanza  en una escuela de educación inicial ubicada por su zona, y también recibe un pago mensual por el desempeño como profesora. Es el 12avo  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Ana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de tela, que necesita para continuar fabricando sus polos; pues tiene un gran pedido por concretar. Además invertirá en la compra de algunos materiales educativos que necesita para implementar mejor el colegio donde trabaja.
texts.en: Ana, 34 years old, lives in her own home with her husband Luis, 36 and their 2 young daughters; together they work hard to get ahead. More than 4 years ago, this enterprising woman started making polo shirts and printed clothing, in the workshop that she has in her home. In her business she works with her sister and husband, this is why she is very satisfied when she sells polo shirts wholesale to the big department stores in the city, and earns regular profits. In the future she is thinking of expanding the business, as one day she dreams of beginning to export her garments, as she knows they are of high quality. What she doesn't like about her job is that sometimes she lacks the material to fulfill everything with such the demand that she has. In addition in parallel during the mornings she teaches at a school for pre-school education located in her area, and she also receives a monthly payment for her duties as a teacher. This is the 12th loan that she has had with MFP and she promises to make her repayments punctually, as she doesn't want to lose face with the people who are making this support possible which will allow her to continue working in search of progress. Ana has plans to invest the requested loan in purchasing material, which she needs to continue making her polo shirts; as she has a big order to fulfill. In addition she will buy some educational materials that she needs to improve her resources at the school where she works.

loans.use: To buy more material to keep making polo shirts.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina E. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 60 years old. Segundina is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Segundina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting, and selling fruits and vegetables, such as onions. Segundina has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Segundina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Segundina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Segundina is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be her 12th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Teresa Del Carme

texts.es:
Teresa del Carme A. Vda. D. P. D. 34 habita en Cuscatancingo, municipio D. Mejicanos en San Salvador, es dueña D. una tienda y una librería que funciona en su casa adonD. vive con sus dos hijos, hace dos meses su esposo falleció quien ayudaba con los ingresos del hogar, ahora toda esta responsabilidad recae en ella.
Es una persona solidaria con su comunidad y ayuda al hospital San Rafael dando clases D. manualidades. 
EL motivo del préstamo es para su tienda y poder con esto comprar mas productos y víveres, ya que pretenD. agrandarla mas al igual que  agregar mas producto para su librería y tener mas materiales para realizar sus manualidad y seguir ayudando a la comunidad y tener mas ingresos para su familia e hijos que aun se encuentran estudiando.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen A. Widow of P. is 34 and she lives in Cuscatancingo, in the municipality of Mejicanos in San Salvador. She is the owner of a convenience and bookstore that she has installed in her house. She lives with her two children. Two months ago her husband passed away and he helped with the expenses for their home. But now that responsibility rests entirely on her. 

She is a person who is very committed to her community, helping the San Rafael hospital by giving artisan classes.

She needs the loan for her store, to purchase more products and groceries. She plans on expanding the store in order to add more products to the bookstore section and to have more crafting articles. She plans on keeping up her community involvement and to earn more income for her family and children who are still in school.

loans.use: To purchase general groceries for resale.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman H. is 44 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and three children, aged 19, 17, and 15. He has always been a responsible father who works hard to provide his family a secure and happy life. 

Mehman owns and operates a store, selling a variety of different home products in Sabirabad. He has ten years of experience selling household goods.  Currently, he earns approximately 400 AZN a month from his trading business. 

Mehman received a loan in amount of 1600 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva. This is his first loan, which was used to buy new goods for his store. After Mehman repays this loan, he plans to apply for more loans to grow his business and enlarge his store.

loans.use: To buy new goods for store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Buyantogtoh

texts.en: Buyantogtoh, 57, is married and lives with her husband and a son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. They enjoy a decent standard of living. She began selling foods in 2000 and now her business is more stable. Besides operating a food store, she sells groceries and commodities to the herders who live far from the city center, by traveling from one place to another in her car. Buyantogoth is a hardworking person with initiative who says: "I am trying to expand my business and increase my profits in order to help my son start his own life." She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to enlarge her food store and purchase more foods.

loans.use: To purchase more foods to sell

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique V. C. tiene 43 años, es viudo  vive  con un hijo en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que estan comenzando con esta actividad.

Luis Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique V. C. is 43 years old, widowed, and lives with his son in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS' community bank has 12 members.  It is located 20 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this group work in agriculture.  They mainly grow blackberries, tomatoes and corn.  The older members have been farming for more than 10 years whilst other members are just starting out in the business.

Luis Enrique is a farmer who grows blackberries, tomatoes and corn in large quantities.  He makes his purchases in Agro, in Chillanes and sells his produce on Sundays at Chillanes market.

Luis Enrique is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy some farmland.

Luis Enrique enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Natalia

texts.es:
Maria tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia,  que está ubicada en el caserío Luchadores Sociales en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua o luz.

María se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida y chicha de jora (una bebida típica de Perú a base de harina de maíz).  Vende su comida y bebidas a sus vecinos los viernes a lunes en su domicilio. También se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral pavos y gallinas contando con 11 pavos y 20 gallinas. Cría sus animales en la parte posterior de su casa. Los engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Tiene más de 4 años de experiencia en estos rubros. 

Desea usar su crédito para comprar más productos que usa en la preparación de su comida y chica y en la crianza de sus animales. Comprará una olla lo que la ayudará reducir el tiempo de la preparación de la chicha. También comprará más harina para la elaboración de la chica y alimentos balanceados para el engorde de los pavos y gallinas. Espera que sus animales logren un mayor tamaño y peso para luego venderlos a un mejor precio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Altnerativa. María desea seguir creciendo en su negocio y les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en esta meta.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives with her family in her own home which is located in the village of Luchadores Sociales in the District of Tambogrande.  This farming area is situated in Piura region and located more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Maria lives in the rural section of this district and does not receive basic services such as water or electricity.

Maria prepares and sells food and “chicha de jora” (a traditional Peruvian beverage made of cornmeal).  She sells food and beverages to her neighbors from Friday through Monday in her home.  Maria also raises poultry and currently has 11 turkeys and 20 chickens.  She raises her animals in an area behind her house.  Maria fattens the animals so that she can sell them later at the local market.  She has four years of experience in these business activities.

Maria wants to use this loan to buy more products that are used in preparing food and “chicha”, as well as for raising her animals.  She wants to buy a cauldron that will help her reduce the time required for preparing “chicha”.  Maria will also buy more cornmeal for preparing “chicha” and balanced feed for fattening her turkeys and chickens.  She hopes that her animals will reach a good size and weight so that she can sell them at a good price.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.  Maria wants to continue growing her business and expresses her gratitude to the Kiva lenders for their support that will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for preparing food and beverages as well as balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a 'ger',  aMongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His sons, age 10 and 12, attend local secondary school. He manages meat sales and used clothing trading businesses with the help of his wife.

 Batjargal himself is responsible for selling meat and meat products and his wife is responsible for selling used clothing. He started his meat trading business in 2003 and gained much experience. His business was quite successful which allowed him to start up the used clothing trading business in 2010. Even with one year of business operations, he has managed to stabilize his business and became well-known amongst his customers.

 Now he earns a daily profit of 10,000-15,000 MNT from his meat sales business and a monthly profit of 300,000 MNT from his used clothing business. He is a polite man who says, "I am planning to continue my businesses in the future." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more used clothes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nicodemus Leseiyio

texts.en:
Nicodemus Leseiyio O. W., 33, is married with two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years. 

He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to buy farming supplies, namely wheat seeds and also land preparations. With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

Nicodemus dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Hakikmo

texts.ru: Хакикмо жительница города Душанбе. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она имеет средне - специальное образование, портниха. Шьет национальные платья на заказ. Этим видом деятельности занимается 28 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Hakikmo lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 46 years old. Married, with three children. She has a technical education as a seamstress. She  sews made-to-order traditional outfits. She has been in this business for 28 years. She is taking out a loan in order to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife and three young children. He has been working as a DJ for the past 10 years. He is very popular and performs at big events and on special occasions. 

With his requested loan of $1200 he will purchase a new sound system. He says that he is in urgent need of getting an advanced sound system as he should get prepared for the summer season where there will be lots of events and occasions, especially weddings. In the future, he is planning to open his own store and sell different music instruments and all related accessories.

loans.use: purchase a new sound system.

loans.name: Norma Margoth

texts.es:
Norma Margoth tiene 38 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Sofía, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Norma se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz, frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y tener casa propia.

Le gusta hacer la limpieza en la casa.
texts.en:
Norma Margoth is 38 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The October 27th Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Recinto San Sofia, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank is composed of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Norma is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She buys her supplies in Ventanas each month and sells her products at the fair in the same location.

Norma is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include pests that can attack her crops. Her dreams include buying land and having her own house.

Norma enjoys cleaning house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson, a 49-year-old married father of four children, earns about PHP 32,000 per cropping season as a farmer working in the Philippines. Nelson has been growing rice for 20 years and is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers necessary for farming.  In the future, he hopes to generate more income to achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers necessary for farming.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Ruth has a poultry farm business that rears chickens, which she has run for one year.         
To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for resale.

loans.name: Toufaha

texts.en: Toufaha is 45-year-old married woman living with her husband. When the life expenses exceeded the family income, Toufaha decided to start her own business to support her family.  So, in 2008 she opened her own store where she started to sell women's accessories and perfumes to customers from her community. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory. In the future, she is willing to add more items to sell in her shop such as women's bags.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: La señora Leonarda tiene 61 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria por que sus padres no tenían los recursos para mandarla a la escuela ya que eran 11 hermanos. Ella es casada y vive sola con su esposo ya que sus hijos son casados. Doña Leo como de cariño le dice la gente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, perfumes y artículos para el hogar por catalogo desde hace 20 años, ella emprendió este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa  y dice que a ella le gusta lo que hace ya que así a conocido a mucha gente que le ofrece a sus productos, además ella a ayudado a mucha gente a tener un empleo através de su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catalogo y eso la llena de orgullo en su trabajo. Leonarda esta pidiendo a la financiera un crédito para comprar perfumes, cosméticos etc., que tiene ya pedidos por sus clientas y que no ha podido sacar por que no ha tenido capital para comprar y venderlos a sus clientas. La meta que tiene la señora Leo es poner un local estable ya que ha su edad ya se cansa de andar en las calles ofreciendo sus productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 61 years old.  She only completed sixth grade in elementary school because her parents did not have the resources to send her to school because they were eleven siblings.  She’s married and lives alone with her husband because her children are married.  

Doña Leo, as people affectionately call her, has been selling cosmetics, perfumes and items for the home via catalogue sales for the last 20 years.  She started the business to help her husband cover household expenses and she says that she enjoys it because she’s met lots of people that way that she sells her products to.  Besides, she’s been able to help a lot of people to have employment through the catalogue cosmetics sales business and this fills her with pride in her work.

Leonarda is asking for a loan to buy perfume, cosmetics, etc. that she has pending orders for from her customers and that she’s been unable to get for lack of capital to buy them and then resell to her customers.  Leo’s goal is to set up a stable locale because at her age it’s tiring to wander the streets offering her beauty products.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Pon, is a housewife. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, who earns an income of $6 per day. This couple has three children, all of them are working in the factory with the income of $8 per day for all. Every month, Pon has to spend $110 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy wood for rebuild her house. In the future, she wants to have a small tailoring shop at her house for her daughters so that they don’t have to traveling to work so far from home.

loans.use: To buy wood to rebuild her house

loans.name: Norma Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Norma Azucena vive en la aldea el Cerro de Marcovia, Norma es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada en toda su plenitud a lo que es elaboracion y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años en su casa de habitacion, Norma vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, por los cuales trabaja dia a dia para sacarlos adelante y darles una mejor calidad de vida, Norma todos los dias muy temprano se levanta para empezar la produccion de sus tortillas que realiza a diario.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña y cal, en estos momentos los pedidos de sus clientes han aumentado y no logra cumplirles a sus clientes en un 100%, es por eso que necesita comprar mas materia prima para tener una mayor produccion.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo y esta obteniendo mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Norma Azucena lives in the village of Cerro de Marcovia. Norma is a hardworking woman, fully dedicated to the making and selling of tortillas, an activity she has been doing for the last 8 years in her house. Norma lives with her husband and 2 children, for whom she works daily to raise them and give them a better quality of life. Norma gets up very early on a daily basis to start making her tortillas.

She will use the loan to burn corn, firewood and slaked lime. At the moment customer orders have increased and she cannot manage to fill the orders 100%. This to is why she needs more raw materials to increase production. 

She told us that she is very happy as her business is growing and her profits are greater.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and slaked lime.

loans.name: Minala

texts.en:
Minala is a 30-year-old married woman with two children in school. She has a business of selling breads in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. 

Minala requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her purchase more bread for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for resale.

loans.name: Xayyam

texts.ru:
Xayyam uje 5 let kak imeyet svoy magazin dlya prodaji produktov. On nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya prodaji, do etogo on prodoval tolko pishiviye produkti no seychas on xochet prodovat tak je i ne pisheviye tak kak v etom yest potrebnost sredi pokupateley.
On jenat no ne imeyet detey. Xayyam 41 qod. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione v posolke Araz Dilagarda vmeste so svoyey jenoy.
texts.en: Xayyam has owned a store, where he sells products, for five years.  He needs 2000 AZN to buy cleaning supplies for sale.  Up to now, he only sold food products, but now wants to also sell non-food products because he there is demand among his customers.  He is married, but does not have children.  Xayyam is 41 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Araz Dilagarda village of the Fuzuli region together with his wife.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Bett

texts.en:
Bett, 31, is married and has four children, two of whom are already in school. He has been in farming for eight years and currently employs one farmhand. He produces tea and milk for the local market. He also works as a tailor for additional income.

Bett has requested for a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his dairy business by buying an additional dairy cow. He says the extra income will help alleviate the family’s challenges in providing basic needs, especially for the children.

He adds that access to finances is the main challenge to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. Benson has been working hard to manage his tailoring shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Benson has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making clothes for resale. This will help Benson to generate greater profits and buy more cows for his farm. Benson hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another business and also build a house. 

Benson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Benson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hope Sisters Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Hope Sisters” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 800,000 SLL each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatu is the leader of this group. The 45-year-old is married and has six children, two of whom are in secondary and tertiary institutions. Fatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells market food – salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy market food – salt, margi, onions, etc. in wholesale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu has been selling water to her neighbors in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya for five years. The increase in population around where she stays has caused a high demand for water. She is married and has five children; three are in school. She also sells cooked food to her neighbors.
Saumu is therefore applying for a loan of Ksh 100,000 to buy more tanks and install pipes. Her main challenge in life has been the lack of capital, but she is proud of her association with Milango because she can now access credit to carry out business.  
Her aim is to build a restaurant in future as she believes this will help improve the living standard of her family while also enabling her to educate those in school.

loans.use: To buy more tanks and install pipes.

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Tsitsi from Harare, a widow with four children.  Tsitsi runs a manufacturing business making furniture. The business has been in operation for the past 19 years. She says the main challenges she faces are delayed payments from clients, as she sometimes gives credit to her clients or sell on a deposit payment basis.  

Tsitsi has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy boards, timber and glue. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her improve the standard of living for her family.  In the future, Tsitsi plans to own a showroom.

loans.use: to buy furniture-making materials

loans.name: Aluong

texts.en:
Aluong is 38-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. For three years, she has had a charcoal selling business in Bor, South Sudan.

Aluong is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from the loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.fr: Mathias est âgé de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Mathias est marié à une couturière du nom de Babine. Mathias a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Mathias exerce le métier de photographie dans sa région. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Mathias contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Mathias désire mieux équiper son atelier par l'acquisition de pellicules et autres articles nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son activité. Pour ce faire, Mathias sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Mathias a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Mathias is 31 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a clothier named Babine. Mathias left school at the primary grade level. The couple has two children, one of whom is in school. Both children are in their care. The couple jointly ensure that the various household expenses are covered. 

To help with the diverse needs of the family, Mathias has been working in the photography trade in his region. Thanks to the income this business generates, he is helping to cover the different family expenses. 

To satisfy the needs of his burgeoning customer base, Mathias would like to do better at equipping his workshop by acquiring some film and other necessary items for his business to operate properly. To do so, Mathias is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a second time. The loan previously received by Mathias was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy film and frames for photographs and some video cassettes

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en:
Kadii is a married woman.  She has three children ranging in age from four years to 10 years.  She describes herself as being honest and passionate about her work.  

She operates a retail stall where she sells snacks, like doughnuts.  She has been involved in this business for one year.  Her business is located at a viable market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.  Kadii will use this loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to purchase more snacks.  Her business goal is to run a big hotel within five years.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Anabela

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposo, quien se dedica s u trabajo como pescador y junto a sus tres maravillosos hijos, a quienes ama muchísimo y por quienes ha luchando mucho por sacarlos adelante. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y sobre todo tiene un don para la preparación de platillos típicos, ya que son muy deliciosos, también la ciudad de chincha posee playas hermosas y también se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho pasar un tiempo con su familia y en ocasiones le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”.

Día a día Rosa trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de artefactos, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá,  construir una pared alrededor de su casa para seguridad, asimismo podrá realizar mejoras en las paredes resquebrajadas, de esta manera ella podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida, con más seguridad y podrá seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.

loans.use: Para construccion de pared

loans.name: Anta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est constitué  de quinze femmes qui habitent le même village et ont comme principales activités l'agriculture et le commerce.

La représentante Ndéye a bénéficié de 8 prêts du compte externe qu'elle a toujours remboursé sans difficultés, elle est mariée âgée de 49 ans et mère de quatre enfants, deux filles et deux garçons.Elle s'active dans l'agriculture, l'embouche et le petit commerce.Elle a une bonne expérience dans ses domaines d'activités. Sur la photo elle est à droite habillée en boubou vert et a levé la main gauche.


Elle se ravitaille  en tissus, encens, chaussures, parfums....  pour revendre dans son village; avec l'approche de l'hivernage elle va aussi investir beaucoup plus dans les semences d'arachide et haricot.

Elle compte avec son prêt acheter des semences d'arachide et haricot pour une valeur de 100000 F, des moutons pour 50000 F et diverses marchandises pour un montant de 50000 F; pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Avec ses bénéfices elle aide son mari dans les charges familiales, renforce son épargne afin d'obtenir un prêt plus élevé.
texts.en:
This group consists of 15 women who live in the same village. Their main activities are agriculture and commerce.
The group’s representative, Ndéye, has had eight separate loans which she has repaid without issues. She is 49 years, married, and has four children: two girls and two boys. She  grows produce, raises livestock and works as  a vendor. She has a long work experience. In the photo, she is on the right wearing a green outfit and raising her left hand.

She stocks up on fabric, incense, shoes, perfume etc. at the markets of Guéoul and Louga in order to resell in her village. With the approaching raininy season, she will increase her investments in peanut and bean seeds. With her loan, she plans to  buy peanuts and bean seeds for 100,000 West African francs, sheep  for 50,000 francs and miscellaneous merchandise for 50,0000 francs; in this way, she will earn good revenues.
She uses her income to help her husband provide for family needs and also to boost her savings in order to be able to obtain larger loans.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening as well as seeds.

loans.name: Finess Group

texts.fr:
Agée de 55 ans, Kadia est une malienne mariée mère de 01 enfant et 02 petits fils âgée de 20 à 02ans dont 02 sont scolarisés, elle est alphabétisée en langue national  .Son marie est un cultivateur.
Kadia n’ayant pas assez de fonds pour le développement de son activité commercial à fait recourt à l’IMF pour avoir plus de fonds crédit pour exercer au mieux son activité commercial.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les foires local et urbaines en  utilisant les fonds pour acheter plus de :[ ballais, savon, condiments(épices)]et après leurs revendent aux comptants à des prix acceptables tout en possédant une méthode de vente  exceptionnel et rentable, elle exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans pour subvenir aux besoins familial tel que : la santé, l’éducation, et le revêtement .
Elle réalise un bénéfice prévisionnel  mensuel de 15000f soit  90000f par cycle de prêts.
 Kadia est la femme au milieu tenant entre ses mains les ballais, oignons, et une boite de tomate concentrée.

loans.use: Commerce de savon et épices pour la vente

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start Poultry farm

loans.name: Alougba

texts.en:
Born in Atiémé, Mrs. A. Alougba is married and a mother of six (06) children. Very early on her husband lost his job and she had to shoulder all the household responsibilities. Becoming the de facto head of the family she launched herself in looking for firewood from fallen trees to provide for her family’s needs. Avery courageous woman working with stamina and abnegation, she has been able to master and manage her business and she more or less makes it. Mrs. A. Alougba has a vast experience of managing loans, she has already obtained and reimbursed her 3 loans promptly and without incidents.

Today she is soliciting a loan of $800 to promote her business by purchasing and stocking firewood and by paying her woodcutters. This will allow her to increase her income to improve her living conditions and that of her family. The demand for this market is year round.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1956 à Atiémé, Madame A. Alougba est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Très tôt, son mari perd son emploi et toutes les charges du foyer reposent sur elle. Devenue chef de famille par la force des choses, elle se lança dans la recherche de bois de chauffage provenant de l’abattage des arbres qui ne produisent plus afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Femme très courageuse et travaillant avec endurance et abnégation, elle a su bien maîtriser et gérer son commerce par lequel elle s’en sort tant bien que mal. Madame A. Alougba a une large expérience dans la gestion des crédits après ses 3 crédits respectifs obtenus et remboursés promptement sans incidents.

Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 pour promouvoir son activité en achetant et stockant des bois et en payant ses ouvriers qui lui fendent le bois. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille. La demande pour ce marché est permanente.

loans.use:
Purchase and stock piling of firewood

Achat et stockage de bois de chauffe

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Mr. M. has a vulcanizer at his repair shop, and after more than four years he has not updated his equipment. "The tool I bought more than four years ago doesn't respond to the demands of today, which is why we need to bring it up to date. My brother and I can not make do with the lack of modern equipment, and that is why we need a loan of $1,200."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. M. tiene una vulcanizadora y a lo largo de 4 años no ha renovado su equipo de trabajo. "La herramienta que adquirí hace mas de 4 años ya no responde a las exigencias de hoy en día por lo que necesitamos actualizarnos, mi hermano y yo no damos batalla por la escasez de equipo moderno para esto necesitamos $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: Buy new parts for the vulcanizer at his repair shop.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty lives in her in-laws' house on Avenida Buenos Aires in the Lomas zone of the city of Paz with her husband and her son. She is 29 years old, and since marriage she has sold lubricants, sharing the workshop space with her father-in-law, who is a mechanic. The workshop is small but is growing little by little.

Betty asks for a loan to purchase more variety of product. This business is her only form of income, and she does not want to lose her clientele, especially since at the moment her husband attends school and she is the only one working.

Her previous history with Impro certifies her as a very good client and as someone who can access new credit. This is the third loan solicited by Betty, and the previous two were payed off by the stipulated dates of payment in the respective contracts.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Betty vive en la casa de sus suegros en la Avenida Buenos Aires de la zona de las Lomas de la ciudad de la Paz con su esposo y su hijo pequeño. Ella tiene 29 años de edad y desde que se caso se dedica a la venta de lubricantes compartiendo el taller con su suegro que es mecánico. El taller todavía es pequeño pero va creciendo poco a poco.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar mas producto y mas variado y no perder clientela ya que es su único ingreso de subsistencia por el momento ya que su esposo estudia y ella es la que trabaja

Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como muy buen cliente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita y los dos anteriores fueron cancelados de acuerdo a las fechas de pago estipuladas en los respectivos contratos.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of product and build capital

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia A. S. is a married woman living in Sharoun with her family and her 4 children. Fadia used to sell cosmetic products from door to door. When this activity ended, she started knitting and doing crochet, skills she learned from her mother at age 15. She either sells her work at home or she passes her creations to a woman in charge of selling them. Fadia needs to buy the necessary materials and accessories to sustain and gradually develop her small business.

Fadia is part of a group with 5 other women from the same village. Her group's name is 'A. Eman' which means faith. The requested loan is for this group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. Group lending is based on incrementA. increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages a collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards the economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: To buy materials for her knitting and crochet work

loans.name: Claudia Petrona

texts.es:
My name is Claudia R., I have a business where I sell purses. I’ve had this business for 2 years. I sell to the people that work in different offices and to my neighbors. My best clients are the young women that work in the offices since I offer great prices and my products are of good quality and brand, I have maintained my clients due to my personal attention to them. At the present time I am requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and with the income that I receive from selling the purses to be able to help my husband with our home’s monthly expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Claudia R. tengo un negocio de venta de carteras. Este negocio lo tengo hace 2 años. Yo vendo a las oficinas y a mis vecinos de mi comunidad. Mis mejores clientes son las jovenes que trabajan en oficinas ya que brindo buen precio y mis productos son de buena calidad y marca, me he ganado mi clientela por la atencion y tratos que les brindo. en la actualidad estoy solicitando prestamo para comprar mas mercaderia y con los ingresos que tengo sobre la venta de cartera ayudo a mi esposo con los gastos mensuales que tenemos en nustro hogar.

loans.use: To buy purses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing and accessories for the end of the year

loans.name: Gulbahar

texts.en: Gulbagar is 40-year-old woman who owns a small livestock farm in the southern part of Azerbaijan in Imishli region. She is married and has three children. She has five years of experience in rising livestock and selling to the local bazaar traders for meat production. Now she is s successful businesswoman and she would like to borrow 1200 USD to be repaid over an 18 month repayment period. With this loan she will purchase an additional three cows for estimated cost of 300 USD and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fodder.

loans.use: Going to  purchase additional three cows and fodder.

loans.name: Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Juana Guadalupe is a single mother of three small children, whom she hopes to always give the best. Unfortunately, Juana didn't have enough resources to be able to have a location for her business, so she began to sell shoes by catalog, and little by little, she acquired clients. Now she makes sales demonstrations every week. Nevertheless, Juana hopes to grow her business.

This is why she is requesting a credit of $475, which she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, Juana will be able to buy some display cabinets to make a small store in her home, so her clients can locate her easily. With your help, Juana will be able to make her dream a reality and at the same time help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juana Guadalupe es madre soltera D. tres pequeños. A quienes elL. desea darles siempre lo mejor. Desgraciadamente Juana no contaba con recursos suficientes como para poder un local. Fue por eso que comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo y así poco a poco se fue haciendo D. clientes. Actualmente hace demostraciones D. productos cada semana. Sin embargo Juana desea consolidar más su negocio.

Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito D. US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero Juana podrá comprar unos aparadores para poder hacer un local pequeño en su casa y así sus clientas L. puedan localizar fácilmente. Con tu ayuda Juana podrá hacer su sueño realidad. Y al mismo tiempo ayudar a que sus hijos salgan adelante.

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 32 years old. She is married with an eleven year old child. She sells clothing, bites, and decorations. She started her business in 2004.

Everyday, Salma works from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm. She can earn a monthly profit of about $65.00 from her sales.

In the past, Salma has successfully completed one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She would now like a loan to buy more items to sell in her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her business

loans.name: Mabousso

texts.fr:
Mabousso G. has been a shopkeeper for three years, selling hardware in a narrow store in Mbambara, the old quarter of Thiès. He is a very earnest man whose ambition is to open a large store, where he will carry everything his customers ask for. He is requesting a loan to diversify his product supply and to improve his hardware store.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mabousso G. excerce une activite commerciale depuis 3 années, il fait de la quincaillerie dans un endroit étroit dans le vieux quartier de Mbambara à Thiès. C’est un garçon très sérieux qui ambitionne d’ouvrir un grand magasin où il disposera de tous les produits réclamés par la clientèle. il sollicite un credit pour diversifier son stock et renforcer sa boutique de quincaillerie .

loans.use: Diversify his product supply and improve his hardware store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Gómez owns a store that she opened thanks to some savings and a loan from Fundación Paraguaya. She knows that it’s tough to start a small business because traditional financial institutions generally don’t want to give credit to people with few resources. Because of this she contacted Fundación Paraguaya and presented her business project, winning support to start her business.

Today Juana is happy that her business is doing well. She is the mother of five and lives with her spouse. Her husband helps by minding the store. Juana sacrifices a lot, and her day starts at 4am when she goes to the municipal market to buy necessary supplies.

Juana’s business is in her home, and is open from 6am to 9:30pm. In addition, she runs a bakery, making cakes and other desserts for birthday parties by request. Juana is a very active woman and says that working makes her happy, because she knows that many people from her country don’t have the same good luck.

Juana would like a loan to buy various merchandise for her store, such as: tea, drinks, noodles, and rice. She’ll also purchase ingredients for baking, like: milk, sugar, flour, coloring, flavoring, chocolates, vanilla, eggs, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana Gómez posee una despensa que logro abrir gracias a un pequeño ahorro que tenía y créditos que consiguió con la Fundación Paraguaya Ella cuenta que es muy difícil iniciar una micro empresa pequeña con ayuda de entidades financieras ya que por lo general, no quieren otorgar créditos a personas de escasos recursos; fue así que contacto con la Fundación Paraguaya y presentando su proyecto de negocio logró conseguir un apoyo para iniciar su emprendimiento.

Hoy día ella cuenta feliz que su negocio marcha bien, ella es madre de cinco e hijos y vive en pareja. Su pareja la ayuda en el negocio con la atención del mismo. Juana lleva una vida muy sacrificada ya que su jornada empieza a las 4 am que es cuando va al mercado municipal de la ciudad para comprar las mercaderías necesarias para su despensa.

El negocio lo tiene en su domicilio y abre desde las 6 am hasta las 9:30 pm. Además de esto ella se dedica a la repostería, haciendo tortas y confites para cumpleaños y acontecimientos bajo pedido. Es una mujer muy activa y cuenta que el trabajo la hace feliz, ya que sabe que muchas personas en nuestro país no cuentan con la misma suerte que ella.

Juana solicita el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de almacén como yerba, bebidas, fideos, arroz así como también ingredientes para la elaboración de sus tortas como leche, azúcar, harina leudante, colorantes permitidos, esencias varias, chocolates, vainillas, huevos y otros.

loans.use: Purchase tea, sugar, flour, canned goods, drinks, eggs, noodles, coloring, vanilla, etc.

loans.name: Marddy Elieth

texts.es:
Marrdy Elieth is a single 33 year-old woman who lives in the Villa Feliz neighborhood of Managua, Nicaragua. She has a 7 year-old daughter who attends elementary school.

Marddy’s business involves renting rooms in her house as well as operating a small beauty parlour. She began these projects using her own funds and with the help of family. She has been developing her small business ventures for the past six years and she would like to continue working, adding more rooms, in order to grow the business. She is requesting a loan in order to build a protective wall in front of her house. This would give her renters greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Marddy Elieth tiene 33 años de edad, e soltera, habita en el Barrio Villa feliz y tiene una niña de 7 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando la educación primaria. Marddy se dedica a la renta de cuartos en su casa de habitación y también tiene una pequeña sala de belleza, negocio que inició con fondos propios y ayuda familiar. Tiene 6 años de estar en estos pequeños negocios y dese continuar trabajando para poder seguir edificando más cuartos para hacer crecer el negocio, requiere del préstamo para construir el muro frontal de su vivienda, y así darle más seguridad a sus inquilinos.

loans.use: To build a protective wall in front of her boarding house

loans.name: Salustiana

texts.es:
Salustiana is 47, single and has two grown children. She has been working for over 15 years as a traveling saleswoman, selling typical Paraguayan products.
