She inherited the business from her parents when she was very young. In addition, she makes the bedspreads herself at home and later she and her children take them to other cities to sell.

Thanks to her hard work and dedication, Salustiana was able to get ahead, build her own house, and provide for her children and her mother, who is no longer of working age.

With her loan, Salustiana plans to purchase bedspreads, hammocks and sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Salustiana tiene 47 años de edad, soltera y con dos hijos mayores. Ella es vendedora ambulante de articulos típicos, hace más de quince años, esta profesión la heredó de sus padres desde muy joven, ademas ella misma fabrica las colchas en su casa para luego llevarlas con sus hijos a vender en otras ciudades.

Gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación logró salir adelante pudiendo llegar a construir para su propia casa , mantener a su s hijos, y también a su madre que ya no tienen edad para trabajar.

Con el crèdito comprarà colchas, hamacas, sabanas.

loans.use: Purchase of hammocks, bedspreads, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta is a married, sixty-year-old mother of two children. Berta has a clothing workshop that specializes in making typical clothes such as jumpers, blouses, although her bad vision has prevented her from producing as much as she would like. Furthermore, Berta has a stocked store where she sells groceries, such as vegetables and meat, in her house. She also sells traditional Peruvian food on Sundays.

Berta needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) to invest in sugar, rice, milk, eggs and detergents. Through this loan, Berta hopes to realie her dream of expanding her business and thus helping her children. Berta is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, milk, eggs and other supplies for her store

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng C., 33, and her husband, Mr. Thy Chamroeun, 46, who live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have two children, one son and one daughter.

Mrs. Loeng has been a silk weaver since 1993, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a boat builder for over twenty years.

Mrs. Loeng is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Zowadan Koffi

texts.fr: Né le 31/12/1939 à  Mission Tové, Mr H. Zowadan Koffi est marié et père de dix 10 enfants. Sa femme est cultivatrice. Ils habitent le quartier Djosse Kpodji. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter et installer un moulin dans quartier qui souffre du manque  d’un moulin à grain. Ce crédit lui permettra d'avoir un revenu substantiel pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1939 in Mission Tové, Mr. Zowadan Koffi H. is married and the father of 10 children. His wife is a farmer. They live in the Djosse Kpodji district. He is requesting this loan to buy and install a mill in this neighborhood which suffers from a lack of a mill to grind grain. This loan will permit him to have a substantial income to cater for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and installation of a mill for grain

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija has owned a beauty salon in Zanzibar since 2007. She works at her salon every day from 9:00am to 9:00pm and earns a profit of approximately $20 each month. One of the services most requested at her salon is braided hair extensions for women. She intends to buy more extensions so that she can meet her clients' demands.

Khadija is 29 years old, married, and has two children, aged 2 and 6.

loans.use: To buy more products for use in her salon.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut M., 47, is married and has three children. She lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia.
Since 2003, she and her husband have been running a wood sales business to earn a living, making on average US$3 per day. The couple is also supported by two of their children who work as garment factory workers. At present, Khut M. needs a loan of US$700 to be able to purchase a sawing machine for cutting trees for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of a sawing machine

loans.name: Cristian Carolina

texts.es:
Esta  microempresaria Cristian Carolina R. S.  tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es casada tiene 2 hijos de los cuales su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 6 años y cursa recientemente el 1 grado de primaria  y su otro hijo de 14 meses no estudia, su esposo labora como controlador del tiempo de las rutas, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio de forma activa y así superarse para mantener a sus hijos ya que necesita sacarlos adelante para que estos en un futuro no pasen necesidades sus deseos son de obtener un lugar mas adecuado para que sus clientes puedan apreciar mejor sus productos.

Su actividad económica es la venta de artesanía y bisutería que esta  ubicado en el parque central de león, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años, la forma en como inicia este negocio es por su mama ya que su Mama era la que tenia el control de su negocio y mas tarde decide independizarse obtener su propio negocio Ella inicia con la inversión de 300 $ dólares netos que fueron destinados para la compra de de 1 docena de camisetas, 3 sillas playeras y algunos jarros donde aparecía Nicaragua y al paso del tiempo decide incrementar mas su productos y es así como obtiene este medio de trabajo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de llaveros, vestidos típicos, sillas playeras, hamacas, bolsos ya que todo este tipo de producto lo encuentra en Masaya de una forma mas factible.
texts.en:
This micro-entrepreneur, Cristian Carolina R. S., is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. Her oldest son is six years old and has recently started the first grade. Her other son is 14 months old and doesn't study. Her husband works controlling the time for drivers' routes. Her desires are to actively maintain her business and thereby improve her situation in order to take care of her children because she needs them to get ahead so that in the future they can manage their own needs. She wants to have a more suitable place so that her clients can better appreciate her products. Her business is selling handicrafts and imitation jewelry and she's located in the central park of León. She has had the business for 10 years. The way in which started is because of her mother because her mother was the one that had control of the business. Later she decided to become independent and create her own business so she started with an initial investment of US$300 that she used to buy one dozen T-shirts, three beach chairs and some jars that had "Nicaragua" on them. As time passed, she decided to increase the number of products. The financial assistance is for working capital that is needed to purchase key chains, typical dresses, beach chairs, hammocks and bags. These types of products are less expensive in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase inventory

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif G. is a young and energetic guy who wants to improve his family's living conditions. He is 37 years old and lives in the small village of Saatli, Azerbaijan. He has a retail shop where sells spare parts for cars made in Russia. He has been involved in this business for more than 13 years, helping his relatives before he opened his shop. He provides spare parts for cars and provides his family with food and other necessities. There is a great demand for Arif`s spare parts, so he wants to buy more goods to meet his clients' demands. He wants to take out a loan of 1200 US dollars to buy more spare parts, including those for foreign cars as Mercedes, Opel, etc., and enlarge his shop's inventory. He promises to repay this loan within 15 months.

loans.use: Increase the inventory of spare parts for sale

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng Y. is a villager from Bos Knol village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 36 year old mother attending to three children. One of her children is a fisherman while the others are attending a local school. Her husband, Mr. Y. Yeth, is a fisherman. Mrs. Seng Y. is requesting a loan to save up and buy a machine to thresh rice for her husband to start a new business. She hopes to increase her family's income and improve their living conditions. 

Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a machine to thresh rice

loans.name: Armando Abel

texts.es: Armando Abel C. tiene 39 años, y su estado civil es casado. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio, y anteriormente el negocio era de su Mama pero al fallecer el prosiguió con la venta de mariscos como pescado, camarones y langostas. Los propósitos de Don Armando son de continuar con este negocio para brindarle apoyo económico a su familia que lo necesita. Don Armando solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de mariscos. Sus deseos son de establecerse en un local de manera permanente para que sus clientes conozcan su ubicación. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 12.000 córdobas a 12 meses.
texts.en:
Armando Abel C. is 39 years old, and he is married. For 14 years he has been dedicated to his business. Previously the business belonged to his mother but when she passed away he continued selling seafood like fish, shrimp and lobster. Don Armando's goals are to continue with this business to provide much needed economic support for his family. He requests this loan for working capital since he needs to purchase the seafood. His wishes are to establish himself in a permanent store so that his customers know his location. The amount requested is C$12,000 cordobas during a 12 month period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a 25-year-old AVON dealer in their village. She is married to Romie and is gifted with two healthy children: Brazel James- three years old and Rhezalyn- a one year old. Her AVON products are in demand in their place; however, it requires a bigger capital to meet the needs of her customers. This is the reason why she wants to request a loan of 4,000 PHP so that she can use it as business capital for her direct selling business. Brenda collects the orders of her customers and they will pay her on a monthly basis. She hopes that her request will be granted so she can sell more products and hopefully have an increase in income and save for the education of their children.

loans.use: To add capital to her AVON selling business

loans.name: Bethylyn

texts.en: Mrs. Bethylyn O., 45, is a resident of Brgy. Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to Jovenal and they have three children. She earns money through fish vending, supported by her husband who is a fisherman. They started with only one fishing boat and through their hard work and good way of living, they were able to buy another one. The purpose of their loan is to buy additional fishing equipment such as fishing net and a motorboat. They want to have another fishing boat for extra income to enable them to send their children to school. They also wish to renovate their house.

loans.use: additional capital (fish vending)

loans.name: Rosa Micaela

texts.es: La Señora. Rosa Rodríguez tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene dos hijos, casada su esposo le ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Tiene como planes iniciales la culminación de su vivienda. Doña Rosa de profesión secretaria ejecutiva laborando en una empresa privada con siete años de experiencia. Las dificultades que ha encontrado para terminar la construcción es que los materiales han aumentado de precios y el salario muy bajo. Gracias a los financiamientos de préstamos en Afodenic ha logrado construir parte de su vivienda y el fin de este préstamo es continuar las mejoras y construcción de su casa comprando los materiales necesarios como: cemento, hierro, zinc, clavos y reglones para poner las ventanas y puertas.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa R. is 37 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of her city. She has two children and is married. Her husband helps her with the household expenses. Her initial plan is to finish her house. Ms. Rosa has seven years of experience working as an executive secretary in a private business. She has encountered difficulties in finishing the construction of her house because the price of materials has increased and salaries are very low. Thanks to financing from AFONDENIC loans, she has succeeded in building part of her house and this current loan is destined for the purchase of materials necessary to continue the construction of her house such as cement, iron, zinc, nails and materials to put in the windows and doors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Status Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Zayda del Socorro G. O., Meyboll de Jesús L. O. y Concepción de María G...

El grupo solidario Status está compuesto por tres mujeres trabajadoras, originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, en el Km 21, empezaron a obtener crédito con Adim a través de referencias con clientas de la institución que les dijeron que se prestaba con fianza solidaria por no tener garantías. 

Doña Concepción de María es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida, vende en su casa  comidas derivadas del cerdo como caldos de carne. El crédito lo usó para comprar cerdos en pie y luego procesar los caldos, así como especies y bolsas de plástico. Ella es madre de tres hijos adolescentes que le ayudan en el procesamiento de las comidas, su esposo es carpintero y le ayuda con los gastos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para tener más seguridad y proteger más a su familia.

Doña Meyboll es una joven mujer vende cosméticos variados de diferentes marcas, con esta actividad ayuda a los gastos del hogar, con el crédito compro perfumes, pinturas labiales, cremas perfumadas, etc. Sus ventas se han mejorado porque ofrece de todos los gustos de sus clientes. Su esposo le ayuda ya que vende truchas en Costa Rica y viaja tres veces a la semana.

Doña Zayda vende ropa variada de forma ambulante en el mercado de la capita Roberto Huembes, ofrece blusas de mujer de todos los colores y ropa menor como calcetines, medias, etc. Es soltera con dos hijos, sueña con tener su propia vivienda para cuando ellos crezcan.. Con el crédito ella ha logrado capitalizarse en su negocio, crecer en variedad de inventario.

El grupo está comprometido con quedar bien a Adim para seguir obteniendo créditos y seguir trabajando mejor.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Zayda del Socorro G. O., Meyboll de Jesús L. O. and Concepción de María G. The supportive group, Status, is comprised of 3 working women who are natives of the city of Masaya, in Km 21. They started to get loans with Adim through references by clients of the institution that told them that they loan to groups with supportive bonds when there are no other guarantees. Doña Concepción de María is the coordinator of this group. She has a business of selling food. She sells in her home foods that come from a pig, such as pork soup. She used the loan to buy live pigs and later process the broth with spices and plastic bags. She is a mother of three adolescents that help her in processing the foods. Her husband is a carpenter and helps her with expenses. She dreams of improving her home so that it is more secure and of protecting her family better. Doña Meyboll is a young woman who sells cosmetics of different brands. Through this activity she helps with the household expenses. With the loan, she bought perfumes, lipsticks, scented cremes, etc. Her sales have improved because she offers all tastes to her clients. Her husband helps her since he sells trout in Costa Rica and travels three times a week. Doña Zayda travels to sell various clothes in the market in the capital, Roberto Huembes. She offers women's blouses of all colors and undergarments such as socks, stockings, etc. She is single with two children. She dreams of having her own home for when her children grow. With this loan, she has been able to capitalize her business and increase the variety of inventory. The group is committed to being in good standing with Adim so that they can continue getting loans and continue working better.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy live pigs, cosmetics, and clothes

loans.name: Alegria

texts.es:
La señora Alegría, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad de los Tres Pisos”, vive en el Jr. Junín Nº 164, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella ya que están estudiando.

Lleva años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva, nos cuenta que le va muy bien es así que logro ahorrar su dinero que le permitió comprar  mas ropa variada, ya que tiene como meta implementar su negocio con ropas para damas, caballeros y niño. A su edad el trabajo que realiza no le causa mucha molestia y esta muy satisfecha con lo que hace. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, en el barrio ya es muy conocida y es la única que cuenta con este tipo de negocio y esto le da mayores ventajas para sus ventas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, lo invertirá comprando ropas como pantalones, polos, vestidos y blusas en fardos, tanto nuevas y de segunda mano.

Se siente muy contenta, tiene fuerzas aún para seguir a adelante y hasta que Dios lo permita, se esta asegurando una vejes tranquila, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Alegría belongs to the Ciudad de los Tres Pisos Community Bank. She lives on el Jr. Junín Nº 164, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is 36, married, and has two dependent children who go to school. She has worked in the business of selling new and used clothes for years. It is going very well for her. She has been able to save her money and buy more clothing. Her goal is to set up her business with clothes for women, men, and children. At her age, her work does not bother her, and she is very satisfied with what she does. She currently continues with the same business, and she has a loyal client base. She is well known in her neighborhood. One of her biggest sales advantages is that she is the only one in the neighborhood with this type of business. She will use this loan for 1,000 PEN to buy clothes like pants, polos, dresses, and blouses in bundles. She will buy new and second hand clothes. She is very happy, and she has the strength to keep going as long as God permits. She is assuring herself of a peaceful old age. She recognizes the great support that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos offers her and other women from the San Martín region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of clothing (polos, pants, dresses, and others) for greater sales

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra  vive en la calle Yuqui  de la zona Villa Ingenio en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus 2  hijos,  de 19 y 14 Años respectivamente.
 
Trabaja como comerciante de ropa de lana, tejida  a mano los cuales adquiere de diversos artesanos, y los vende de manera ambulante en el centro de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de mayor cantidad de mercadería y así mejorar sus ventas
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives in Yuqui Street in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her two sons, aged 19 and 14.

She works as a vendor of hand-woven woolen clothes, which she purchases from various craftsmen and sells in the streets of the city center. She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise and thus increase her sales.

This is her first loan with Impro. Our evaluation qualifies her to be granted this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Union Y Progreso Group

texts.en:
Ana V. L. is a mother of 6 and is one of two group leaders in the Union y Progresso loan group. She lives with her family in Santiago, a crowded city in the Dominican Republic. 

Prior to her involvement with Esperanza, Ana sold miscellaneous things out of her home to other women in the community. When Esperanza began working in her community, she took out a loan and started her clothing business. She buys used clothes that are sent to the Dominican Republic from America in large shipments called pacas. She buys the clothes in bulk and then sells them out of her home.

Ana’s husband is a butcher. He has a meat stand that he runs out of their home. Ana and her husband’s incomes help support their 6 kids. Ana expresses that if she was not able to receive her micro-loans, their family situation would be much more difficult.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Amavi Sefenya

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris la couture, faute de moyens pour ouvrir son atelier, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits congelés, elle a associé après à ce commerce la vente de cartes de recharges  téléphoniques.son stock de produits congelés a connu une baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 7 cartons de poissons, 10 cartons de poulets et gonfler son stock de cartes de recharges avec 10 cartes de recharges TOGOCEL et 10 cartes de recharges ILLICO.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned how to sew.  Lacking the means to open her workshop, she started off in the commerce of frozen foods.  She has included with it commerce in mobile phone recharge cards.  Her inventory of frozen goods has experienced a drop.  She wants to stock up again and consequently is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 7 boxes of fish and 10 boxes of chicken and also for expanding her stock of recharge cards with 10 boxes of TOGOCEL cards and 10 boxes of ILLICO cards.  She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying frozen foods and phone cards

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito D. is from the village of Tigdok,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old. Julito is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Julito owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Julito has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Julito is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Julito from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Hendresa

texts.en:
Hendresa E. is from the village of Catarman in Camiguin. She is 45 years old. Hendresa is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Hendresa makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Hendresa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hendresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hendresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Hendresa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Hendresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Buenos Aires 1 Group

texts.es:
Grupo: 
Código: 
Integrantes:
 
Petrona de Jesús A.
Monto:6,300

El Grupo Buenos Aires 1  está conformado por Luisa del Carmen S., Alba Azucena C. y Petrona de Jesús A., ellas son del barrio san Judas de Managua. 

Luisa del Carmen S. de 32 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella trabaja de domestica y empezó a llevar sus compañeras de trabajo zapatos, perfumes y cosméticos.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Alba Azucena C. de 33 años vende tortilla, frijoles cocido y los fines de semana sopa  y Petrona de Jesús A. vende cosmético y ropa usada.

loans.use: para comprar zapatos, perfumes y cosmeticos

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La señora Martina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”,   Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y no tiene hijos.Se inicio con un capital S/. 1,000.00 motivada por el espíritu emprendedor tanto de ella como de su esposo,  se dedica a la venta de ladrillos, ya que cuentan con un terreno grande y con la materia prima como es la arcilla para la preparación de los ladrillos. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio que por la calidad de sus productos trabaja con instituciones publicas y privadas  con pedidos de ladrillos en millares. También en su ratos libres se dedica a la venta de ropas que los ofrece entre sus amigos y vecinos los mismos  que tienen muy buena acogida.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 comprará, galones de combustible, leña en tercios para asado de los  ladrillos.Ambos, su esposo y ella toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocioMartina, manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Martina is a member of the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank located in the Bellavista District, San Martin Department. She is 36 years old, married, and has no children. She began with a 1000 new sol investment and, fueled by both her husband's and her own entrepreneurial spirit, started a brick manufacturing and sale business since they have a large enough parcel of land and the raw materials, such as clay, needed for the manufacture of bricks. She is still engaged in the same activity and, thanks to the high quality of her products, she sells to public and private institutions filling orders that number in the thousands of bricks. In her free time she likes to sell clothing which she offers to her friends and neighbors who have shown a positive response to the wares. With this new 3000 new sol loan she intends to purchase gallons of fuel and bundles of fire wood which will be used to fire the bricks. Both her husband and herself share in decision-making with respect to their profits. Martina states her gratitude to the Manuela Ramos Movement for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fuel and fire wood.

loans.name: Ivone

texts.pt:
Ivone D. Conceição nasceu em Chokwe, Província de Gaza, tem 44 anos de idade, divorciaD. e mãe de 02 filhos com 23 e 24 anos de idade, todos já não vão à escola. Estudou ate 10ªclasse, parou de estudar porque teve que começar a trabalhar muito cedo para responder as despesas caseiras para sustento. Vive na casa própria em Boane e para alem dos filhos sustenta também os pais, enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Saiu de Chokwe para Maputo quando se casou ha 25 anos. Actualmente é negociante e dona do negocio há 06 anos. O produto que mais vende é a loiça e outros utensílios domésticos os quais compra por 2.500.00MT e vende a 3.000.00MT e faz compras três vezes por mês.

Nunca teve credito com outras instituições bancárias, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma vizinha. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo nesta instituição no valor de 15.200.00MT com o qual pretende comprar Produtos de Mercearia e loiça de cozinha tensilios domésticos e outros para venD..

Tem como objectivo deste empréstimo, aumentar o seu rendimento através de aquisição de mais produtos para o seu negocio. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos a fim de adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
Ivone D. Conceição is originally from Chokwe, Mozambique. She is 44, divorced and the mother of two children ages 23 and 24, who are both out of school. She finished 10th grade but had to drop school to start working and support her family. She lives in her own house in Maputo and besides her children she also supports her parents, sending them money every month. She owns her own business selling kitchen utensils. She is asking for a 15.200,00MT (U$550) loan that she'll use to buy more merchandise to resell at her store.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen utensils for reselling

loans.name: Marvin  Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marvin P., es trabajador activo es guarda de seguridad en una empresa privada, en estos últimos años ha trabajado  en la agricultura, de albañil. El cual le generaba buenos ingresos pero solo por contratos y luego hacia lo que saliera para poder dar el sustento a su familia es por eso opto por un trabajo fijo, son dos hijos de 2 y 10 años de edad el cual quiere dar una buena educación. Tiene 34 años de edad y espera poder hacer una casa buena para su familia y más segura ya que es forrada de zinc y es de suelo el piso. Contento por tener su casa propia pero desea mejorar es por eso con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, y hierro para comenzar a construir su casa de concreto, con el crédito anterior pudo hacer un cuarto de madera, con este quiere comenzar un arranque de piedra a largo plazo pero quiere una vivienda digna para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Marvin P. works as a security guard at a private business. Before this he worked as a farmer and a builder. These jobs generated good income but they were only contract jobs and afterward he would have to leave to be able to support his family. He chose to get a permanent job so he could give a good education to his two children, who are 2 and 10 years old. Marvin is 34 years old and he hopes to be able to make a good house for his family that is more secure than their house that is lined with zinc and has a dirt floor. He is happy to have his own house but he wants to make it better. He wants to use this loan to buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and iron to begin to build a house of concrete. With the last loan he was able to build a room of wood. In the long term he wants to begin a stone removal project, but in the meantime he wants his children to live in a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, cement and sand to begin to build a house of concrete

loans.name: Ingrid Sarai

texts.es: Ingrid  es madre soltera de 2 niños: el mayor de 5 añitos y el menor de 2 añitos de edad, vive en casa de su anciana madre, la cual la ayuda con el cuido de los niños cuando ella anda trabajando, esta solicitando su primer crédito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es terminar de repellar la casa,  Ingrid todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para dejar lavada la ropa de sus dos hijos y el desayuno hecho, es importante  mencionar que Ingrid desde muy pequeña  a trabajado y  a apoyado a su mamá,  son una familia  que profesan la religión  católica, es una Joven con mucha responsabilidad, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por los pobladores de su  barrio,  su sueño es tener trabajo para sacar a sus hijos adelante  para que a su familia no le falte nada y salud.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a single mother of two young children, ages 5 and 2. She lives with her elderly mother who looks after her children while she is at work.

Ingrid is requesting a home improvement loan so that she can finish plastering the walls of her house. Every morning, she wakes up early to wash clothes and prepare breakfast for her two children. It is important to mention that Ingrid has been working since she was a young girl in order to support her mother. She grew up in a Catholic family, so as a young woman she learned how to be responsible, honest, and hardworking. Ingrid is well-known among the residents of her neighborhood. Her dream is to have good health and a job in which she can succeed on behalf of her family so that they lack nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline J. sells fresh vegetables in a market and is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell.  Jackline is 29 years old and divorced.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to go back to school.
------------------------------
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: José Alonso

texts.es: José Alonso A. P. de 63 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, tiene cuatro hijos, tres de los cuales están casados. Vive junto a su esposa y su hijo menor de 15 años de edad. El señor José posee una barbería, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Debido a la amplia experiencia que él posee, cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que son más de 20 años de dedicarse al mismo oficio, las personas tienen mucha confianza en él. El señor José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda tener la capacidad de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que desea poder pintar las P. y mejorara el techo del lugar. A pesar que la mayoría de sus hijos no dependen de él, José aun trabaja arduamente por llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y por brindarle estudios a su hijo menor tal como lo hizo con los mayores, a los cuales gracias a su esfuerzo les logro dar estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
José Alonso A. P., 63 years old, lives in the San Salvador district. He has four children, three of whom are married. He lives with his wife and their youngest child, who is 15. Señor José has a barber shop, which is located in his home. Thanks to his extensive experience, he can count on a large number of clients. Since he has worked at the same occupation for more than 20 years, people have great confidence in him. Señor José is seeking a loan that will enable him to improve the conditions of his business, since he would like to paint the walls and improve the roof of the barber shop. Although the majority of his children do not depend on him, José still works hard to provide sustenance to his household and to offer schooling to his youngest child, just as he did for his older children, to whom, thanks to his efforts, he was able to give a university education.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and improve barber shop

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Seam O., 41, is married and has three children, two of whom are living at home and are supported, and one of whom is a garment factory worker. Seam grows and sells vegetables at the local market in Takeo province. She typically makes about $3 USD of profit each day. Her husband is a rice farmer who typically makes $2 USD per day. Seam O. would like to take out a loan for $1000 USD to purchase a water pump and expand her cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and expand cultivation

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El sr, Roberto   M. es trabajador activo de la alcaldía municipal trabaja de conductor, el dinero lo solicita para la terminación de un cuarto, compra de materiales como perlines, zinc, cemento y arena, y si los crédito que Ceprodel me ha financiado me han ayudado mucho ya que he podido cumplir mis metas propuestas y espero que siempre nos estén brindando esta ayuda de financiarnos créditos. Soy casado, padre de 4 hijos ya mayores y una bebita de 4 años. Ya es el segundo crédito con Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Señor Roberto M. is an active worker in the municipal city hall. He works as a conductor. The money he requests is for finishing a room, to purchase materials such as tiles, zinc, cement and sand. The loans that Ceprodel has given him have helped a lot since he has been able to meet his proposed goals and he relies on the availability of this aid to finance loans. He is married and the father of 4 already grown children and a young child of 4 years. This is his second loan with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tiles, zinc, cement and sand for finishing a room in his house.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. V., 24, was married many years ago to Chanthy, age 31, and they currently earn their daily income by working in the garment factory. The couple always gets a specific salary of over two hundred dollars and they use it to send all their kids to school and to cover their family’s daily living expenses.

However, the current family income is not adequate to cover an expense so V. plans to make extra income by investing in a new trade. Because she lacks capital, she decided to request a loan to purchase pig feed and piglets to start raising.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and piglets to start raising

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Mrs. SarO. O. is a 29 year old married woman who lives in Phngeas village in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a 2-hectare field where they cultivate rice. In this dry farming seasO. they do not have enough money to support their field. Thus, Mrs. SarO. O. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and the rest of the loan she will use to buy duck feed to support her husband's duck breeding, because aside from farming, her husband is a duck breeder. This couple has three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the other two are too young to study or work. Her husband is O. the left of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and duck feed.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa M., 42 years of age and married, is a resident of Mantic, Tangub City. She is blessed with six children: four are now in their teenage years and the other two are still minor dependents. Presently, she buys and sells Chinese medicines. She has been in this business for six years and earns an average net income of not less than 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

As a new member of the Paglaum Development Program for Landless People (a micro-finance program of PMPC) she was given the privilege of taking out 5,000 PHP as her first loan to add to capital for her current business. Her income is used to meet her family's daily needs and for savings. She is hoping that with this business she will be able to send all her children to school for a good future.

loans.use: Additional capital for a Chinese medicine business

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en:
38-year-old Latifat is married and has five children. She is a hair stylist; she styles hair and sells hair accessories to her customers at her beauty salon. She buys hair accessories from a big distributor and sells retail. She has been in this business since 2006.

Latifat wants to improve her business as this will attract more customers to her salon. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to buy goods directly from the company at a reduced rate, thereby increasing her profit. She says thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: María Dominga

texts.es:
La señora María Dominga C. L., es madre soltera de 46 años,  sus dos hijos son mayores de edad y viven de forma independiente, pero le apoyan económicamente y en los trabajos de la finca, debido a que ella es cultivadora de piña desde hace 16 años.

Dentro de sus planes de vida está el establecimiento de un puesto de venta de frutas y realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda, pero la afectación de plagas y enfermedades de las tierras, han robado este sueño debido a que la producción se ha disminuido,  provocando pérdidas económicas, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de  materiales agrícolas, tales como fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos, con el propósito de realizar un mantenimiento a las tierras y tras esto una mejor cosecha, que garantice la recuperación de la inversión y   la ambición a futuro de llevar a cabo sus planes de remodelación y establecimiento de una nueva fuente de trabajo, esto favorecerá a toda la familia, pero sobretodo a la señora Dominga debido a que ella es una mujer sola que no tiene el apoyo de una pareja, pero su trabajo le ocupa su mente y la llena de propositos a futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. María Dominga C. L. is a 46 year old single mother. She has two adult children who live independently, but they help her financially by assisting her with the work around the farm. María has been growing pineapples for 16 years.

Among the plans María has for her life are to open a fruit stand and make a few improvements to her home. However, pests and diseases have impacted her farmland. Her plans have been put on hold because production has decreased, causing her to suffer financial losses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers and seedlings so that she can maintain her land and achieve a better harvest. María hopes the loan will guarantee the recovery of her investment, provide for her future plans of remodeling her house, and establish a new source of work. This should encourage the entire family, especially María because she is a single woman who does not have the support of a partner. Therefore, her work occupies her mind and provides her future with purpose.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & other farming supplies

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Nouen S. became a fruit seller when she was single, but she is now married with three young children, all of whom are students and dependent upon their parents' income. Nouen sells fruits that she orders in bulk from her wholesale supplier, operating her business inside the market, generating substantial income for her family. Her husband fishes for a profit but now requires more equipment, so Nouen is requesting a loan of $1000 to make the necessary purchases.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment for her husband's business

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia L. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old. Eufemia is widowed and has five adult children. Eufemia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Aside from her fish vending activity, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Eufemia has been to this business activity for less than a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eufemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Eufemia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with two children who both attend school. She has been frying fish for sale for the past six years as wholesale, retail, at the market, from door to door and from home. She sells to her immediate neighbors. With the Ksh 20,000 she would like to add stock and pay the deposit for a stall at the market to use for selling fish. Her major challenge is the high cost of transporting fish from fresh water catchment areas. 

Pamela rents a house without electricity or piped water, citing transport as her greatest monthly expense.  Pamela hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the market in future.

loans.use: Buy stock and pay  rent for stall used for selling at the market

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Jariatu is a very hard-working businesswoman. Her business is located along Yiks Road, Makeni. She was initially financed by her husband and began selling foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past 20 years.

Jariatu is married to a businessman who also helps her with her business. Her challenge is, how to improve her business to the level that she can continue to serve her customers in a cost-effective way and at the same time help her husband support their family. She needs a loan to buy more stock.  She however intends to use the proceeds of her loan to help her husband educate their children to university level and buy a plot of land where they could build a  house.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase two cows

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino tiene 30años de edad, reside en el municipio de Cacaopera, Departamento de Morazán, está acompañando, vive con la esposa y su pequeño hijo de un  1 año de edad, el tiene una venta de frutas y  verduras.
Tiene tres los de experiencia en el negocio y su venta está ubicada en la calle, los clientes son personas que transitan el lugar, regularmente atiende el negocio de 6:00am- 5:00pm, el solicita un préstamo para la reparación  del vehículo donde transporta las verduras y frutas, también invertir en la compra de plátanos, papas, tomates, naranjas, manzanas, bananas que son productos que demanda sus clientes. Esto contribuirá a mejorar los ingresos de la familia y mantener el negocio.
Las aspiraciones de Cristino son tener un negocio prospero, comprar un carro en mejores condiciones para transportar las frutas y verduras, para darle a la familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Cristino is 30 years old and lives in the town of Cacaopera, Morazán Department. He lives with his wife and their little one-year-old son. Cristino has a business selling fruits and vegetables. He has three years of experience with this business, and his sales stall is located on the street. His customers are people who pass by the place. He runs the business regularly from 6:00 am until 5:00 pm. He is asking for a loan to repair the vehicle he uses for transporting the vegetables and fruits. He also wants to invest in purchasing plantains, potatoes, tomatoes, oranges, apples and bananas, which are products his customers demand. This will help to improve his family's income and maintain his business. Cristino's aspirations are to have a prosperous business, buy a better car to transport the fruits and vegetables, and give his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables, and repair a vehicle

loans.name: Fualaau

texts.en:
Fualaau S. is 48 and married with eight children (ages 4 - 10).  She owns a business venture selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Fualaau has one year of experience in this business.  Fualaau needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fualaau joined SPBD.  This is her first loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Fualaau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as to Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La Señora Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en el centro poblado D. Mataro Chico del distrito D. Santiago D. Pupuja,  provincia D. Azángaro y departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 04 hijos (02 dependientes y 02 independientes), la señora estudio educación primaria completo.

La señora Felipa esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, incrementó el capital D.  su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes.

Con este crédito D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará insumos como arroz, azúcar, leche, etc.  También nos cuenta que se ayuda con la producción D. su chacra.

Su sueño para el futuro  es aumentar el capital D. su negocio para luego mejorar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones  y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the Mataro Chico communal bank, located in the populated center of Mataro Chico in the district of Santiago D. Pupuja, province of Azángaro, and the department of Puno. She is 53 years old, a widow, and has 4 children (2 dependent and 2 independent). She completed primary school studies. Felipa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past 4 months. She tells us that with the first loan of 500 PEN that she received, she increased her working capital for her grocery sales. With this loan of 500 PEN, she will purchase food items such as rice, sugar, milk, etc. She also tells us that it is helpful with the production of her farm. Her dream for the future is to increase her working capital to then improve the business. What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings and the trainings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food items such as rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie R. is from the village of Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Julie is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Julie operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as milo (a powder to mix into a drink), vinegar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Julie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Julie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Julie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rossana Regina

texts.es: Rossana Regina M. A. de 40 años de edad, es una persona la cual se destaca por ser muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien siempre cuenta con el deseo de mejorar cada día más. Ella reside en el municipio de Soyapango, el cual está ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, y junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 12  años de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Rossana posee su propia tienda de productos perecederos como: golosinas, sodas, jugos, leche, pan, granos básicos y otros más, el negocio se encuentra en su casa de habitación, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para ella debido a que le permite cuidar de sus hijos al mismo tiempo que atiende su tienda. A pesar que cuenta con mucha competencia, posee varios clientes los cuales a diario consumen de sus productos. Rossana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir la tienda, comprando productos por mayor, de manera que cuente con todo lo necesario para atender de la mejor manera a sus clientes y así obtener algunos nuevos. Rossana desea mucho poder aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma vivir mejor junto a su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Rossana Regina M. A., 40, is a person who stands out for being very hard working and enterprising.  She wants to improve daily. She lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department, with her husband and two children who are 10 and 12 years of age and in school.  

Rossana has a small grocery store.  She stocks such items as: snacks, soft drinks, juices, milk, bread and basic grains, among others.  The store is located in her home which is very beneficial for her because she can watch after her children while tending to her store.

Despite facing much competition she has several regular customers that come by daily to buy from her.  Rossana is asking for a loan to stock her store buying products at wholesale so that she can meet customer needs and attract new customers.  She very much wants to increase sales so that she can live better alongside her small family.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Angel Serapio

texts.es:
Ángel Serapio S. C.  tiene 35 años. Es casado  vive con los hojas y la esposa, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Ángel pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Ángel trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa para los hijos.
Le gusta bailar en las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Ángel Serapio S. C.  is 35 years of age.  He is married and lives with his children and wife.  He lives in the canton of Ventanas in the Province of Los Ríos.  He has 4 children.  

Angel belongs to the Dole communal bank located in the precinct of the same name which is part of Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  It is a group that is dedicated to farming crops with a short growing cycle.  Most grow bananas. This group has 16 members.  

Angel works in agriculture and sows bananas on an estate that he leases.  He buys the young plans in Guayaquil and sells the bananas in the areas near his house and in the market of Ventanas.  

He requests the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand his business.  The support of the loan would help him economically to supply his needs.  His dream is to have a house for the children.  He likes to dance at the festivals of the precinct.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to grow his business

loans.name: Fortuna Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento FORTUNA esta integrado por personas que viven en la zona de Bajo Alpacoma, esta zona se caracteriza porque alberga a más de cincuenta fábricas de ladrillos artesanales, la mayoría de las socias trabajan como maquinistas, cargadoras o quemadoras en estas fábricas, además tienen actividades como la cría de cerdos y gallinas. Venta de comida y venta de ropa, la líder de este grupo y la encargada de conformarlo es la señora Victoria quien trabaja en una fábrica quemando ladrillos, ella vive sola con sus cuatro hijos en su casa propia que con mucho esfuerzo la construyó, la Sra. Utilizara el dinero del crédito en la compra de material de construcción para hacer terminar su cocina,   la Sra. María es la tesorera del Banco de Emprendimiento tiene una pensión donde atiende en su mayoría a los obreros de estas fábricas, el dinero lo utilizara en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus platillos, la Sra.  Adela se dedica a la venta de ropa esporádicamente de manera ambulante, su esposo es maquinista en una de estas fábricas. El trabajo que realizan las señoras y sus esposos es de mucho esfuerzo puesto que hay días que tienen que permanecer despiertos hasta dos noches para quemar los ladrillos. La mayoría de estas socias trabajan solo con la institución.
texts.en: The Fortuna Entrepreneurial Bank is made up of people who live in the Bajo Alpacoma region.  This region is known for having more than 50 artisanal brick factories.  Most of the members of the bank work as machinists, brick carriers or brick bakers in the factories.  They also have small businesses that they run outside of the factories like raising pigs or chickens, selling food or clothing.  The group leader who helped to found the group is Victoria who works in the factory baking bricks.  She lives alone with her 4 children in her own home which she built thanks to her own hard work.  She will use the money from the loan to buy construction materials to finish building her kitchen.  Maria is the bank's treasurer and provides food to the majority of the factory workers.  She will use the money to buy ingredients for her food.  Adela works selling clothing around town.  Her husband is a machinist in a factory.  The women and their husbands work very hard as there are often days where they have to stay awake 2 nights in a row to bake the bricks.  Most of the women work only with the institution.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Siga Thioumboud

texts.fr:
Madame SIGA THIUOMBOUD D. est une femme de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 05 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de divers produits céréaliers tels du mil, du niébé, des arachides etc.

Son crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de générer des bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de la famille et d'assurer la nourriture et scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. Siga Thiuomboud D. is a 50 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 10 children. She is also caring for five other children who have been entrusted to her by relatives. She has a small business selling various goods, including millet, black-eyed peas, peanuts etc. This loan will enable her to grow her level of stock, which will ultimately increase her income. Her objective is to generate enough income to enable her to pay for the needs of her family and ensure that her children have enough food, and can go to school.

loans.use: To develop and promote her business.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.en:
Crisologo B. is from the village of San Jose. He is 45 years old. Crisologo is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Crisologo owns & operates a business planting & harvesting rice for sale. Crisologo has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Crisologo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisologo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Crisologo is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Crisologo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Soraya Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Portoviejo de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Portoviejo.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Soraya, ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 17,  15 y 8 años,  dos de ellos estan en colegio y el menor en escuela.  Su esposo es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catálogo de la marca Nive, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  también vende productos de la marca Avon y Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería, y accesorios para damas) ventas que realiza al mismo tiempo que hace la venta de ropa. Trabaja todos los  días, deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana. Su mercadería la recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cremas, perfumes y bisutería. Lleva 7 años en el  Banco Comunal y le ha gustado el banco por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos, ella se desempeña como secretaria del Banco. Sus sueños son tener un bazar en su casa y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Nueva Portoviejo' community bank meet in the Nueva Portoviejo district of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Here we meet 35 year-old Soraya.  Soraya is married and has three children aged 17, 15 and 8.  Two of her children are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Soraya is a housewife who also sells Nive-brand clothes and shoes through a catalog.  She makes her sales door to door.  She also sells Avon and Sayson products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She makes these sales at the same time she makes her clothes sales.  She works every day, leaving her products with her customers on credit and collecting payment on the weekend.  She receives her merchandise from a supplier in Portoviejo.

Soraya will use this loan to buy clothes, creams, perfume and costume jewelry.  She has been a member of her community bank for 7 years and she likes it for the speed with which she can acquire loans.  She is her community bank's secretary.  Soraya's dreams are to have a store in her home and for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: To buy clothes, creams, perfume and costume jewelry

loans.name: Monte Fresco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mote Fresco lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Reyna Isabel A. quien se dedica al comercio de ropa negocio que inicio con poco y ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo en especial en mercadería como pantalones, blusas, zapatos, suéter entre otros. 
Las otras integrantes son  Marisol F. quien realiza sopas los fines de semana y fritanga, ella con el préstamo invertirá en materia prima y Norma A. mini pulpería e invertirá en chiberias, granos básicos, papel higiénico…etc.
texts.en:
The group Monte Fresco is composed of three hardworking, courageous, and entrepreneurial women who are from the capital, Managua. The coordinator of the group is Señora Reyna Isabel A., who sells clothing. She began this business with very little, and it has been growing little by little. 
She will invest the loan in her business so that it can continue growing; in particular, she will invest in pants, blouses, shoes, and sweaters, among other items.

The other members are Marisol F., who makes soups and fritters on weekends and will invest the loan in basic ingredients, and Norma A., who has a mini-market and will invest in snacks, basic grains, toilet paper, etc.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica M. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school aged children. Jessica operates a family member's business in the retail sector, selling fresh fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately $63 a month.

In 2010, Jessica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar, 20 years old, is from the town of San Francisco. She is married and has a 2-year-old child. To make a living, Maricar owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. At her young age, Maricar is already a responsible mother to her child. She starts to save little by little for her child's future.

Maricar joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricar is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maricar from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en: Nazih is a 40-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and three kids. Nazih has worked laying house tiles for 12 years. Nazih is a hard worker. He does so in order to provide secure living for his family members. Nazih is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a new machine used to polish the tiles he lays on the floor. His clients like his work a lot and recommend him to most of their neighbors, relatives and friends. Working hard is his way to provide the best education for his kids. He hopes to expand his business to keep a good base for his family members.

loans.use: To buy a machine that polishes tiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy various fruits

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita B., age 46, makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She is from the village of Centro 2. Merlita is married and has four school-aged children. 

In 2009, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. 

Merlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools and other equipment to expand her furniture making business

loans.name: Berclin

texts.fr:
Berclin L. est un commerçant de HOPE Congo âgé 35 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant dont l'âge est de 13ans.

 il débute son commerce de quincaillerie en 1996. Il vend en moyenne 15000 a 35.000frs par jours. 

Avec le prêt le second, il compte renforcer son stock en achetant deux mélanger lavabo et baignoire, dix boîtes colles gebajoint, deux des robinets, des flotteurs bâche à eau, vingt des fusible. 

 il pense ouvrir un magasin avec vente en gros et détails, afin de soutenir les études scolaires de son enfants.
texts.en:
Berclin L. is a merchant with HOPE Congo. He is 35 years old, unmarried, and the father of one child, aged 13.  He started his hardware business in 1996. His sales on average amount to 15,000 to 35,000 francs a day.

With this second loan, he plans on bolstering his inventory by buying 2 blenders, washbasins and bath tubs, 10 cans of Gebajoint glue, 2 faucets, some toilet tank floats, and 20 fuses.

Berclin is thinking about opening a wholesale and retail store in order to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy faucets, bath tubs, and fuses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for his general store

loans.name: Nimrod

texts.en:
Nimrod, a 53-year-old man, is married to Sumini, a 36-year-old lady. They are blessed with a son, Paskalis, who is 14 years old and in the second grade of junior high school. They are living in a modest house in Oeleta Penkase Village.

In order to meet his family's needs and Paskalis’ education needs, Nimrod is running a broiler (chicken) business. Besides running the broiler business, Nimrod is also selling gravel to generate more daily income. Nimrod never had a formal education but he has the spirit to move forward. 

Nimrod dreams to improve his business as currently he only has 2 boxes of chicks to breed. He wishes to generate more income from the business. He plans to add 7 boxes of chicks and 4 sacks of fodder (feed) for this business. In order to make his dream come true, then, Nimrod is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR from TLM. He plans to spend the loan on chicks and fodder. This loan means a lot to Nimrod and he is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fish.

loans.name: Safarboy

texts.en:
Safarboy is a hardworking and responsible father of four children. He is a carpenter. Safarboy buys building materials from the market and makes doors, windows, walls and kitchens. He also repairs floors, ceilings and roofs. He has many regular customers. Safarboy would like a loan of 10,000 TJS to purchase building materials to expand his business and prepare good, high quality products.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and maring the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es: José Miguel  de sesenta y uno años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia. El posee una venta de huevos desde hace varios años y es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad, sus clientes lo prefieren porque vende huevos frescos y de muy buena calidad además a un buen precio; ademas es muy carismático siempre recibe a la clientela muy contento y los atiende como se merecen; José es un hombre emprendedor, para él solo se triunfa en el mundo si no  se dejan los sueños de lado es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar huevos para mantener a flote el negocio. José tiene la confianza que esto le permitirá sostener a su familia y llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: José Miguel is 71 years old and lives with his life partner in their own house. He has been selling eggs for many years. He is well known in his neighborhood. His clients prefer his eggs as they are fresh and of good quality and sold at a good price. He is also very charismatic. He always is happy to attend his customers and he helps them, as they deserve to be helped. José is an enterprising man and he has succeeded in the world without leaving his dreams behind. This is why he is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will allow him to buy eggs in order to maintain his business. This will allow him to support his family and bring economic security to his home.

loans.use: to buy eggs

loans.name: Chocaman Group

texts.es:
