La señora Santiaga es casada, tiene 52 años D. edad, se dedica al comercio a la venta D. ropas D. todo tipo y tamaño, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, el negocio que tiene inició siendo vendedor ambulante, lleva hasta el momentos 20 años D. experiencia. 

DeciD. organizar un grupo para pedir y solicitar un préstamo, que lo utilizaran para la compra D. mercadería para la venta, ya que se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva, van a comprar bufandas, medias, calcetines, chumpas, gorras, y entre otros tipos D. ropa. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican la mayoria al comercio, y los demás a la crianza d animales domésticos. En el futuro desean tener su negocio con locales comerciales.
texts.en: Mrs. Santiaga, 52, is married and sells all kinds and sizes of clothing.  She was unable to get an education, and set up her street vendor activity 20 years ago.  She decided to organize a group to apply for loans which she will use to buy new clothing merchandise such as scarves, stockings, sweaters, and caps, among other types of clothing.  The other members of the group are in commerce and domestic animal farming.  In the future they would like to establish their businesses in shopping areas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Joebima

texts.en:
Joebima is 44 years old and married with 3 children.  She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 10 years, and also earns some income from pig fattening.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Joebima has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like bread, noodles, egg, spices, etc. in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed – and repaid – 17 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rafael Andrès

texts.es:
Rafael es un joven de 23 años de edad  que inicio su vida productiva trabajando en  varias agencias publicitaria y ganando un buen mercado logró independizarse y emprender su propia aventura de negocio de publicidad, donde se  dedica a realizar asesorías de imagen corporativa, mercadeo, campañas publicitarias, organización de eventos, tipografías, diseño gráficos, dotación de artículos para oficina y en general venta de material  publicitario. Inició este negocio  hace 4 años, sus clientes son, agencias de viaje, personas particulares, y otras empresas que recomiendan sus servicios, porque reconocen la calidad con la cual Rafael trabaja. Los estados financieros de su microempresa están de acuerdo con la  actividad que desarrolla,  sus compras las hace  de contado, y maneja un margen de utilidad neta no menor de un 39,80%, mientras sus inventarios representan un 17%, sus cuentas por cobrar no superan el 60% y rotan  cada 13 días mientras , sus inventarios lo hacen cada 6.   
Su mayor sueño y mayor desafío es abrir sus instalaciones en un lugar más estratégico, él sabe que esto lo logrará  por su gran esfuerzo cuando este aún más posicionado.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; con su credikiva logrará mayor disponibilidad de efectivo, para  poder realizar mejor su actividad y cumplir con sus pedidos, mientras recibe el pago de sus clientes que lo hacen cada 30 o 45 días. Aplicará este financiamiento a la elaboración de afiches, materiales publicitarios y una campaña que tiene planeada en la Costa Caribe de Colombia, para la cual fue contratado y su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para este gran propósito.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 23-year old young man who began his working career at various advertising agencies.  Gaining a good market share, he managed to go off on his own and start his own advertising agency venture.  He dedicates himself to creating corporate image campaigns, marketing, publicity campaigns, event planning, typography, graphic design, allocation of office supplies and general sales of publicity materials.  

He started this business 4 years ago and his customers include travel agencies, individuals, and other enterprises that recommend his services because they know the quality of the work that Rafael produces.  The financial state of his micro-enterprise goes according to the amount of activity he carries out.  He makes his purchases in cash, and manages a net working margin no smaller than 39.80%.  Meanwhile, his inventories represent 17%, his accounts payable do not exceed 60% and rotate every 13 days; he does inventory every 6 days.

His greatest dream and biggest challenge is opening his installation in a more strategic location.  He knows that he will manage this with a great amount of effort when he is better positioned to do so.  Currently, he is applying for his first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With his Kiva credit, he will have more access to capital to better carry out his activities and fulfill his orders, while he waits for payment from customers every 30 or 45 days.

He will use this loan for creation of posters, publicity materials, and also for a campaign he has been contracted to do along the Caribbean Coast of Colombia, however his working capital is insufficient for this grand undertaking.

loans.use: create posters and publicity materials, as well as carry out a campaign he has planned throughout the Caribbean Coast of Colombia.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 30 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has 2 children, 7 and 13 years old. They all live with her at home and attend school. Her husband is a driver. 

For the past 5 years, Julia has been selling oil, rice and pepper on a table in the local market. She started her business by selling at the table market. From this business she has been able to send her children to school, feed the family, provide for their clothing, and pay her house rent. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil and flour for her business. Her plan is to buy land and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and flour for her business

loans.name: Abdel Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old and married.

Abdel Hussein has owned a workshop since 2001. He repairs all kinds of generators. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan to purchase a machine for repairing generators, to make a sliding door and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for repairing generators, to make a sliding door and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Abelardo Antonio

texts.es:
Abelardo, de 43 años de edad, esta casado, es padre de tres hijos , el se dedica a vender billetes de lotería , lleva 4 años en este negocio. El se inicio en este negocio debido a que su padre enfermo el tuvo que asumir el negocio en ese entonces el tenia 38 años de edad, antes de este negocio el se dedicaba a la venta de helados y refrescos de manera ambulante actividad que todavía realiza solo los fines de semana. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar billetes de lotería y raspaditas. El espera poder vender más billetes al ofrecer más numeraciones de lotería. Su meta próxima es comprarse una moto para agilizarse mas rápido y vender sus billetes de lotería. En lo futuro  a el le gustaría vender el premio mayor de lotería y así poder comprarse una finca.
texts.en:
Abelardo, 43, is married and the father of three children.  He sells lottery tickets.  He’s been in this business for four years.  He started in this business because his father became ill and he had to take over the business.  Back then he was 38 years old.  Prior to this business he was an ice-cream and soft-drink vendor, something he still does but only on weekends.

He asked for the loan to buy lottery tickets and Scratch-Offs.  He hopes to be able to sell more tickets by having more numbers available.  His next goal is to buy a motorcycle to get around more quickly and sell his lottery tickets.  In the future, he’d like to sell the grand prize ticket and be able to buy himself a farm.

loans.use: To buy lottery tickets and Scratch-Offs.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Фарход родился 1973 году. Он честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и отец 4 детей. Его жена не работает, она домохозяйка и присматривает за детьми. Фарход занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, а также купля продажей овощи и фрукты. Займ, который он получил от Имон Интернэшнл раньше, дал ему хороший результат. Он увеличил свой оборотный капитал, получил хороший урожай и улучшил свое условия жизни. Фарход хотел бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений, который позволит ему, получит хороший урожай. Он также хочет использовать займ для покупки семена и оплата труда работникам. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Farhod was born in 1973.  He is an honest and goal-oriented person.  He is married and is a father of four children.  His wife does not work; she is a homemaker and looks after the children.  Farhod is involved in growing agricultural crops and also buying and selling vegetables and fruits.  His previous loan from Imon International provided him with a good result.  He increased his turnover, gathered a good harvest and improved his quality of life.  Farhod wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers, which would allow him to get a good harvest.  He also wants to use the loan for the purchase of seeds and payment of worker wages.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and pay wages to workers

loans.name: Reyna Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Reyna de 43 años  de edad labora como Enfermera desde hace 22 años, solicita su 7mo credito para comprar materiales de construcciòn y asi poco a poco ir mejorando sus  condiciones de su vivienda y de su familia ,  es una señora honesta y muy responsable, bien querida por su familia y sus compañeros de trabajo, su sueño es que su familia gozen de salud , trabajo ya que son de escasos recursos economicos y mejorar poco a poco la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en: Doña Reyna, age 43, has been a nurse for 22 years. She is requesting her seventh loan to purchase construction materials in order to improve her living conditions, and those of her family, bit by bit. She is a very honest and responsible woman, who is well-loved by her family and co-workers. Her dream is for her family to enjoy health and employment (as there is a shortage of economic resources), and to improve her home bit by bit.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Lina Fe

texts.en:
Lina Fe is a hard-working mother who sells AVON, Natasha and MSE products in her village to help her husband in financing the education of their children. She is now 47 years old and has three school-aged children. Due to financial difficulty, she is hoping to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy the family's basic needs and support the education of their children. 

In this regard, she wants to sell more AVON, Natasha and MSE products but she has inadequate capital, therefore, she wants to ask for 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more of these products to sell in her village. She believes that this loan will help her to improve her business through her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy AVON, Natasha and MSE products to sell in her village

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married, and a father of one child.

Hani has had a workshop since 2009 for cars, plumbing, and painting. He has good experience in this field, a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan in order to purchase a generator and to make a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and to make a sliding door.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children between the ages of 8 and 17.  She has been in farming for 11 years, producing and selling vegetables, tomatoes and bananas at the local market. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds so she can venture into poultry farming. She has plans to have a farm running with 2000 birds in two years. She says there is a ready market for both birds and eggs, and the business will generate more income to help provide for the family’s basic needs.  She is aware of the main pitfall of the business – animal diseases – but despite this challenge, she remains focused on achieving success and repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, age 31, is a banana farmer in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started his business by buying one acre of land from personal savings, and he has since grown his business to three acres. He and his wife live with their six children in a semi-permanent house. 

He would like to request a loan to apply toward the weeding and mulching of his banana plantation.

Robert dreams of educating his children and building a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: to weed and mulch his banana plantation

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mme Aminata, âgée de 53 ans est marchande d’arachides, de mais, et d’autres fruits selon la période. Elle exerce ce métier  depuis plus de 15ans. Elle habite un quartier sis dans la région se trouvant à 70km de Dakar
Elle souhaite acheter de l’arachide, du mais pour renforcer son activité de petit commerce.
Avec les revenus de son commerce elle aide son époux dans la gestion de la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs Aminata, 53, sells peanuts, corn, and other fruits depending on the season. She's been doing this for over 15 years. She lives in a neighborhood located 70km away from Dakar.
She would like to buy some peanuts and corn to strengthen her business.
With the income from this business, she helps her husband manage the household.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and corn

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza de 25 años de edad, labora como docente de Educación Primaria en Escuela salomón Ibarra Mayorga de Colonia Los Angeles, está solicitando su 5to crédito con el propósito de mejorar la cocina de su casa de habitación, ella es bien reconocida en su comunidad como una persona honesta, trabajadora y muy responsable en sus compromisos adquiridos, ella tiene el apoyo de su marido quien le ayuda a pagar sus cuotas como trabajador de la Alcaldía municipal, quien se se desempeña como director del área del medio ambiente, ella sus mayores sueños son mantener siempre su familia unida y birndarle un lugar digno a sus dos pequeños hijos donde crescan felices para que sean hombres y mujeres de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en: Maritza, age 25, works as a primary school teacher in the Salomón Ibarra Mayorga School in the community of Los Angeles.  She is applying for her fifth loan with the purpose of improving the kitchen in her house.  She is well recognized in her community as an honest, hardworking, and very responsible person.  She has the support of her husband with her commitments.  He helps to make loan payments as a worker for the municipality, where he is employed as the area director for the environment.  Maritza's biggest dreams are to keep her family united and offer a dignified home for her two small children where their happiness increases so that they can become a man and woman who are productive members of society.

loans.use: to improve the kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Masiga Group

texts.en:
Mavis is a 51-year-old widowed mother of three chidren aged 32, 23, and 21, one of whom is still attending school. She has two additional dependents, her grandchildren. In business for five years, Mavis operates from home, buying her products in the town of Chiredzi. She also earns additional income from renting out rooms.

Mavis' main business challenge is chicks that die prematurely due to heat. She is requesting this loan to buy more chicks, stock feeds, and medicines. These purchases should enable her to increase her profits and take better care of her family and orphaned grandchildren. Within the next five years, Mavis hopes to be able to rear chickens on a large scale and supply shops and schools in town.

loans.use: to buy chicks, stock feeds, and medicine.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.es:
Emerenciana es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar, tiene 50 años, ella es transportista, tiene 2 combis, tiene 3 hijos, es socia de Finca hace 16 años.
Emerenciana empezó sin saber como hacer un negocio y en Finca le enseñaron y siempre le apoyaron, solo su esposo trabajaba llevando a la selva verduras con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprarse un carro y un terreno, cuando todo le iba muy bien sufrió una estafa y hasta ahora esta pagando esa deuda, pero Finca siempre le ayudó nunca la dejaron sola, ella valora mucho eso y da gracias que ya falta muy poco para que termine de pagar, pero nunca dejo de trabajar con mucha fuerza, en esos momentos de desesperación recuerda las palabras de la Morenita “En el camino siempre habrá piedras, pero tú, nunca te detengas”, y así lo hizo, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en los repuestos de los carros y la gasolina, lo que mas anhela es poder tener su propia flota de carros.
texts.en:
Emerenciana is a member of the communal bank “Despertar,” or “to awaken.” She is 50 years old and has 3 children, and has been a member of Finca for 16 years. She works in transportation and owns 2 vans. Emerenciana began without knowing how to run a business. At Finca, they taught her how and have always supported her. 

Her husband had been working carrying vegetables to the forest. With a lot of effort, he was able to purchase a car and a plot of land. When everything was going well for him, he was the victim of fraud. To this day, he is paying off this debt. Finca always supported them and never left them on their own. She really appreciates this and is thankful that they are not far from finishing the payment. 

She never stopped working hard. In moments of desperation, she would remember the words of the Black Madonna, “En el camino siempre habrá piedras, pero tú, nunca te detengas”, “On your path, there will always be stones, but you, never let them stop you.” So she didn’t, and now she will use this loan to invest in spare parts and gasoline. Her greatest wish is to have her own fleet of cars.

loans.use: purchase spare car parts and gasoline

loans.name: Mahuclo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUCLO est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Honorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Honorine est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Honorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Honorine est mariée à un maçon du nom de Marcel. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Honorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Honorine vend depuis trois ans, de l’huile végétale à son domicile. Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Honorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUCLO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The MAHUCLO group is made up of four friends. This is the third time this group is seeking financial aid from ALIDé in order to increase the level of its business. The group representative, Honorine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Honorine is 41 years old and lives in Benin. Honorine did not attend school. Honorine is married to a mason named Marcel. The couple has three children, all of whom attend school and of which two are still in their care. Honorine lives with her husband and children. The couple shares the household expenses. In order to meet the needs of her family, Honorine has been selling vegetable oil from her home for three years. Honorine stocks up at a market in Benin. In the goal to satisfy her clientele and to increase her revenues, Honorine is seeking a third loan with ALIDé with the other members of the MAHUCLO group. The first two loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old and married to Naomi. They have one child. He has been operating a posho mill business for the last year, earning a monthly income of Kes 64,000.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. for Kes 80,000. He intends to use the funds to purchase maize to grind into maize flour at his posho mill. He plans to save the additional profits and invest them back into the business.

His hopes and dreams are to buy another posho mill and open a retail shop to sell assorted grains.

loans.use: To buy maize for his posho mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Move his business into a permanent room and purchase more cell phone accessories for resell.

loans.name: Vinemoto

texts.en: Vinemoto is a 42 year old mother of 5 children, 3 working and 2 in school.  Her husband works for Samoa National Provident Fund as a driver.  Vinemoto’s business is sewing. It’s her favorite hobby that was taught to her by her mother.  Vinemoto is a brave woman, who has worked for some organizations in the past years.  Vinemoto wasn’t happy about her working life because she knew she had a talent that she needed to shine.  So she resigned 25 years ago and started her own sewing business.  Vinemoto’s talent enabled her to start her business and at the same time build up her skills and talent while earning.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of fabrics, sewing materials and tools for maintaining her sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan to invest in buying furniture, in maintaining the restaurant to improve its appearance, and to buy new kitchen equipment

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Mrs Choun S. is 35 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She is a teacher and earns a dollar per day. Her husband is a construction foreman and he recruits workers to help him in his work and earns five dollars a day.  They have 2 children. They are requesting a loan to pay wages of their workers.

loans.use: To pay wages of workers

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Dilafruz is relatively new to business. She sells clothing, footwear, and schoolbags for children. Recently, Dilafruz turned 20. Sales profits contribute to her family’s budget, as Dilafruz lives with her parents. Dilafruz joined MicroInvest in April and has already earned a reputation of exemplary borrower. Her new loan, Dilafruz plans to use to purchase fall collection of children’s clothing.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Дилафруз занимается бизнесом сравнительно недавно. Она продает детские одежду и обувь. Также у нее в ассортименте школьные сумки. Недавно Дилафруз исполнилось 20 лет. Доходы от занятия торговлей дополняют семейный бюджет семьи Дилафруз, так как она живет с родителями. В Микроинвест она кредитуется с апреля месяца, и уже показала себя как образцовая клиентка. Новый займ она собирается потратить на приобретение осеннего ассортимента детской одежды.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Elba Francisco

texts.en: Elba says she is a woman who has always struggled for existence and for a better life.   She is 45 years old and has three children.  Her husband is a farmer.  Ten years ago, Elba started a small business, but she had to leave it for a while because of illness.  She used to sell shoes, shirts and pants.  Right now, she is selling ice and alcoholic drinks in her house, but she wants to restart her first business.  She needs a loan which will allow her buy clothing in bulk and shoes in order to start her sales activity.  Restarting the sales activity will help her diversify her sources of income and earn more for the sake of her family.

loans.use: buy bulk clothing so as to restart her first business; she used to sell shoes, shirts and pants

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy is a man of great physical and spiritual strength. Day by day, he works arduously in order to yield great results with his crops. For this reason, he goes forth every morning with great determination and the tools necessary to complete his work. Thanks to his vigor, he has been able to support his family and provide them with both great fortune and an education. He efficiently supports his three children with his job, which has also permitted him to open a small grocery store in order to further provide for his daily family expenses. While Roy looks after his crops in the field, his wife is in charge of the grocery store that the family operates out of their home. Roy has inculcated his young children with this model of diligent labor so that they can conduct themselves adequately in life. He sees the good behavior of his older kids, who form an important part of their society. He is requesting a loan in order to increase production with the purchase of more supplies for his crops. Let’s work together with this prodigious father so that he may continue sowing hope with the anticipation of reaping happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Roy, es un hombre poseedor de mucha fortaleza física y espiritual, día a día trabaja arduamente para así obtener una muy buena producción y cosecha, es por eso que con mucho empeño sale cada mañana llevando a cuestas las herramientas que utilizará para un mejor desempeño de su labor. Gracias al ímpetu que tiene ha logrado sostener y brindar a su familia educación y ventura. Con su trabajo mantiene eficientemente a sus tres hijos y esta actividad también le ha permitido abrir una bodega para apoyar con los gastos diarios del hogar. Mientras él permanece en el campo cuidando los cultivos para que en la cosecha pueda obtener excelentes frutos de su duro trabajo su esposa se encarga de brindar sus servicios en la pequeña bodega de casa.Este modelo de labor diligente ha sido inculcado en cada uno de sus seis hijos desde muy pequeños para que se conduzcan adecuadamente por la vida y puede observar con mucha alegría la buena conducta de sus hijos mayores dentro de su sociedad. Él solicita un préstamo para incrementar su producción con la compra de más insumos para su cultivo.Solidaricémonos con este prodigioso padre para que continúe sembrando esperanzas a fin de que pueda cosechar mucha felicidad.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
I've had my business for over 10 years, I sell new and used clothes. This business is a strong source of income for my family since I'm a single mom. I would like to invest and purchase new clothes and shoes. I request a loan for $500 to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 10 años con mi negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera. Quiero invertirle mas al negocio sin descapitalizarme comprar más ropa nueva y zapatos. Solicito un préstamo de $500.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mir Sayaad

texts.en: Mir Sayaad lives with his own individual family (i.e., not in an extended family) in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. He is a man with 10 years' experience in his business. He has a retail shop with good numbers of customers. He wants to expand his shop so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his inventory of everyday necessities and make good income to support his family. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his inventory of everyday necessities

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
My name is Shamshad B.. I am 35-years-old, the group leader and a mother of five children. I create embroidered dresses. I started this business after my marriage to add additional income for the family. My husband runs a leather tannery and he needs a loan to expand his business. I feel that women should work side by side with men to eradicate poverty completely out of their houses.

My group members are requesting loans for the following businesses: Razia A. D.’s son sells car tires; Nasreen D. wants to purchase cloth in bulk; Bushra A. runs a beauty salon.

loans.use: Expand leather tannery

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 40-years-old and is married with four children; ages 24, 20, 13 and 7. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 13 and 8. Rukia owns a small food vendor store which she started in 1998. She works from 6AM to 10PM and earns a monthly profit of approximately $180.

Rukia has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She now hopes for another so she can purchase more food items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products for resale

loans.name: Felix  Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. R. is an electrician and repairs electronic items, wiring, and sells materials refurnished electronics. He works with his son who is also an electrician. He's been a Kiva client for ten years and has been approved so far for twelve loans. With these past credits he's been able to improve his living conditionos. He is divorced and lives with his son.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor R. es electricista y se dedica a la reparacion de aparatos electricos, instalaciones electricas y venta de aparatos refaccionados, trabaja con su hijo quien tambien es electricista, es cliente nuestro desde hace diez años se le han otorgado doce creditos, en la casa donde vive ha mejorado las condiciones, es divorciado y vive con su hijo.

loans.use: Materials for work

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng L. is a grocer in Haong Khvow Village in Kampong Speu Province. In addition to this business activity, Mrs. Seng L. is a subsistence farmer. In this business, she has insufficient draft animals to plow the field. Therefore, she asked for a loan to build her profit by buying two cows to plow her cultivatable land. Mrs. Seng L. is 29 and married with three children, one of whom is attending state school, while the other two are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Noeurn Nov, is a subsistence farmer and a motorbike driver with a cart in which he can transport his passengers for a fee. Previously, Mrs. Seng L. obtained a loan from AMK to start a grocery business. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows to plow her land

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya S. is an entrepreneur from Uzhgorod. She sells plastic flowers and sports bags in one of the local markets. She has been in this trade for seven years, and her experience and entrepreneural spirit have helped her business grow and be successful. 

Mariya has benefited from Nadiya Ukraine loans. She has increased her turnover capital and been able to remodel her apartment from the resulting business profits. Mariya has seen times of both success and failure. After her husband divorced her, she struggled with depression. However, her sister helped her start a business, and it gave Mariya a new hope. Mariya has learned not to give up and to believe in herself. She believes that the current loan will help her increase her turnover capital even more and allow her to eventually open another vending facility in the market.

loans.use: Increase in capital for running a retail business

loans.name: Mkasi's Tawaqal Group

texts.en:
25-year-old Mkasi is married with two children, aged 6 and 2. Since 2005, she has been a soup vendor where she works at her business from 8am to 12pm daily. She earns a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Mkasi now hopes for a loan to buy more meat for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have businesses as shopkeepers, clothes sellers and food vendors.

loans.use: To buy more meat for her soup business.

loans.name: Saliu

texts.en: Saliu F.,38, sells electrical parts and construction materials. She has been in this business since 2005. Saliu is married with four children and lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting a new loan to purchase a larger inventory of construction and electrical products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a larger inventory of construction and electrical supplies for resale

loans.name: Diarry

texts.fr: Diarry K., 49 ans, veuve avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade depuis 3 ans. Elle veut acheter et revendre des tissus teintés. Son activité secondaire est la vente de pâte d’arachide qu’elle produit par la transformation des graines qu’elle achète sur le marché. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charges les besoins de sa famille. <b>Diarry sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Diarry K. is a 49-year-old widow with five children under her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Vivane Wade for three years. She wants to purchase and resell dyed fabrics. Her other job consists of selling peanut butter which she makes with peanuts that she buys at the market. Her income allows her to support her family. Ms. K. is requesting a loan which will be repaid in one lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling of dyed fabrics and peanut butter

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is Olga P.. She sells shoes in her home town of Nikopol. She started this business 9 years ago. Due to her unbelievable determination and stamina she managed to grow her trade within these past years. Currently, she has about $4,000 invested in inventory. Her income is about $2,000 a month. 

Olga has just opened a second store. She is hoping to get a loan of 5800 Grivnas ($1000 USD) to stock it with new clothing items. Olga is a skilled and experienced business woman who knows how to identify a problem and come up with a proper solution even in the most challenging situations. We believe Olga’s professionalism and willingness to go all the way to achieve her goals will help her persevere and repay this loan without any problem.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Ouy

texts.en: Ouy V., 25, is married and lives with her husband and child in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. She and her husband earn income making and selling cakes. They are able to make around US$5 per day. The couple is also responsible for looking after their old parents. To make more money, Ouy V. is asking for a loan of US$600 to be able to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate as a motor-taxi.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Mily Caronila

texts.en:
Mily C. E. is a 22-year-old entrepreneur who sells salchipapas (Peruvian dish consisting of hot dogs and french fries) from a cart on a highway near her home in Carabayllo, a northern suburb of Lima, Peru. She is requesting this loan of 600 soles to help expand her business; she wants to be able to offer a wider variety of food options, to have a covering for her cart, and to add lights to it as well. She will pay back the loan over a period offour months. This married mother of two children, aged 5 and 2, works from 5pm to 10pm every night at her salchipapas business and has been doing so since the age of 14.

She views this loan as the first step to achieving her greater goals. One day she hopes to convert her salchipapas cart business into a restaurant. Then she wants to have her own house and be able to have enough room in it to open a weekend retreat hotel. While the process of achieving her dreams is likely to be a long one, this loan will help her take the next step in it. She believes she already has part of her dream achieved by owning her own business, however small it may be.

loans.use: To invest in salchipapas dinner business

loans.name: José

texts.es: José, de 39 años es padre de dos hijos, convive hace aproximadamente 13 años con la madre de sus hijos, tiempo en el cual pudo construir su casa en una zona alta cercana a sus campos de cultivo. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a labrar la tierra, siembra frutos cítricos y plátanos, pero no solo se ocupa en su chacra, sino que también trabaja para los vecinos que requieran de sus servicios para abrir trochas, dependiendo el tamaño cobra entre 200 a 300 soles, de acuerdo a los arbustos que estén en la tierra, según la dificultad varía el precio. Cuando llega el momento de la cosecha de sus frutos prepara la carga para llevarla al mercado, esto lo realiza cada quincena o fines de mes. El resto de los días recoge la cosecha desde las 4.00am, ya que tiene que preparar con tranquilidad la carga y horas más tarde el calor intenso y no le deja trabajar cómodamente. Cuando hay compradores en el campo vende por arrobas, que consiste en 12 kilos de plátano, todos estos preparativos los realiza para los meses de abril y mayo, donde cuesta mejor el plátano; mientras que los cítricos, su buena temporada es en los meses de enero a marzo. José prefiere pagar el transporte de sus frutas a la ciudad y venderlas él mismo, porque así le es más rentable que vendiendo a los compradores que van a las chacras y pagan un precio menor. Es la primera vez que pide préstamo con MFP, y tiene la predisposición de pagar con puntualidad, ya que no quiere fallarles a los demás socios de su banco comunal que ya están en el sexto préstamo, pues él acaba de ingresar. Con el dinero solicitado podrá mantener su chacra con el abonado correspondiente, y considera que es lo suficiente por el momento.
texts.en:
José is 39 and the father of two children. He has been living with the mother of his children for roughly 13 years, during which she has been able to build a house in the highlands near his farmland. He has been working the land since he was very young, sowing citrus fruit and bananas. In addition to tending his farm, he works for his neighbours who need his services to create trails for which he charges between 200 and 300 soles depending on the size of the trail, the size of the shrubs to be removed, and the difficulty of the particular job. At harvest time, he prepares loads of fruit to take to market, usually every two weeks or at month-end. At other times, he harvests from 4:00 in the morning as he must take his time to prepare the loads correctly and later in the day it is intensely hot and uncomfortable to work in. When there are buyers in the area he sells in bulk: bananas are sold in 12 kilogram loads. He makes these preparations in April and May, when the price of bananas is better. Citrus fruit, however, are at their peak from January to March. José prefers to pay to have his fruit transported to the city and sell it himself because he makes more money this way than by selling to the buyers who come to the farms and pay a lower price. This is the first loan he is asking for from MFP and he is able to pay on time as he does not want to let down the other members of his community bank who are on their sixth loan, as he is a new member. He will use the loan to fertilize his farm, and he feels this is enough for now.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farms.

loans.name: Arusha Group

texts.en:
Tausi S., age 60, is married with four children ages 30, 26, 24 and 13. She also takes care of an orphan. She has a business of mama rishe (Kiswahili food vendor). She started this business 8 years ago and works daily from 6am until 4pm. She is able to make a monthly profit of around $189. 

This will be Tausi’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock of food and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to improve the place where she sells her food. 
	
Tausi will share this loan with her loan group Arusha, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Tausi is right of center, sitting.

loans.use: To improve the place where she sells her food

loans.name: Simona Esperanza

texts.es:
La venta de cosméticos es el negocio al cual se dedica la señora Simona Esperanza M. en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde es originaria. 

Ha logrado salir adelante en la venta de cosméticos por lo que ha mejorado sus ventas desde el momento que tomó la decisión de trabajar con Ceprodel en el otorgamiento de los créditos. Hoy en día ella una vez más espera ser beneficiada por Ceprodel obteniendo un  crédito para la compra de los cosméticos que tanto requiere para continuar ofreciéndolos a sus clientes en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Selling cosmetics is the business of Mrs. Simona Esperanza Munguia. She does this in the Terminal Market in her hometown of Leon, Nicaragua. Her cosmetics business has progressed successfully since she started working with the Ceprodel agency, which is providing her with credit on a regular basis. Once again she is requesting a working capital loan to enable her to purchase additional merchandise for resale to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia A. is 48 years old. She is married and has three children, two daughters and one son. According to her, her son is learning a trade and one daughter is in junior high school. The other daughter has yet to start school. Her husband is a cocoa/palm nut farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and the palm oil production business.  
Sophia trades in foodstuffs. She says she procures foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, yam, and fruits such as oranges, banana, etc. and treks to other towns to sell. She buys from nearby farms. Sophia wants a loan to procure the foodstuffs in bulk so that she can distribute to her increasing number of customers. She wants to help her husband improve their standard of living and give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.ru: Сулаймонов Юсуфчон - мужчина 38 лет. Женат отец 4-х детей. Юсуфчон с юности занимался откормом  скота помогая родителям. Из за финансового кризиса  Юсуфчон не давно приехал с Российской Федерации из заработков так как их строительную бригаду сократили и он остался без работы. Так как в селе нет работы Юсуфчон хочет увеличит количество своего домашнего скота. Юсуфчону нравится заниматься скотоводством. Жена Юсуфчона работает доярка в местной ферме и в свободное время помогает мужу.
texts.en:
Yusufjon S. is 38 years old. He is married and the father of 4 children. He recently returned from working in Russia, since his construction team was slashed and he was left without work. Since there is no work in the village Yusufjon wants to expand his herd of livestock. He enjoys animal husbandry. His wife works as a milker at a local farm and helps her husband in her spare time.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock

loans.name: Willian Enrique

texts.es: El señor William Enrique es un hombre trabajador que ha logrado sobresalir a delante con su negocio desde hace mas de ocho año tiene dos molinos en su casa de habitación el cual día a día trabaja, el compro los molinos con ahorros y parte de prestamos. Tiene 39 años de edad, reside en Lomas de Guadalupe en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 6,11 y 16 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Con este crédito quiere invertir en una pequeña pulpería que tiene en la compra de carnes, cereales, dulces y productos lácteos. Sus planes es poder seguir incrementando sus ventas y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
William Enrique is a very hard working man. He has been able to get ahead in his business. For more than eight years he has had two mills in his house. He works with them day to day. He bought the mills with savings and part of loans. He is 39, and he lives in Lomas de Guadalupe in the city of Managua. He and his wife have three children, 6, 11, and 16. The children are in school. With this loan he wants to invest in a small mini market that he has. He will buy meat, cereal, sweets, and dairy products. His plans are to be able to keep increasing his sales and to help his children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat and cereal

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es: La señora tiene una caseta en el Mercado Villa Sebastian Pagador, venD. variedad D. lanas y chinelas desD. hace 10 años, el puesto D. venta es D. su propiedad, sus clientes son generalmente D. la zona, quienes le tienen mucha estima. Su esposo es albañil, viven en anticrético, tiene un hijo que depenD. directamente D. ellos, sus otros dos hijos ya son mayores.
texts.en:
Eleuteria has a stand at the Villa Sebastian Pagador market where she has been selling yarn and sandals for the past 10 years. She owns her stand and her clients are mostly from the region and they love her very much. Her husband is a construction worker and they lie in Anticretico. She has a little boy that depends on them, while her other two children are adults.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of yarn and sandals for the summer

loans.name: Bilda Marisol

texts.es: Bilda Marisol M. D. G. D. 36 años D. edad resiD. en Ilopango junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos. DesD. hace 12 años ella posee una pequeña librería y una venta D. perfumes y cosméticos, los cuales logra venderlos con mucha facilidad. Bilda solícita un préstamo ya que uno D. sus mayores sueños es poder surtir su librería y poder equiparla con todo lo que los clientes demanden, así también desea crecer más en el negocio D. los cosméticos es por esto que a través D. dicho préstamo espera comprar más D. estos últimos.
texts.en:
Bilda Marisol M. D. G. is 36 years old and lives in Ilopango with her husband and 4 children.
She has owned a bookstore for 12 years and also offers perfumes and cosmetics that sell well.
Bilda is requesting a loan because one of her greatest dreams is to stock her bookstore with everything her customers want. She also wants to expand her cosmetics business and she hopes that this loan will allow her to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bookstore items and cosmetics

loans.name: Belinda Walkiria

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Belinda C. tiene su propio negocio de pulpería el cual atiende muy alegremente con el propósito de mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia.

El motive principal por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y de esta forma mejora su situación y salir adelante en el negocio que ella posee.
texts.en:
Mrs. Belinda C. has a grocery shop at the Central Market in the city of Chinandega, where she is happy to work in order to improve her family economic situation. The main reason she has gone to Ceprodel is because she needs a loan for the purchase of grocery products that will help her to improve her financial situation and succeed in the business she owns.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Maria es casada, tiene 42 años y 7 hijos, Maria viaja  a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra quesos, cereales, animales, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también por su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos y cereales.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank "Lirio" (Lily).

Maria is married, 42 years old, and has 7 children. Maria travels to the different fairs in her region, where she buys cheese, cereal, animals, and products that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho and also in her home.

Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles which will be invested in buying pigs and cereal. Maria's dreams are to improve her house and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and cereal

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris la couture et s'est spécialisée depuis deux ans dans le commerce de pagnes Baoulés qui sont des pagnes très appréciés à Lomé. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge 02 personnes. Son stock ayant connu une baisse, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour reconstituer son stock avec 20 pagnes Baoulés de nouvelle qualité.
texts.en:
This lady learned sewing and has been specialized for the past two years in selling a sort of "pagne" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) which is greatly appreciated in Lomé: Baoulé fabrics. She is married and responsible for 2 people. Her stocks are low, so she is asking WAGES for a loan that will allow her to replenish them by buying 20 lengths of new-quality Baoulé "pagne" fabric.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing lengths of 'pagne Baoulé'

loans.name: Toir

texts.en:
Toir is married and has 5 children. He was unemployed without a way to sustain his family, so he looked for a way to start his own business to be able to face his costs. With much effort Toir initiated his own business with very little merchandise. Selling foodstuff, little by little he was able to maintain his home and start to grow his business, incorporating the sales of grocery items, and improving the quality of service he offered. Toir needs a loan of 8000 Somoni, which he will use to provide more foodstuff and continue to work hard to sustain his family. He and his family very much appreciate your support in helping them.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuff for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
Melita tiene 37 años, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer con muchos objetivos, por eso se esfuerza cada día en su trabajo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso. Estas prendas las ofrece a sus amistades y vecinos, tanto al contado como al crédito, también viaja hasta algunos caseríos de su región para intercambiar sus prendas con productos comestibles (plátanos, yuca, maíz, fréjol, pescado, gallinas y otros), los mismos que revende de regreso. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años y le va muy bien, adicionalmente, por las noches, trabaja en una pequeña casa de hospedaje como recepcionista. A Melita le gusta estar activa y trabaja por el bienestar de sus hijos, a quienes desea darles lo necesario para progresar en el futuro. 
Este es su 9no crédito con MFP, lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes se comprenden, son responsables y solidarios. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ropa para aumentar sus ventas y con ello sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Melita is 37 years old, a single mother and lives with her three children in her own house. She is a woman with many objectives, because of this she makes an effort every day in her work selling second hand clothes. She offers these clothes to her friends and neighbours for cash and credit. She also travels to other villages in the region to exchange her articles of clothing for edible products (plantains, cassava, corn, beans, fish, chicken and other items) which she resells on her return. She has been involved in this activity for two years and it is going very well for her. Additionally, at night she works in a small guesthouse as a receptionist. Melita likes to be active and work for the wellbeing of her children, who she wants to give everything they need to progress in the future. This is her ninth loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her community bank is that all the members understand each other and are responsible and supportive. With the money that she is now applying for she will buy a greater quantity of clothes to increase her sales and in so doing, her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the group coordinator of the Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Poderosas (Powerful Women). Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom have recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic) and Dominican clients. The group is based in Puerto Plata, a small rural zone that has basic, but unreliable, electricity and running water.

Maritza lives with her husband and has three sons. She is a professional cosmetologist and runs a beauty salon. She will use this loan to purchase additional beauty supplies and cosmetics. She hopes to one day have a better salon that is bigger.

Maritza has successfully repaid three loans and this is her fourth loan with Esperanza. These loans have helped to improve her quality of life and have enabled her to make investments.

loans.use: To buy additional beauty supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Mrs. Toch Khoem Group

texts.en: Mrs. Toch K. is a group leader of four in Pun Phnum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. Um Ngoy, is a pig breeder and he is also a thatch seller in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so Mrs. Toch K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and she also buy more thatch to re-sell for and income. Mrs. Toch K. is 35 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and she also buy more thatch to re-sell for and income.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en: Akbar has been in the house-repair business for four years. He was born in 1975 and is married with two children. The N. family lives in the Fuzuli region. Now Akbar needs a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his business.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro  es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus seis hijos en el caserío El Morante, distrito de Olmos, tres horas y media al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo, cuatro de sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la zona.

Desde hace más de 23 años se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y ovejas, los cuales ofrece en venta a los compradores que visitan su caserío con frecuencia. Esta actividad es la única fuente de ingreso económico con la que cuenta para sustentar los gastos de su hogar.

Pedro ha pensado en mejorar la alimentación de los cerdos que cría para lograr su venta con mayor rapidez. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimentos balanceados.

Su más grande sueño es hacer mejoras en su casa que está construida de material rústico y cambiar las calaminas que le sirven de sombra ya que están deterioradas. El es un padre ejemplar y responsable.
texts.en:
Pedro, 57, is a married head of household that lives with his wife and six children in the El Morante farmstead, Olmos district which is three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo. Four of his children are students in a local school. For more than 23 years he has raised pigs and sheep which he sells to buyers that visit his farm frequently. This activity produces his only source of income with which he meets household expenses. Pedro has thought to improve his pigs' nutrition so that he can sell them sooner. For this reason he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1,000 sol, loan which will be used to buy nutritionally balanced feed. His greatest wish is to make improvements to his home which is built with rudimentary materials and to replace the metal sheets, that are used for shade, which are very deteriorated. He is an exemplary and responsible father.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed for pigs.

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es:
Los socios D. L. alcancía  comunal “Somos Impacto 2006”, está conformada por 11 socios, L. cual se encuentra ubicada en L. parte baja D. Huaycán, distrito D. Ate departamento D. Lima, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: venta D. golosinas, ropa, comida y otros a L. confección D. ropa (polo y buzos).
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desD. hace 4 años, actualmente asume el cargo D. presidenta L. señora Margarita S. P., conviviente, con 5 hijos, D. los cuales 2 son dependientes. Margarita se dedica a L. confección D. carteras en tejido a macramé, lana y otros, para después venderlos en los mercados y según pedidos, elL. para perfeccionar sus productos participo en talleres D. tejido, con el cual realiza lindos modelos D. cartera. Margarita   con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo apoya a su esposo (quien es pintor D. carros), en los gastos en el hogar, y en los estudios D. sus 2 hijos.
Margarita anheL. en el futuro establecer una tienda y aprovechara  L. campaña naviD.ña, para L. compra D. materiales: macramé, lana, accesorios y adornos  naviD.ños, para poder incrementar sus ganancias, para así seguir mejorando   educación D. sus hijos.
Nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo que nos brindan mediante los préstamos y nos comprometemos a cumplir con el pago D. las cuotas en el pL. establecido.
texts.en:
The "Somos Impacto 2006" communal bank, located in the lower part of Huaycán, Ate district, Lima department, is maD. up of 11 members who are involved in various commercial activities like: sale of sweets, clothing, food; others make clothing (polo shirts and sweatshirts). They have collaborated with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the last 4 years. Currently, the group president is Margarita S. P.. She lives with her life partner and has five children, two of whom are still dependent on her. Margarita makes purses on order out of macramé, wool and other materials for sale in the market. To perfect her technique, she attended various workshops where she learned to make pretty purses. Margarita, thanks to her work effort, is a help to her husband (who is an automobile painter) with household expenses and in paying for her two children's education. Margarita hopes in the future to have a store and will take advantage of the Christmas shopping season to buy supplies: macramé, wool, accessories and Christmas decorations to improver her earnings and be able to improve her children's education. Our members appreciate the help given by these loans and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for Christmas shopping season.

loans.name: Luriya

texts.en:
Luriya J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and onions and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of onions and groundnuts to make paste to sell. Luriya is 30 years old and is married; her husband is a security guard. She has four children; they are all in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of onions and groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe Mariela

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, la señora Guadalupe S. se ha dedicado con gran ahinco a su actividad de venta de artesanías siendo comercializadas en su propia casa de habitación donde muchos clientes le visitan a diario para llevar las bellas artesanías.

Este negocio es muy importante para ella porque de aquí obtiene las ganancias para mantener su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de dichas artesanías con el propósito de continuar con su venta y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella misma y de su familia.
texts.en:
In the state of Masaya, Mrs. Guadalupe S. has been extremely dedicated to her activity of selling crafts, which she sells from her own house. Many customers visit her daily in order to buy the beautiful handcrafts. This business is very important to her because it is where she takes income from to maintain her house, which demands so much her help. The loan she is requesting is to buy such crafts, with the intention to continue her selling business and so to improve her and her family’s life conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crafts

loans.name: Yart

texts.en: Yart S., 34, is married and lives with her five children. She works as a farmer in the Takeo province, typically earning US$1 each day, and is supported by her husband who works in house construction. On average, he makes US$2.50 a day. Three of the children are in school and one is a garment factory worker. Yart S. is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase rice and take off the husk, with the plan of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Irma Gudelia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes está integrado  por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que están dispuestas a salir adelante en su trabajo y vida cotidiana para entregarles un mejor porvenir a sus familias,  todas viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, urbe  hermosa por su cultura,  arquitectura, su gente, tradiciones  y su rica gastronomía.

Irma M. tiene 33 años  es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes,  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con sus  hijas  de 14, 11 y 3 años y su esposo  que trabaja como chofer de un camión en una ferretería, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Nuestra socia dedica  a la venta de confites y frutas a las afueras de una escuela y colegio lleva seis años realizando esta actividad teniendo días buenos y malos para  la venta pero siempre agradece a Dios,  por otro lado los fines de semana vende salchipapas en  cualquier localidad que haya fiestas o programas.

Irma  se encuentra  dos  años trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación  y éstos le  ayudaron a cancelar los gastos de una operación de  apéndice que le realizaron, ahora con el nuevo préstamo va a  comprar  caramelos, chupetes, papas en fundas, mangos y los ingredientes para la elaboración de espumilla.

Su sueño es llegar  a tener su casa propia
texts.en:
The “Nuevos Horizontes” (“New Horizons”) Communal Bank is made up of very hardworking women committed to getting ahead and providing a better future for their families. They all live in the city of Cuenca, a beautiful city known for its culture, architecture, traditions, and food. Irma M. is 33 years old and a member of Nuevos Horizontes. She lives in Cuenca with her husband and her three children, ages 14, 11, and 3. Her husband is a truck driver for a hardware store and they rent their home. For six years, Irma has sold sweets and fruit outside of a school. She has good days and bad days with her business, but she is always grateful to God. During the weekends she sells “salchipapas” (hot dogs and french fries) wherever there are parties or other public activities. Irma has worked with the Foundation for two years and previous loans helped her repay the expense of an appendectomy. She will use the current loan to purchase candy, lollipops, french fries, mangoes, and ingredients to make meringue. Her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, lollipops, french fries, mangoes, and ingredients to make meringue

loans.name: Reynan

texts.en: Reynan M. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin province. He is 28 years old and is single. Reynan owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Reynan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Reynan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny K. (pictured here), age 57, and her husband, Mr. Meng Pen, age 55, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home and two have full-time employment in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ny K. has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old, a skill she learned form her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then in turn brings them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a farmer for 24 years. 

Ny is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 70 years old and married with six children. His primary business is animal and crop farming which he has been doing for a number of years. He sells milk to his neighbors. James has also built some structures that he rents out as residential houses and shops. He lives in Kinoo which is a busy business center on the outskirts of Nairobi. This is his fourth loan with KADET — his only source of financing. James wants to add more structures so that he can rent them out and get more income. He hopes to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To build more shops and houses to rent.

loans.name: Uzoma

texts.en: Since 2008, Uzoma has had a shop selling handbags which she buys in bulk at a discount outside of Lagos.  Uzoma is 37 years old, married and has five children; her business allows her to care for her aged parents who are living with her and support her husband in meeting their family expenses. She is now requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more handbags to sell and thanks you for your support, promising to repay her loan on the due date.

loans.use: To purchase more handbags to sell.

loans.name: Rita María

texts.es:
La señora Rita María M. A., es una joven de  23 años, es casada y su esposo labora como Albañil, apoyándole con los gastos del hogar, aun ellos no tienen hijos, pero esperan mejorar sus condiciones económicas para comenzar ha procrearlos.

Los ingresos de la familia son muy limitados, ellos esperan que se les apoye en la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar unas remodelaciones al hogar, sobre todo con la reconstruccion de su baño personal debido a  que esta en mal etado y perjudica la salud e higiene de la familia, el apoyo que se le brinde a la familia ayudara a ambicionar con la idea de agrandar la familia a corto plazo, pues es una de las mayores ilusiones del matrimonio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rita María M. A. is a married young woman who is 23 years of age. Her husband works as a mason and helps with the household finances. They do not have children, but they want to improve their financial condition before starting a family.

Rita’s family income is very limited, so she hopes to receive assistance with purchasing construction materials to complete a few home remodeling projects. One such project is rebuilding her personal bathroom because it is in bad condition, which makes it harmful and unhealthy for her family. The support that will be provided to Rita and her husband will help them with their plans of expanding their family in the short term, which is one of the greatest thrills of marriage.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rebuild the main bathroom

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
Mariam B. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Together As One. She is 44 years old and married, with 6 children who range in age from 2 to 26 years old. Mariam could not continue her education through 3rd grade due to lack of financial support.

For 10 years, she has been selling hardware, such as nails, locks, and hinges, on a table at the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia. Mariam started selling with funds she borrowed from her savings club, but has now improved. She lacks shelter to do business, especially during the rainy season.

Mariam offers good service to her customers in order to keep them returning. She plans to use her 10,000-LRD portion of this 42,000-LRD group loan to purchase more hardware, such as nails, locks, and hinges. Her goal and dream is to own a building-material store in the near future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mariam is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as nails, locks, and hinges

loans.name: Reyna Amparo

texts.es: Reyna Amparo tiene su actividad como es la venta de prendas como oro y plata. Hace más de 3 años, ella tiene la edad de 49 años, por lo que su inicio fue cuenta propia pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y sacrificarse para su familia, pues ella recorre largas distancias y ahora en la temporada lluviosa, siempre tiene su paragua a mano para protegerse. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de aretes, pulseras, cadenas, anillos, dijes entres otras cosas. lo que sueña es ampliar sus ventas cada día más.
texts.en:
Reyna Amparo is 49 years old and has been selling gold and silver jewelry for more than three years. She started her own business because she always enjoys working and is willing to make sacrifices for her family, such as traveling long distances. Since the rainy season has arrived, she always carries an umbrella with her to protect herself from the elements.

Reyna is requesting a loan to buy earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings, pendants, and other items. Her dream is to increase her sales every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings, pendants, and other items

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
La Sra. María Pérez es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada la ciudad más hermosa del Ecuador,  por sus calles, sus iglesias, su gastronomía, y su gente que es muy cordial y amable.

La Sra. María tiene 41 años de edad es casada, tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 19, 17, 15 y 13 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan para la economía del hogar y sus dos últimos hijo estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja como comerciante de varios productos, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de fantasías y bisutería, actividad que la realiza hace 20 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana sin descansar, labora desde las 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., y sus productos los vende recorriendo el mercado 9 de Octubre en Cuenca.

 Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo,  los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando mas productos de bisutería, su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio para superarse con su familia.
texts.en:
María Pérez, 41, is a member of the El Ahorro (The Savings) communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca considered to be Ecuador’s most beautiful city because of its streets, churches, gastronomy and cordial, kind residents. She’s married and has 4 children who are 19, 17, 15 and 13 years of age. The two oldest are employed and contribute to the family’s finances and the two youngest go to school in the city. Her husband is a merchant; he sells a variety of products. She does not own her own house, she rents. Our member is a costume jewelry merchant; she has been in this line of work for twenty years and works every day of the week with no time off from 9am until 5pm. She sells her products up and down the aisles in Cuenca’s 9 de Octubre market. She is in her 3rd loan cycle. The past loans have helped her business grow and she will use the new loan to buy more costume jewelry. Her goal is to continue growing in her business in order to get ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry: rings, earrings, necklaces, etc.

loans.name: Cindy Kaina

texts.es:
Cindy de 26 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana con una ecología en disolución), tiene un hijo y su esposo es albañil, ellos viven en una casa de caña. ella es profesora en reuniones del Programa “Children Internacional” (es un jardín de niños que tienen en su casa). 

Ella trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 12h00pm como profesora en el jardín de niños que tienen en su casa. Con la ayuda de su mama ha podido administrar con bien el jardín de niños.

 Pero como lo tiene en su casa y no tiene los medios adecuados para los niños ella quiere con el préstamo comprar cemento, bloques y arena para construir su casa mejor. En el futuro ella quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Cindy lives in El Paraíso, located in Guayaquil (a peri-urban zone with a deteriorating ecosystem). She has a son and her husband is a bricklayer. They live in a house made of reeds. She works from 7am to 12pm as a teacher for the "Children International" program, which is a kindergarten for kids that meet in her house. With the help of her mother, she has been able to successfully run the kindergarten. However, because the kindergarten meets in her home and she does not have adequate means for the children she is requesting the loan which will be used to buy cement, cinder block and sand in order to build a better house. In the future she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina L., 37, resides in Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Primo L., a vendor, and is the mother of four children, one of whom is in college while the rest are staying at home. By the grace of God, Lina has managed to support her older child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college.
