Lina herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lina operates a variety store where she also does a little direct selling. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lina gets her supplies at a wholesale price and sells at a smal profit.  Her store is located next to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 21,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Lina dreams of giving all her children a good, high-quality education through her hard work. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: To expand her product inventory

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda A. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Canbanwa, Argao, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  Fish vending and frozen foods businesses. Her husband, Mariano A. Jr., is 60 years old and helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children who are 21 to 25 years old. 

Leonarda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leonarda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 increased her business turnover and helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 45000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to buy more frozen products and more fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family. Leonarda A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg B. is 47 years old and has been living with her husband and daughter in the central province of Mongolia for 30 years. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband works as a driller for the Central Water Company in their town while her daughter is a student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Oyuntsetseg operates a hair salon in her town, sharing the salon and the rent with several of her friends who are beauticians and hairdressers. Oyuntsetseg started the salon in 1980 and since then her business has grown steadily over the years and is popular in the area. Although her cooperation with her friends has proven to be successful, Oyuntsetseg dreams of being on her own. She says, "I would like to open my own beauty and hair salon in the future." She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase beauty products for her business and to use some of the money for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Brigida Del Carmen

texts.es: Brigida Del Carmen de 38 años, vende ropa y calzado para poder solventar sus gastos, desde muy joven comenzó con ayuda propia porque no tenía aun un ingreso fijo. En ocasiones va a recorrer las calles para encontrar clientes que le compren su mercadería, pero el estilo de venta que ella tiene es venderles a sus amigas y vecinos. Tiene un lugar establecido, pero sabe que vende más ofreciendo sus productos de manera ambulante.  Ella quiere continuar con sus ventas por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo pantalones, camisas, sandalias entre otras cosas. Uno de sus sueños es termina de construir su casa y ya establecer un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Brigida Del Carmen is 38 years old. She sells clothing and footwear to be able to meet her financial obligations. She started at a very young age because she didn't have a fixed income. Occasionally she roams the streets to find customers to buy her merchandise, but she prefers to sell to her friends and neighbors. She wants to continue her sales so she is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, sandals and other things. One of her dreams is to finish building her house and to establish a local for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Dovi Adjovi

texts.fr: dovi est âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique et très animé de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie. elle a une ancienneté de 10 ans dans ce commerce. sa clientèle est grande et elle doit très souvent s'approvisionner pour bien les satisfaire. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, le second crédit qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre de s'approvisionner avec 5 rouleaux de popeline bleu, 5 rouleaux de popeline blanc, 5 rouleaux de popeline vert et divers.
texts.en:
Dovi is 46 years old, married and mother to one child. She lives with her family in the Adidogomé district, which is a busy neighborhood on the outskirts of Lomé. She has an income-generating activity selling haberdashery products and has ten years experience in this trade. She has a large client base and has to get fresh supplies regularly in order to satisfy her customers. She has already had one loan from WAGES, which she repaid in full. She is requesting a second loan which will allow her to get supplies including five rolls of blue poplin, five rolls of white poplin and five rolls of green.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of haberdashery products

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol A., 37 years old, is married to a fisherman and lives on an island located in the middle of Laguna de Bay in the Philippines. The couple is blessed with two 2 children: an 11year old boy and 9 year old girl, who are both studying. She joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. a partner MFI of KIVA to have access on capital for starting a business. Since the lake is abundant with fish, and their main source of income is fishing, they decided to avail of loans to fund their fish vending business. She is applying for a new loan amounting PHP 20,000.00 to finance assembly of a fish trap, locally know as “skylab”, and a fish cage. She will buy materials for the construction and fingerlings to be place in the fish cage. She is optimistic that their profit will increase from this investment. She is hopeful that KIVA lenders will support her in their business plan.

loans.use: To buy materials for the assembly of fish cage and a fish trap locally known as "skylab".

loans.name: Carmen Marlene

texts.es:
Carmen Marlene T. C. tiene 26 años. Es casada vive con los hijos y el esposo vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 3 hijos.  

Carmen  pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Carmen trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz,  arroz y fréjol. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar seguir cultivando para tener dinero y comprar un carro.
Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Carmen Marlene T. C. is 26 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. She has 3 children.  

Carmen belongs to the Nueva Inspiración bank, located in the community of Anchoveta, which belongs to the Puerto Pechiche, Pueblo Viejo canton. It's a group dedicated to short cycle agricultural work, mainly corn, rice, and beans. This bank has 13 members. 

Carmen works in short cycle agriculture in corn, rice and beans. She makes the purchases in Guayaquil and sells them in a locale in her house and in the  Ventanas market. 

She is asking for the loan to buy corn, rice and beans. The support from the loan will help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to buy to continue planting to have money and buy a car. She likes to cook.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice and beans.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco V. M. tiene 42 años de edad y vive en su casa de propia, vivienda que está ubicada en una comunidad de la ciudad de Tarija.  Francisco  es casado tiene dos hijos dependiente de sus ingresos. Francisco se dedica al servicio de transporte libre de pasajeros como taxista esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace mas de 20 años, además se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando frutas como la uva y muy poco de papa pues su costo es mas elevado.

Francisco tiene la necesidad de comprar semillas de papa para sembrar en el terreno que hace poco tiempo compro, de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su esposa e hijos, es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de dichas semillas.
 
Francisco nos cuenta que quiere darle a su esposa e hijos toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco V. M. is 42 years old and lives in his own home located in a community of the city of Tarija.  He is married to Sra. Marina Janeth Altamirano Sandoval and they have two children.  Francisco works as a teacher in the rural areas and provides free transportation as a taxi driver in his spare time.  He has worked at both jobs for more than 20 years.  In addition, he is a farmer who grows fruits, such as grapes, and a few potatoes since the cost of cultivating them is more expensive.

Francisco needs to buy potato seedlings to plant on the plot of land he recently purchased.  This will help him improve his income so that he can provide a better life for his wife and children.  The loan will be used for the purpose of acquiring the potato seedlings.

Francisco says that he wants to provide his wife and children all the comforts that he can.  He says that with the next loan he requests, he plans to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Purchase potato seedlings

loans.name: Sandra Eloisa

texts.es: Sandra Eloísa tiene su negocio de manera ambulante, su mayor desafío recentinamente es no ofrecer la gran variedad de productos que sus clientes le solicitan. Sandra se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general tiene trabajando desde hace 13 años, por lo que se siente satisfecha con los financiamientos que ha realizado.  La señora solicita un nuevo préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio en la compra de ropa, cosméticos, calzado, sabanas, entre otras cosas. Su sueño es progresar y seguir adelante en su negocio. Ya que en esta época recibe muchos encargos.
texts.en:
Sandra Eloísa has an itinerant sales business.  Her greatest challenge is not having available the great variety of products her customers request.  She has sold general merchandise for 13 years and feels satisfied with the loans she has had.

She is asking for a new loan to buy clothes, cosmetics, footwear and bed sheets, among others.  Her dream is to make progress and continue forward with her business since this season she gets lots of orders.

loans.use: To buy assorted general merchandise.

loans.name: Batma's Group

texts.en:
Batma B. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Tashkomur, a small town in Jalalabad region.  Batma is 30 and married. Her husband works in construction. Together they bring up four children: a daughter and three sons.  The daughter and the oldest son are at school and the other sons are preschool age (under seven). 

Five years ago with the initial investment of 20000 soms Batma started to breed cattle. She earns money to cover family expense by reselling cattle after fattening at the higher price. Batma applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a cow and a calf for breeding. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle and improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel M. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 31 years old. Maricel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling rice in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Maricel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Vianka Group

texts.es:
El grupo Vianka lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Vianka J. quien tiene una tortillería y los fines de semanas vende nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo.
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo en especial en maíz, cerdo, leña etc.
Las otras integrantes son  Alba Z. vende comida y Flor Díaz vende ropa usada.
texts.en:
The “Vianka” group is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women from the capital, Managua. The coordinator for the group is Vianka J., who has a tortilla-making business and also sells nacatamales, made of corn and pork, on the weekend.

She will use the loan for her business with the goal of growing it. She will buy corn, pork, firewood, etc. 

The other members are Alba Z., who sells food, and Flor Díaz, who sells used clothing.

loans.use: To buy corn and pork

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine A. is 26 years old and is married with two children aged 1 and 4 years old. Vestine owns a small well-organized business selling shoes and has an experience of seven years. Her business is open from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. 

Vestine's husband is a salesman who works with her in the shoe store. 

Vestine has requested a loan in order to expand her business by purchasing more sacks of shoes. She hopes to use any profits to continue to grow her business, and she would like to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly M. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Milly has a business of selling clothes. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Milly sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Milly has requested for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Milly include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot and build her own house and also to start selling on wholesale only. Milly lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Paok

texts.en:
Mrs. Paok S. is a farmer who owns a 3 hectare plot of land. She cultivates rice to sell to support her family. She was born in 1970 and she is the mother of four children: two of them are employed in garment factories and the others are studying in a local public school. They live in Tonle village in Takeo province.

Mrs. S.'s husband, Mr. Det Yun, is a traditional musician and a traditional instrument maker who is able to earn some money to support the family. At present, Mrs.  S. has a problem because her husband’s workplace is far away from home. She is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, madre soltera, trabaja para una ferretería, la seguridad de su familia es esencial por tal sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda poco a poco ya que con el préstamo anterior instalo cerámica, en este ciclo de préstamo lo utilizara para la construcción de un porche por tal requiere compra materiales de construcción como: Cemento, hierro, arena, zinc entre otros materiales.
Agradece ala financiera por su apoyo para el desarrollo de un mejor nivel de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is a single mother who works for a hardware store.  With family safety foremost in her mind, she has plans to improve her home's infrastructure little by little.  With her previous loan she installed ceramic tiles.  She plans to use this cycle's loan to build a porch and, therefore, needs to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, sand and zinc, among other materials.

She is grateful for the financial support which allows her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie T. is from the village of Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 34 years old. Rosemarie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living,Rosemarie owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for her business comes from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. 

Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2011, Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. 

Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua F. is married and has five children. Her husband is a trader, and they live in Ntranoa near the town of Elmina.

Ekua runs a small store from which she sells things like soap, detergent and food items. She has been in business for eight years. Her earnings help pay for their household expenses.

Ekua wants to grow her business and so is asking for a loan. She intends to use the loan to buy a greater variety of goods to grow her customer base and sales. She intends to save her profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of goods

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 23 year-old married woman with a school-aged child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Marie has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like bags, shirts, etc., for her business.

Ana Marie has been in this business for 4 years.  In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough money to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her clothing business

loans.name: Háy's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of ten members. Mrs. Háy, born in 1950, is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members.

She and her husband, Mr. Sdeoung, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land which they use to grow vegetables and corn for supporting their family.  In order to improve their farming, Mrs. Háy would like to ask for a loan to help support her farming crops. 

They have four children: one is a farmer, two are car taxi drivers, and the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: to support her farming crops.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua K. sells cosmetics at Elmina, a fishing town in Ghana’s Central Region. She sells items such as talcum powder and slippers. Ekua does not own a shop and carries her wares in a metal container (as shown in the photograph), which she balances on her head. 

She wants to improve the selection of items she sells to attract more customers and improve her earnings. A loan from Kiva will allow her to buy more cosmetics for resale. Ekua intends to reinvest any extra earnings back into her business, which she has been in for two years, for further growth. 
She is married to a farmer and they have three children. Her earnings helps pay their kids’ school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Mutabarkhon

texts.en:
Mutabarkhon is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and is the loving mother of four children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. She has been engaged in clothing sales. She sells national clothes in the market called “Khair”. Mutabarkhon has been in this business for 15 years and she has broad experience. She has regular customers and a good income. She would like a loan of 8,000 TJS to purchase new, national clothes which will  enable her to attract new customers.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Tuichiboi

texts.en:
Tuichiboi is busy husband who has a secondary education. His wife is a hardworking woman and helps in her husband’s in his farming business, which involves growing potatoes and wheat. He has been a farmer for 11 years and has earned enough money to provide for his family but would like to increase his income by producing a larger harvest. To make this possible, he has applied for a loan for 3,500 TJS to buy fertilizer. He hopes to earn enough money to buy a car for his family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por la comunidad de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. Se caracterizan por ser personas muy amables y trabajadoras.
 
La Señora María tiene 23 años, es casada y ha concebido una hija de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora en una fábrica de bloques, no tienen casa propia por lo que están viviendo en casa de su suegra pero independientes.

Doña María labora en la agricultura, cultiva los campos de otras personas. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y chanchos a los que los vende en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su sexto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y esta contenta de tener muy buenas amigas en el, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes y chanchos para segir con su negocio.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Juventud", meaning "New Youth". She lives in the community of Del Valle Parish. This parish is of a cold climate and the population retain their culture and traditions. They are dedicated to commerce, livestock farming and agriculture. They are known to be very kind and hardworking people.

Maria is 23 years old, married, and she has a 3-year old daughter. Her husband works at a construction block manufacturing plant. They don't have a house of their own so they live with her mother-in-law, although they are independent.

Maria works in agriculture, working fields belonging to others. At home, she raises poultry, guinea pigs, and pigs which she sells in her community.

She is on her sixth loan with her communal bank and she is happy to have such good friends there. The funds from her loan will be invested in the purchase of poultry, guinea pigs, and pigs to keep up her business.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Anar 31 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Anar uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. On delayet yogurt,kefir iz moloka i prodayet ix sosedam.
texts.en: Anar is 31 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  He is married and has one child.  Anar has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for five years.  He started this business with his father.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to develop his business.  He makes yogurt and kefir from the milk and sells them to neighbors.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
Norly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Norly requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the repair of her motorcycle. Norly has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Norly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz belongs to a poor family and has six children. It is very difficult for her husband to fulfill the needs of his family with the limited income which he earns from his auto rickshaw driving business.
 
Shahnaz is very supportive lady by nature. She supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to change the body of his auto rickshaw as it has become rough and never makes a good impression on the passengers. 

Shahnaz is a very positive-minded person and confident that after changing his rickshaw body, her husband will not only be able to save his business asset but also be able to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To change the body of an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Kulmira's Group

texts.en:
Kulmira is the leader of this group. She is 48 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised a son and three daughters. The son works as a policeman, the older daughter is a teacher, the second daughter is a retailer and the youngest daughter studies at school.

 In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, Kulmira, together with her husband, breeds livestock. They started this activity in 1994 and now their monthly profit from reselling livestock is 8000 soms. This profit made it possible for them to purchase a vehicle. 

Kulmira wants to purchase four livestock animals for breeding, but she doesn’t have enough funds, thus she has applied for the loan. In the future she wants to see all her children get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
Doña Azucena, originaria de la ciudad de Granada, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos, es comerciante se dedica ala venta de ropa. Ella inicio vendiendo poca mercadería tales como trajes para niños, ropa interior, luego que tuvo un año de iniciado su negocio, hizo un préstamo que le ayudo a incrementar su mercadería y vender un poco mas ella vio buenos resultado así que decidió continuar. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería y surtir su negocio de nuevos productos. Con esta inversión de capital espera poder vender mas, hacer mas clientes y mejorar sus ingresos. Su próxima meta es hacerle reparaciones a su local para hacerlo mas seguro.
texts.en:
Doña Azucena is originally from the city of Granada. She is 54 years old and the mother of three children. Azucena is a merchant who sells clothing. She started out selling a few items such as children’s outfits and undergarments. A year into her business, she took out a loan to help increase her inventory. She began selling a little more and saw good results, so she decided to continue in this manner.

Azucena is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can restock her business with new products. With this investment of capital she hopes to sell more, attract more customers, and improve her earnings. Her next goal is to make repairs to her shop to make it more secure.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise so that she can restock her business with new products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been farming for the last 10 years in the town of Oloitoktok. She is 34 years old and is married to Christopher. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Grace hopes to build rental houses which will generate additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Manuel Eduardo

texts.es:
Manuel Eduardo tiene 27 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en Ventans Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.

Manuel se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros hace un año y medio.Las compras lo hace en Guayaquil y las vende en el Cantón Ventanas.El crédito lo solicita para comprar mercaderia e incrementar el negocio, aumentar y mejorar los ingresos económicos.

El sueño es adquirir más mercadería y poderlos distribuir a precios cómodos para alcance de todo bolsillo. Los desafios al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia que se da entre comerciantes.

En los momentos libres le gusta pasar con la familia y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Manuel Eduardo is 27 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives with his wife and child in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

The 1º de Mayo community bank is located in 1º de Mayo community, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  The members of this community bank work in commerce.

Manuel has been selling men's and women's clothing for one and a half years.  He makes his purchases in Guayaquil and makes his sales in Ventanas canton.  He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise, increase his business, and increase and improve his income.

Manuel's dream is to acquire more merchandise and sell it at affordable prices that are within the reach of every purse.  The challenge he faces every day comes from the competition between sellers.

In his free time, Manuel enjoys going out for walks with his family and watching television.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a focused business woman, age 49. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. 

For the last year, she has been managing a salon to earn a living. She also sells herbal hair chemicals to earn extra income. 

In the next five years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a hair drier.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en: Mr. Jargal is 48 years old, married, and a father of three children. He lives in Dornod, a province of Mongolia, with his wife and two children. He works as a welder at local thermal power station. He has been doing this job for five years, and he managed to buy his own land and a house. His wife is on the dole.  He is a very diligent father and husband. He works hard to support his wife and two daughters. His elder son lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He just got married and started to build his own house. However, because of a lack of money he couldn’t finish the house before winter. Jargal is requesting a loan to help his son to purchase the building materials to finish building the house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana, a 41-year-old married mother of three children, works hard to provide for her family. The operator of a sari-sari store in the Philippines for nine years, she also earns an income from selling coconut wine and eggs.

Feliciana has borrowed and repaid 14 previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a new one for PHP 15,000 to buy more store goods to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more store stocks to sell.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula es tejedora de mantas y guantes de lana e hilo y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital para comprar lana de diversas texturas y colores y continuar con su pequeño negocio. Vive en casa de su hija la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Villa Progreso de la Ciudad de El Alto. Paula se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y ahora trata de mejorar su negocio para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Paula weaves blankets and gloves from wool and yarn, with the assistance of her daughter.  The loan she is requesting is for increasing her capital to purchase wool in different textures and colors, and to continue with her small business.

She lives in her daughter's home, which is located in the Villa Progreso area of the city of El Alto.  

Paula is very satisfied with the loans that are being offered to her, as she will be able to improve her family's quality of life, and try to improve her business by generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase wool in different textures and colors, so as to continue her business weaving blankets and gloves.

loans.name: Rosa Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Verónica y su esposo tienen ya más de tres años con su negocio de renta de equipo de cómputo. 
Solicitan un préstamo para compra de inmuebles que son mesas y sillas para colocar las computadoras y así sus clientes estén más como y satisfechos al estar haciendo tareas escolares en su negocio. 
Son personas trabajadoras que desean tener un buen patrimonio para cuando lleguen sus hijos darles lo mejor y una vida con seguridad. 
Con la inversión tendrán mejor instalaciones ya que con las que cuentan no son apropiados para el negocio. Por lo cual tendrán más clientes y así mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Verónica and her husband have managed a business renting out computer equipment for more than three years. She is requesting a loan to buy furniture, such as tables and chairs, on which they can place the computers so that their customers can do their schoolwork while they are at their establishment. This will keep them happy.

Rosa and her husband are hardworking people who want to leave a good inheritance for their children so that they can have a better and more secure life. With this investment, they hope to provide better facilities because the existing ones are inadequate for their business. They want to have more customers and be able to make them more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her computer facility.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio Antonio   tiene 28 años de edad, su actividad económica es la  venta de productos varios, tiene un hijo a su cargo que está recién nacido él junto a su esposa ha salido a delante con mucho esfuerzo. El objetivo que tiene Mauricio con el préstamos es para comprar y abastecerse de productos como plata, cosmético, ropa, zapatos y poder así brindar a los clientes variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Mauricio Antonio is 28 and his principal economic activity is selling various goods. He has a newborn son and he and his wife have gotten ahead through a great deal of hard work. 

Mauricio’s goal is to use the loan to buy supplies such as silverware, cosmetics, clothing and shoes and to provide his customers with a variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as silverware, cosmetics, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 38-year-old a married woman with no children. 

She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Ayen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Diana Janeth

texts.es: La señora Diana es propietaria de una papelería y venta de helados en un local adecuado en la sala de su casa, este negocio lo heredo de su padre quien hace tres años se lo cedió para que ella trabajara. Desde entonces viene trabajando arduamente para generar los ingresos para su familia y el sostenimiento de su bebe de 18 meses de nacido. La señora Diana requiere de la compra de surtido en productos de papelería puesto que esta por iniciar la temporada escolar. El sueño de la señora Diana es ver crecer a su hijo y tener un gran almacén de variedades.
texts.en:
Diana has a paper goods store and also sells frozen treats from a space set up in her home.  She inherited this business from her father who passed it on to her three years ago so she could work.  Since then she’s been working arduously to earn the income that her family needs and to support her 18 month old baby.

Diana needs to buy an assortment of paper products so she can begin the school year.  Her dream is to watch her son grow and to have a large variety store.
.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y emprendedora. Esta casada con Asunción quien es jubilado. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Isabel es la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros  y niños, de diversas marcas y modelos que están a la moda. Mercadería que trae a pedido de otras ciudades. Esta actividad lo realiza de modo ambulante y reparto a domicilio, ya lleva como 4 años en éste negocio, la cual lo realiza sola pero de manera muy alegre. Paralelo también realiza la otra actividad que es el transporte, esta actividad viene realizando hace ocho meses. Lo que le gusta de ésta actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico con el cual puede tener un sustento para la economía de su hogar. Se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones. Tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando y buscar un negocio rentable, por eso tiene planes de comprar un vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros de mayor capacidad como una combi. Este sería el 03 préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad que le brindarán, de contar con un capital. Por tanto se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará más ropa de niños y damas.
texts.en: Isabel is 59 years old, she is a very cheerful, dynamic and resourceful woman. She is married with Asunción who is on retirement, and they live together in their own house. Isabel’s activity is selling women, men and children’s clothes of different brands and fashions. She buys her clothes in other towns. She is a street vendor and she also delivers to her customers’ houses, she has been engaged in this activity for 4 years and she works alone buy in a very cheerful way. She also engages in another activity: she has been offering transportation services for eight months. What she likes the most about this activity is that it gives her an income she can use to provide for the economy of her family, and she feels happy because she has been very satisfied with her activities. She wants to keep on working and running a profitable activity, and for this reason she plans on buying a bigger passengers vehicle such as a combi (a 12-passenger vehicle). This will be her third loan with MFP: she is very thankful for the opportunity to count on working capital that she has been offered. For this reason she commits to being punctual in her repayments. The 2000 PEN requested will be used to buy more women and children’s clothes.

loans.use: To buy women and children's clothes.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 45 years old.  She is married to Joseph and they have three children.  She has been operating a cereals retail stall for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of 6,800 KES.

She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 30,000 KES.  With it, Winfred intends to purchase additional stock of maize, beans and green grams, or mung beans. With the anticipated profit generated from the loan, she will purchase additional cereals to add to her inventory. 

She hopes and dreams to grow her business into a cereal wholesale store.

loans.use: to purchase cereals like maize, beans and green grams (mung beans).

loans.name: Mohchehra

texts.ru: Мохчехра образованная женщина в возрасте 40 лет. Она замужняя женщина и имеет двух замечательных детей. По профессии она учительница и у нее двадцатилетний опыт работы. Мохчехра работает в школе и преподает урок по математики. Её заработная плата очень мало. Её муж мастер по строительным работам. Всё что они вместе зарабатывают уходить на проживание и не как не могут накопить на будущее.  У них  скоро начнется мероприятия и им необходимо денежные средства. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за получение кредита.  Она заранее благодарит Арванд за доверие и поддержку!!!
texts.en: Mohchehra is an educated woman who is 40 years old.  She's married and has two wonderful children.  She's a teacher by trade, and has more than twenty years' experience working as one.  Mohchehra works in a school and teaches math lessons.  Her salary is very low.  Her husband is a tradesman who works in construction.  Everything they earn altogether goes to pay for living expenses, and they're unable to save money for the future.  They have some events coming up, and they urgently need money; as such, she's turned to Arvand for a loan, and thanks them in advance for their trust and support.

loans.use: to buy dowry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Gbogossi

texts.en:
Gbogossi A. is a specialist in producing and selling palm oil. She was born in 1959 and lives in an extended family. Besides her five children that she supports, there are several people under her care and responsibility. So she feels she needs financial support in the amount of $650 to acquire sacks of palm nuts and firewood. This will revitalize a business that she has been running for 20 years. She has been successful due to her long experience in her field of endeavor. The loan will allow her to be better organized and to meet strong customer demand by augmenting her production of palm oil, as well as augmenting her revenues. She can then help maintain herself in her community, avoid loan sharks, and provide for her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Spécialiste dans la production et la commercialisation d’huile de palme, Madame A. Gbogossi est née en 1959 et vit avec une famille élargie. En dehors de ses cinq (05) enfants qu’elle supporte, nombreuses sont les personnes qui constituent pour elle une charge. Ainsi, elle ressent la nécessité d’avoir un appui financier de $650 pour acheter des sacs de noix de palmes et des bois de chauffe pouvant la relancer dans son activité qu’elle mène depuis 20 ans. Les expériences qu’elle a eu à faire déjà dans ce domaine ont été fructueuses. Ce crédit lui permettra de mieux s’organiser et de répondre à la forte demande en augmentant sa production d’huile et en augmentant ses revenus pouvant l’aider à s’affirmer dans sa communauté, à éviter les usuriers et à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts and firewood

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lusita is 59 years old, and she is a single mother of eight! All of her children have since moved out of the house, but they take with them the many lessons that their mother Lusita taught them. When she left her parents' house many years ago, Lusita dedicated herself to selling goods near the major streets in Guayaquil. In the past she also worked in a restaurant for the Ecuadorian Navy, but when they closed their doors, she moved her business to her home. It hasn’t been easy for Ms. C.. Her husband left her to raise all eight children, so she had to find part time work outside the home to bring in enough income for the family.

Lusita is requesting her second loan with the Kiva and Mifex program. She wants to continue investing in her store and buying more and better inventory. Her first loan was a success as she was able to increase profits and make some small improvements to her home.

loans.use: Continue investing in inventory for her store

loans.name: Sear

texts.en:
Mr. Sear has been married since 1984 and has 2 sons and a daughter. He has been in the business of driving a remork (a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) for more than 10 years. He drives workers from the village to the garment factory site. His wife makes cloths at home for sale in the local market. Neither Sear not his wife have  finished primary school. They are working very hard in order to support their children's education. Also one of their children is currently working at the garment factory. The other 2 children are studying.  
Mr. Sear needs to borrow US$500 from MAXIMA to purchase a new carriage for his motor taxi. With his business, he can generate sufficient income to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motor taxi carriage

loans.name: Abie

texts.en: Mrs. Abie O. is the union secretary of Nosakhare in the Oka branch. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She is a fashion designer and sells fabrics in her shop. She has been in this business since 1997, and she is eager to get the loan of $800 for purchase of clothes and tailoring material for business growth. She lives in Benin City, in Edo State in Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine & fabrics

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo E., age 48, is a widow who works selling vegetables and grocery products from her home, earning up to $25 per day in revenue. She has two children: one who is a vendor at the market and one who is employed in a private company and earns $50 per month. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to expand her inventory by adding a greater variety of products to meet her growing customer demand. She predicts that this will increase her revenue, leading to a higher income to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of grocery products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 43 year-old Lucy A.. She is married with 5 children, aged 7,14,17,20, and 25. In 2001 Lucy established a clothing business. Lucy has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Juhairiyah

texts.id:
Juhairiyah previously runs a business selling sweet salad. She changed to the recyling business since 2000. This activity comprises from the phase of seeking used products; sort used products acquired; and the final phase to drop the used products with collection centers. Medium of transportation used are push cart and sacks. In a week, she generates earnings of Rp 400.000,00 (USD43). Loan she received will be used to increase funding – to purchase used products that she cannot find from rubbish dumps or by the roadside. However, she gets from homes and stores. Juhariyah’s husband is also in the similar field of business with earnings of Rp 250.000, (USD27)/week. Although they do not have dependent children, however they are planning for their future.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Juhairiyah pada mulanya menekuni usaha jualan Rujak Manis. Dia beralih usaha menjadi pemulung sejak tahun 2000. Kegiatan usaha ini terdiri dari tahap mencari barang – barang bekas; Menyeleksi barang – barang bekas yang diperoleh; Dan tahap yang terakhir menyetorkan barang – barang bekas tersebut ke Pengepul. Sarana yang digunakan berupa gerobak dorong dan karung. Dalam seminggu ia memperoleh keuntungan mencapai Rp 400.000,00. Pinjaman yang ia peroleh akan ia gunakan untuk menambah modal usaha - untuk membeli barang – barang bekas yang tidak ia dapatkan di tempat sampah ataupun di jalanan. Namun, ia dapatkan dari rumah – rumah penduduk atau toko – toko. Suami Juhariyah juga bergerak di bidang usaha yang sama dengan penghasilan Rp 250.000,00/minggu. Walaupun mereka tidak memiliki tanggungan anak , namun mereka harus tetap memikirkan masa depan mereka berdua.

loans.use: Purchase used products which cannot find in rubbish dumps or by the roadside (Membeli barang – barang bekas yang tidak ia dapatkan di tempat sampah ataupun di jalanan)

loans.name: Kisenyi A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Daphine I.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing materials. Daphine is 39 years old and is divorced. She has 1 child aged 10 who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase materials for school uniform outfits.

Daphine is joined in her small group by Joyce Z., Hanifah N., Rukiya N., and Aisha N.. Joyce Z. has a business running a retail shop and wants to add capital stock. Hanifah N. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to boost business. Rukiya N. operates a business selling used shoes and wants to increase inventory. Aisha N. is currently in the business of selling second hand shoes and is requesting a loan to add capital stock.

loans.use: To add to tailoring business and expand it

loans.name: Badr

texts.en: Badr is 42 years old and works and lives with her family in the Bekaa Valley. She makes a living selling clothes. This is the first time Badr has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. She will use the funds to buy additionA. merchandise to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Every day in the market located in the “16 de Julio” community and in the neighboring kiosks, a variety of breakfasts, delicious lunches and other refreshments are offered by the majority of the members of the “Sol Naciente” Association. Preparation of the food obligates this group to remain in their stands for the entire day. That means working next to their small children, because they don’t make enough money to leave them in daycare centers, an unfortunate situation that leaves the children exposed to many dangers.

The “Sol Naciente” Association has worked with the Pro-Mujer organization for three years and, with the help of their loan advisor, has proven to be very well organized. They now need additional funds to be able to inject more capital into their businesses and thereby increase their income which will benefit their families.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Todos los días en el mercado de la zona 16 de julio y kioscos aledaños al lugar, se ofrece variados desayunos, deliciosos almuerzos y otras meriendas. Actividad que se dedica la mayor parte de la asociación “Sol Naciente” La elaboración de estos alimentos obliga a este grupo a permanecer en sus puestos de venta por todo el día teniendo así que trabajar junto a sus pequeños hijos, ya que no cuentan con el dinero suficiente para poder dejarlos en guarderías, caso muy lamentable ya que los niños se ven expuestos a muchos peligros. La asociación Sol Naciente ya trabaja con la familia de Pro-Mujer hace mas de tres años con la ayuda de su asesor de creditos demuestran ser un grupo muy bien organizado. Ellas ahora precisan mayores créditos para poder inyectar capital a sus negocios de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos para el bien de sus familias.

loans.use: Additional funds will be invested in their food businesses

loans.name: Chu

texts.en: Chu S. is 44 years old and a widow. She no longer works but has devoted herself wholly to managing her household and caring for her four children who live outside the family home. Her children provide the family income by working at garment factories throughout the area. Together, the three at factories provide their mother with 120 US$ per month. One of her other children is a construction worker and earns 60 US$ per month. She wants to take out a loan to give her children a bike to use to commute to work. Their family is fortunate in that they were able to even find work in their home province. Commonly families must send their daughters all the way to Phnom Penh to live in concrete block houses working 12 hour shifts at the factories there. With the motorbike they will be able to continue to come home each night.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Tata Peter

texts.en:
Born in 1940, Tata Peter is married and has four children. With the death of his children, he has been facing numerous emotional and financial difficulties.

Vegetable farming is a very profitable business in Tata Peter’s community, especially when done on a large scale. However, he has found it difficult to raise business capital. He tried borrowing money from other financial institutions but had problems repaying the loan due to high interest rates. Motivated by his ambitions as a gardener, Tata Peter joined GHAPE to access loans and benefit from their numerous trainings on loan and money management.

Given a loan, he plans to buy more seeds, plant palm trees (for harvesting palm nuts), and buy piglets. He will use the profits to provide for himself and his family. He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first repayment will be four months from the date of dispersment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, seeds, and palm tree seedlings

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 25 years old. She is married, and has two children, aged 4 and 3. Fatima began to vend food in 2006. She works everyday from 7 AM to 12 PM, earning a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Fatima has successfully completed one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Fatima would like to request another loan to purchase more food items, such as juice and eggs, to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana Y. is 48 years old and has 6 children. She lives in Igbo-elerin, Lagos, Nigeria. 

Christiana is a hardworking woman. She sells provisions, such as bathing soap, detergent, and toothpaste. She also sells drinks and food. 

She needs a loan for $600 to buy drinks and food. She says "thank you!"

loans.use: To buy more drinks and food to sell

loans.name: Asha's Mungu Muweza Group

texts.en:
Asha is 24 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 3 years old. She also takes care of one other person aged 26 years old. She has been a clothes and chicken seller since 2004. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 175 from her sales.

Asha is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and chickens for her businesses. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatma, MwanaK. M., Mgeni and MwanaK. M..

loans.use: To buy more clothes and chickens for her businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more toilet products and other goods to sell

loans.name: Khalida Parveen Zulfiqar Group

texts.en:
Khalida parveen baji is a wife of Mr. Z. and lives in Pakpattan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room, brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. She is the mother of eight children: four sons and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Khalida baji’s husband works in a rice mill. Khalida baji herself has a sewing business. She has been sewing clothes for the past five years, and charges $2 per suit. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she will be able to sew more clothes and earn more profit. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zahran baji requests a loan to buy fruits to resell. Khursheed baji requests a loan to buy vehicles wheels to resell. Ameena baji requests a loan to buy wood to resell. Khadija baji requests a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine improve her seamstress business

loans.name: Mayamka Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. and Adama S. K. named their group Mayamka.  They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni, and this is not their first time receiving a Kiva loan through SMT.  Previous loans have been a great help to the members of this group. It enabled them to expand their businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve the living conditions of the members of the group.  Having repaid their last loan successfully, they have requested a new loan for the amount of Le 1,500,000.

Mariatu is the leader of the group and fifty years of age. She was born in Magbass, a few miles away from Magburaka in the Tonkolili District in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a diamond digger, and they have three children. One of their children is now running a business, one is in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Mariatu sells groundnuts and sometimes items such as onions, rice, and palm oil depending on market demand. She has been in business for more than thirty years now.

With this new loan, Mariatu will expand her business by buying more bags of groundnuts.  She will be able to get at least eight bags of groundnuts depending on the price determined by the market.  She travels to Bamoi (a make-shift business center) to buy the groundnuts.  In Bamoi, a bag of groundnuts costs something between Le 80,000 and 110,000.  She pays a fare of Le 15,000 or 20,000 for transport to and from Bamoi and another Le 2,000 as a delivery charge for each bag of groundnuts she brings back with her.

Every time she receives a loan from SMT, Mariatu experiences growth in her business. This time again, she is expecting an increase in profit, which will improve her standard of living. She will be able to assist her children in school, feed them and give them medical attention whenever they are sick.

loans.use: Bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa e hijo en la calle Illampu de la zona Rosario de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como chofer realizando viajes a Oruro en transporte libre; con estos ingresos él mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para instalar un sitio de servicio de Internet en la casa de sus suegros lugar donde su esposa podrá atender y de esta  manera aumentar sus ingresos.

No tiene Historial por que es cliente nuevo pero por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Robert lives in his parents' house with his wife and son on Illampu street in the Rosario zone in the city of La Paz. He works as a taxi driver making trips to Oruro; he supports his family with the income. He seeks credit to install a site for Internet service in the house of his in-laws that his wife could attend to and increase their income. He does not have history of loans because he is a new client but his social character qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install internet service for the public

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Аминова Саехат живет сосвоей семьей в Шахринау. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Возраст 27 лет. Зарабатывает деньги дома , принимая заказы  для пошива национальной женской одежды.  Занимается бизнесом уже шесть лет. Обратилась за кредитом для того, чтобы купить вышивальную машинку. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент предлагаемых услуг и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sayohat A. lives with her family in Shakhrinaw. She is 27, married, and has 3 children. Sayohat works at home making national clothing for women. She has been in business for 6 years. Sayohat will use this loan to purchase a sewing machine. Having the new machine will help Sayohat to widen the range of her services and attract new clients. Sayohat will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia tiene 37 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación del puente 1 c abajo 1 ½ c al norte en la ciudad de Managua, con dos hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante, ella tiene una pulpería desde hace cinco años, que inicio cuando se caso con su esposo los dos trabajaban en una zona franca y con la liquidación de ambos lograron este pequeño comienzo de una pulpería. Con esta solicitud va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para hacer porche y poder gozar de los beneficios y logro de sus trabajos, a si también da las gracias  Afodenic por el apoyo con los créditos que ha otorgado. Sus planes para el negocio es acondicionar bien la venta para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia, 37, lives with her husband and their two young children (ages 2 and 6) in Managua. He husband work in sales, and she has been running a small convenience store out of her home for the last 5 years. She started her business after she and her husband were laid off. Silvia is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to make a small porch outside the store and provide a better service to her customers. Silvia is very thankful to Kiva partner Afodenic for the support she has received in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz es una jovencita soltera de 19 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, a los que quiere mucho, ella desea apoyar en los gastos familiares, y darles una vejez digna. Es una hija muy amorosa, se preocupa mucho por el bienestar de sus padres, la escasez de dinero que hay en su hogar, le impidió terminar sus estudios superiores, por lo cual tuvo que encontrar la forma de llevar dinero a su casa, actualmente se dedica a la venta de helados, los cuales son muy solicitados por sus clientes, ya que los prepara muy deliciosos. A Luz le gusta mucho vender sus helados en los días soleados, ya que siente que la gente se refresca gracias a ella, anhela tener una heladería muy grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y vender con mayor comodidad. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y lo que menos le gusta es el frió que siente al hacer los helados, pero igual Luz persiste en su afán de alcanzar sus metas y no le importa los sacrificios que tenga que hacer. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal donde es muy querida, y como todavía es muy joven, siempre es aconsejada por el resto de las socias. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en comprar una máquina para almacenar sus helados, lo cual le costará alrededor de tres mil nuevos soles, ella está dispuesta a poner el resto de dinero de sus ahorros, con tal de mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz, 19, is a single young woman who lives with her parents who she loves very much. She would like to help with the family's expenses and give her parents a dignified retirement. She's a loving daughter, concerned about the well-being of her parents. The lack of money in the household prevented her from finishing her university studies. She had to find another way to bring money into the household so she started a business selling ice cream, something much in demand from her customers because the ice cream that she makes is delicious. Luz especially likes selling ice cream to her customers on sunny days because she believes they're reinvigorated thanks to her. She dreams of having a large ice cream shop where she would be better able to tend to her customers. She's operated the business for 3 years. The thing she likes least about the business is feeling cold when she makes the ice cream but, even so, she continues to strive toward her goals without caring about the sacrifices that she might have to make. This is her second MFP loan and she strongly feels an obligation to repay the loan on time because she doesn't want to cause problems at her communty bank, where she is much loved, and, because of her youth, much advised by the other members. The loan will be used to buy a machine for storing ice cream, something that will cost around three thousand new soles. She will use her savings to pay for the balance.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a device for storing ice cream.

loans.name: Djekafo (Parlons La Même Voix) Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de femmes du   village de Téné (région de Ségou) qui se sont regroupé pour la pratique de la même activité. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans, sont toutes mariées et sont mères d’au moins 4  enfants. Elles mènent  les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments alimentaires (oignon, tomate, huile, cube magie et épice etc.) Les membres du groupe Djekafo ont intégré le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année  pour mettre fin aux ruptures de stock.
 Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 75 000 FCFA pour le deuxième et le premier prêt a été correctement remboursé. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des  condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes, en gros auprès des producteurs et des commerçants grossistes. Les condiments sont vendus, sur des tables, au bord du goudron  l’artère principale autour duquel les activités économiques sont menées.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 80 000 FCFA. de bénéfice chacune au cours du cycle. 
En plus du remboursement des prêts, une partie de leur bénéfice sera utilisé pour  faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Dans les jours à venir elles comptent avoir des prêts élevés pour augmenter la quantité de marchandises et diversifier avec le commerce de fruits.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of women of the village of Téné (Ségou region) who gathered together to do the same work. The women average 25 years of age, are all married, and are the mothers of at least four children. Their businesses involve buying and selling condiments (onions, tomatoes, oil, Maggi bouillon cubes, spices, etc.) The group members joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago in order to stop running short of inventory. Loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 75,000 francs for the second. And the first loan has been correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy condiments of all sorts, in bulk from producers and wholesale merchants. The condiments are sold from tables along the main asphalt road, where commerce conducted.

With this new loan, the group members each plan to realize an average profit of 80,000 francs in the course of the cycle. In addition to making loan payments, a portion of their profits will be used to address typical family expenses. In the days to come, they plan to obtain larger loans, so as to increase the quantity of merchandise and to diversify with commerce in fruits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Paea

texts.en:
Paea L., 62, is married and the mother of eight children. She is starting a pancake business. She will be selling to the village people and the public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 130 Tala (about $42).

SPBD loans are Paea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan. She plans to use her loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, baking soda, etc., in order to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of flour, sugar, baking soda, etc.

loans.name: Sunatjon

texts.ru: Сунатжон раньше работал в местном заводе строительных материалов. Одновременно со своей работой открыл маленькую торговую точку и стал продавать там строительные материалы. Постепенно полностью переключился на занятие предпринимательством и сейчас успешно им занимается. В МикроИнвест кредитуется уже 2 года. Недавно он подал заявку на получение нового займа и собирается приобрести оптовую партию цемента и алебастра.
texts.en:
Sunatjon used to work at a local construction material plant. At that time, along with work, he opened a small retail store and started selling construction materials there. Gradually, he focused on his business full-time and is now successful at it. Sunatjon has been collaborating with MicroInvest for 2 years. He recently requested a new loan and plans to purchase additional inventory of cement and alabaster wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of alabaster and cement

loans.name: Georgina Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Georgina del Socorro M. M. es propietaria de una pulpería ubicada en la Comarca Las Flores, del departamento de Masaya, es conocida en su comunidad por su establecimiento, es madre de un hijo joven que le ayuda en la pulpería, su esposo es agricultor en tierras propias. Decidió instalar su negocio hace varios años para tener ingresos propios y comprarse lo que le gusta, sus sueños es mejorar su negocio hasta que sea una mediana empresa y poder brindar estudios universitarios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Georgina del Socorro M. M. is the owner of a small grocery store located in the La Flores district, Masaya department. She is known in her community for her establishment, she is the mother of a young son who helps in the shop, her husband is a farmer of their own land. She decided to establish her business several years ago in order to have her own income and to be able to buy what she would like. Her dream is to improve the business until it is a medium-sized enterprise and to be able to provide a college education to her child.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various products for her grocery store

loans.name: Leongina

texts.en: Mrs. Leongina is from the city Quiindy and is 50 years old.  She is married to Mr. Juan. He has helped her raise her children, who are now all older.
