Leongina has always worked selling milk and raising different types of animals that she later sells in the area.  She has more than thirty years of experience in this industry.  Today she has a well-formed farm that is named Granja E.. She is applying for a loan to buy more land for her animals to graze.

loans.use: To purchase more land for grazing

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La socia Lilian, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, entre las labores del hogar, ella comparte las de sus esposo, quien tiene una carpintería y requiere el préstamo para así poder invertir en la compra de herramientas y madera para hacer sus pendientes. Motivo por el cual ella solicita el préstamo.

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Doña Lilian is a partner of the community bank "SIEMPRE UNIDOS, she is from the neighborhood of Santiago of the town of Cusco.

The partner is 39 years old, married, with 2 children, she does the chores as well as helping her husband at his carpenter's workshop and she requests the loan in order to invest in the purchase of tools and wood for unfinished work. The partner is very grateful and appreciative of the loan and the opportunity through this means and is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools and wood.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine C. is from the village of Lantay Valencia Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Josephine is widowed and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She sells a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and to finance the family's basic needs. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria A. (far left) is extremely excited to receive her first loan from Kiva partner Esperanza International. For three years, she has maD. delicious frozen fruit juices which many in her neighborhood pick up for breakfast. Her flavors incluD. cantaloupe, passion fruit, cherry and pineapple. Along with these treats, Maria makes fresh bread to augment her sales.

Maria lives with her husband and one of her three children who is currently working at a local resort. While her son is now in his late 20s, he wants to return to school sometime soon. With only nine months of the Dominican equivalent of high school left, it is very possible that he can complete his high school, and then consider moving on to a more advanced degree.

In the future, Maria also hopes to apply any extra income to improving her home and to expanding the selection of goods she can afford to make and sell. She would love to begin selling more treats, such as cookies and other baked goods which would complement her frozen juice. She hopes, if her business takes off, to make her home out of cement blocks, rather than just wood. A home maD. of these blocks is extremely important to many Dominicans, as it withstands rain and does not rot away.

Esperanza International encourage you to give to Maria and the others in her group. All are committed to stewarding their loan wisely and have dreams and wishes to improve their living situation and that of their families.

Muchas gracias!

loans.use: To purchase juice making and baking materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Vilma Nery

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 01 hijo, ella  estudio educación superior técnica completa, vive en el Barrio Santa Rosa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra lanas de diferentes colores. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra la compra de abarrotes, gaseosas, golosinas, galletas, etc. Para su tienda.

Su deseo es tener una tienda de venta de lencería en Puno o Arequipa.
A ella le gusta la  puntualidad y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma is a partner in the Community Bank New Future which is located in the district of Puno, department of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has one son. She completed post-secondary technical studies. She now lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years. Her initial loan was 300 new soles, money that she invested in her business buying different colored wools.

Now she is applying for a loan of 2200 new soles for the purchase of candy, soda, snacks, cookies, etc. for her shop.

Her wish is to have a shop that sells linens in Puno or Arequipa.

She likes being on time and attending the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of candy, soda, snacks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Laura Clemencia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras está formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, con visión hacia un futuro mejor, adoptando de la vida las mejores oportunidades para salir adelante,  las socias  viven en diferentes partes del centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ésta es una ciudad muy hermosa y milenaria teniendo muchos lugares turísticos para visitar y enamorarse de la belleza que esta ciudad encierra.


La señora Laura  Clemencia C. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 70 años de edad, es casada y procreó  ocho hijos, todos se encuentran casados viven independientes con sus respectivas familias, su esposo es mecánico pero por su edad solo trabaja horas en su antiguo taller; aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que tienen que arrendar.

Laura tiene un negocio de venta ropa americana de segunda mano, lleva 25 años en esta actividad, los sábados y domingos recorre todas las ferias de la ciudad para realizar sus ventas.

Laura  es una señora muy tierna y dulce, se lleva bien con todas las socias, trabaja con la fundación hace 5 ciclos y le han ayudado para surtir su negocio, con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería surtida para todos los gustos y edades

Su sueño es de seguir trabajando hasta que Dios le permita.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank 'Mujeres Luchadoras' is formed by a group of entrepreneur women that aim for a better future, and go after the best opportunities to get ahead in life. The members live in different parts of Cuenca, a beautiful and historical city with several touristic attractions. Mrs. Laura Clemencia C. lives in downtown Cuenca, is 70 years old, married and has raised 8 children, all now independent and with their own families. Her husband is a mechanic, but because of his advanced age he only works a few hours a week in his old workshop; they have to pay rent as they still don't own a house. Laura sells second hand clothing from the US, and she's been in this business for the past 25 years. On Saturdays and Sundays she goes around all street fairs in the city to sell her clothes. Laura is a very sweet and tender person and she gets along with all the other members of the foundation, where she's been part of for the past 5 years, and they have helped her improve her business. With the loan she's asking from the Espoir Foundation, she is planning on buying more merchandise for all ages and tastes. She dreams on keep working for as long as God allows her to.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to resell in local markets

loans.name: Zerina

texts.en:
Zerina C. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at her home and is requesting a loan to purchase baking flour and crates of beer to sell.  Zerina is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase baking flour and crates of beer to sell at home

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.en:
K. Hurmatoy is a happy mother of three children. She is 29 years old and married. Hurmatoy is a teacher. Her salary is very small and that’s why she has been running her own grocery business. For six years she has been selling foodstuffs such as sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee, and many others in her grocery store.

Hurmatoy’s wish is to expand her business, offering various types of foodstuffs to customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are all the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts.

With this opportunity and with the immense love Hurmatoy feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 6800 Somoni in order to increase the range of her goods. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Hurmatoy.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of foodstuffs to increase the range of  goods she offers

loans.name: Vilma Leonor

texts.es:
la sra. Vilma Leonor A. R. tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad el cual es muy buena ya que las tortillas es un alimento que acompaña a todas las comidas (desayuno, almuerzo y cena).
las tortillas de Vilma son muy buenas y sabrosas, las vende en mercaditos, pulperias y tambien las reparte en diferentes colonias y caserios cercanos a su casa de habitacion.
ahorita necesita el credito para poder comprar mas harina de maiz, leña, cal, agua y fosforos, para tener una mayor produccion de tortillas, su negocio ha crecido y ahora vende mas diariamente y no esta produciendo lo necesario para las ventas diarias,
Vilma se levanta todos los dias a las 4 de la mañana para preparar la masa y luego salir a venderlas durante todo el dia.
necesita el credito para salir adelante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma Leonor A. R., 38, makes and sells tortillas. She has done this for several years and it is a profitable business because tortillas are consumed with every meal (breakfast, lunch and dinner). Vilma's tortillas are good and delicious. She sells them in little markets, small grocery stores and also distributes them among various neighborhoods and homesteads near her home. She needs financing to buy more wheat flour, firewood, lime powder, water and matches to increase her tortilla production. Her business has been growing and her daily sales have increased and she is unable to produce enough to meet her daily demand. Vilma gets up every morning at 4am to prepare the dough and then spends the rest of the day out selling. She needs financing to get ahead with her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, firewood, lime powder, water and matches.

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal CAMINANDO JUNTOS se encuentra ubicada en L. zona alta D. Huaycán, departamento D. Lima, actualmente está conformado por diez socios, quienes se desempeñan en diferentes actividades como producción, comercio y servicio, trabajan con EDAPROSPO- prosperidad desD. hace cuatro meses y esta representada por:
Sabina: entusiasta y emprendedora D. 46 años, conviviente con cuatro hijos, actualmente sigue asumiendo el cargo D. presidenta D. L. alcancía.
Sabina se dedica a L. venta D. menús para  fábricas textiles las cuales están ubicadas a 40 minutos D. su domicilio, gracias al perseverante esfuerzo que pone día a día en su labor ha logrado obtener bienes para su hogar y apoyar a su cónyuge con los estudios D. sus hijos. Con el reciente préstamo Sabina comprara panetones para venderlos en esta campaña naviD.ña.
Ruth Enriqueta: luchadora y emprendedora D. 36 años D. edad con tres hijos D. 7, 10 y 16 años,  actualmente continua en el cargo D. secretaria, anteriormente se dedicaba a L. venta D. habas y maní, pero con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado establecer una bodega en su domicilio,  también realiza manualidades como confección D. polos y bordados. Con el préstamo recibido Ruth lo utilizara en L. ampliación D. su hogar y surtir  su pequeña bodega.
Maylen Evelyn: quien sigue asumiendo  el cargo D. tesorera desD. hace cuatro meses, es una joven emprendedora, conviviente D. 24 años con un hijo D. 1 año por el cual lucha día a día. 
ElL. es una experta dibujante  realiza pancartas, dibujos para colegios y nidos, empezó en este pequeño negocio con L. ayuda D. su tía quien es profesora. El reciente préstamo lo invertirá en L. compra D. colores y demás materiales para seguir realizando sus dibujos y así ayudar a su familia y a su pequeño niño.
texts.en:
The "Caminando Juntos" [Walking Together] Communal Bank is located in the high zone of Huaycán, in the Department of Lima. It currently includes ten members who work in a range of fields, including production, traD. and services. They have worked with the Edaprospo Prosperity organization for the past four months, and they are represented by: Sabina M. Castañeda: an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial woman of 46 who lives with her partner and four children. She is currently taking on the position of president of the communal bank. Sabina works selling meals at textile factories which are located 40 minutes from her home. Thanks to the dedicated efforts she puts into her work day after day, she has been able to obtain goods for her home and help her partner with their children's educational expenses. With this loan, Sabina will purchase traditional cakes to sell during the Christmas season. Ruth Enriqueta: a determined and entrepreneurial woman, 36 years old, with three children aged 7, 10 and 16. She is currently continuing in her position as secretary. She previously worked selling beans and peanuts, but with the effort she has put into her work, she has been able to open a small shop in her home. She also creates handmaD. goods such as shirts and embroidered items. Ruth will use this loan to expand her home and to stock her small store. Maylen Evelyn: who continues to occupy the position of treasurer, as she has for the past four months. She is a young entrepreneur, 24 years old, who lives with her partner and her 1-year-old child, for whom she works hard each day. She is an expert at drawing and creates placards and drawings for schools and day care centers. She began this small business with the help of her aunt, who is a teacher. She will invest the funds from the current loan in purchasing art supplies to continue producing her drawings and thus helping her family and her small child.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto C. is from the village of Labinay Ozamiz City. He is 52 years old. Ernesto is married and has 3 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Ernesto plants and harvests bananas for sale. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ernesto joined GDMPC to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Ernesto is requesting his second loan, for 6000 PHP, which he will be use to invest in expanding the business.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in his banana business.

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi has been rearing bird, selling chickens and eggs for the past six years.  Her business is growing. She sells eggs to help support her family's expenses.  She is blessed with four children.  Titi hopes for a loan of NGN180000 to purchase more birds to rear and sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase birds to rear and sell.

loans.name: Kim San's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kim San K. is 39 years old. He is a village-bank president for a group loan consisting of 23 people located in Kandal Kraom village in the Kandal province. 

Mr. Kim San K. is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. On this farm, he now faces a problem because his field has infertile soil. He decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support it. Besides being a farmer, he is also a motorbike taxi driver who can make a little income to support his family. 

His wife, Mrs. Chan Thun, is a grocer in the local market. Mrs. Chan Thun is the mother of five childR., one of whom does housework while the other four are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA REBECA ES UNA PERSONA JOVEN, QUE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN EL MERCADO 10 DE ENERO QUE ESTA EN LA ZONA DE PAMPAHASI, ELLA ES MUY CONOCIDA EN EL MERCADO YA QUE PREPARA UN DELICIOSO ALMUERZO NEGOCIO DONDE LE VA MUY BIEN.

LA OTRA ACTIVIDAD DE LA SRA. REBECA VENDE CALZADOS Y CHINELAS EN LA FERIA SAN LUIS DE EL ALTO Y ELLA SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR CALZADOS PARA NIÑOS Y JOVENES YA QUE COMIENZA LA ÉPOCA DE CLASES, SU ESPOSO, EL SR. MIGUEL, ES CARPINTERO Y TIENE SU TALLER EN SENKATA. 

ELLOS VIVEN EN LA ZONA COSMOS 79 DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO Y TIENEN UN PEQUEÑO HIJO Y SU DESEO ES VER A SU HIJO PROFESIONAL.
 
ELLA Y SU ESPOSO SON PERSONAS MUY RESPONSABLES CON SU FAMILIA Y SU TRABAJO ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a young person who sells food in the market "10 de Enero," which is in the Pampahasi area. She is very well-known in the market since she prepares a delicious lunch, and her business is doing very well. She also has another business activity, selling shoes and slippers in the San Luis Market in El Alto. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy shoes for children, since school season is starting. Her husband, Miguel, is a carpenter and has a workshop in Senkata. They live in the Cosmos 79 neighborhood in the city of El Alto, and they have a small son. They hope to see their son become a professional. She and her husband are very responsible people, both with their family and with their work. They are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes for school season

loans.name: Luz Marie

texts.en: Luz Marie B. is from the village of Purok 6, Barangay Ayam, Gingoog City. She is 52 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Luz Marie owns and operates a specialized retail business selling green bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Luz Marie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Luz Marie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Mrs. Noun H., (pictured in the photograph),  is a 51 year old  widow with seven children: two sons and five daughters. One of them married and lives outside the family home, one is a construction worker, another one is a garment factory worker and the others attend school. They are living along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Noun has been a farmer since 1982. She grows rice on her farmland in the village. Noun doesn’t have capital to maintain her farm, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To use for farm supplies

loans.name: Lucy Wambui

texts.en:
Lucy Mambui M. is 38 years old and a married lady. She sells clothes in the Westlands market within Nairobi. This market is busy and receives customers regularly. She has been doing this as her primary business for three years.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her first loan with KADET. She has not borrowed from other financial institutions apart from KADET.

Lucy hopes that with this loan she will be able to add more clothes stock and grow her business substantially.

loans.use: She will use the entire amount to restock her business by buying more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothes for resale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Av. San Lorenzo se reúne en la ciudad de Calceta en la provincia de Manabí, la señora Francisca es una  ciudadana de esta bella ciudad, ella tiene descendencia de chino puesto que su abuelo era de ese país en una época que la una parte de la colonia china se radicó en esta provincia se enamoró de su abuela y se quedo a vivir en nuestro país.

La señora Francisca es madre de tres hijos, en viudo hace 11 años, esta atravesando por momentos de dolor hace 4 meses perdió a uno de sus hijos y eso la ha tenido bastante triste, pero así, aun así a seguido trabajando no puede dejar de hacerlo es la manera de sacar  adelante a la familia, a sus 53 años se dedica al comercio y lo hace a través de las ventas de sabanas, toldos, y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, lo hace de una manera informal, desde hace 13 años se dedica a este negocio en su ciudad de origen, semanalmente viaja a una ciudad de la misma provincia para hacer las compras de los pedidos que tiene que entregar, cada crédito que recibe de la Fundación lo invierte en el negocio, en el lugar que compra no le dejan a crédito pero para poder conservar a sus clientela tiene que darles facilidad de pago y cobra por semana, nuestra socia esta con ganas de seguir trabajando uno se sus sueños es mantener a su familia unida.
texts.en:
The Avenue San Lorenzo Communal Bank meets in the city of Calceta in the province or Manabí. Ms. Francisca is a citizen of this beautiful city. The is of Chinese heritage, her grandfather having come from that country during a time when part of the Chinese community settled in this province. He fell in love with Francisca's grandmother and stayed to live in our country. Francisca is a mother of three children. She has been a widow for 11 years. She is going through some painful times since four months ago she lost one of her children which has been very sad, but still she has continued working. She cannot stop working since it is the means she has to help her family get ahead. At 53 years of age she works in commerce, selling sheets, awnings, and clothing for women, men, and children. She works in an informal way. For 13 years she has worked in this business in her native city, traveling weekly to a city in the same province where she make purchases for the orders she has to deliver. Each loan she receives from the Foundation she invests in the business. Where she buys her merchandise they do not provide her with credit, but to maintain her clientele she must give them flexible means of paying, charging weekly. Our member has a desire to continue working since one of her dreams is to maintain her united family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets, awnings, and clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Víctor Sanjinez vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su hijo.
El señor Víctor hace contratos de entradas para un club de fútbol de esta ciudad con empresas de Imprenta, y por dicha actividad recibe comisión; también realiza tramites varios para personas particulares; estas dos actividades le generan ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un Baño en su vivienda para el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Victor Sanjinez lives in his own house in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area, on the west side of the city of La Paz, with his wife and their son. Victor makes contracts for tickets for a football club in this city with printing companies, and for this work, he receives a commission. He also performs various tasks for particular people. These two activities generate the income to support his family. The loan that he is requesting is to build a bathroom in his house so he can improve the quality of life for his family. This is the first occasion that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis completed qualified him favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao C., 57, is married with three children living at home in Takeo province. She grows rice and works as a musician, typically making US$2 each day. Her husband, Svay Heng, pictured here, makes musical instruments and raises pigs and typically makes about US$2 each day.

Sao C. would like a loan of US$1,200 to create a new investment. She plans to open a store selling beer and meat in the village and allow her children to operate it.

loans.use: To open a store selling beers and meat for her children to operate

loans.name: Queta

texts.es: Queta, de 53 años, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposo  David (54) y con 2 de sus 3 hijas, puesto que la mayor, labora en la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades. Desde hace 5 años  empezó con el negocio de venta de comida en su casa, para lograrlo separó un espacio de su sala y lo convirtió en comedor, donde atiende a diario  a sus exigentes clientes a partir del mediodía. Cada plato de comida lo vende a 5 soles y los días domingo a 7 soles, pues prepara sus comidas con los mejores ingredientes que encuentra, ya que siempre le gusta satisfacer a sus comensales. Asegura que le gusta mucho cocinar y ver como sus clientes disfrutan de sus alimentos, sin embargo, le disgusta comprar los insumos para cada preparación porque tiene que ser muy selecta, por eso realiza sus compras para toda la semana, excepto las verduras. Mientras Queta, administra su restaurante, su esposo labora de docente de educación superior, además le ayuda en su restaurante. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para mas adelante tiene planeado incrementar su negocio con otros productos de  dulcería.Es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasta de continuar trabajando en su banco comunal, donde ella, es presidenta de la junta directiva de su grupo.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en refaccionar la fachada de su casa, para hacer más atractivo y vistoso el ingreso a su negocio, también invertirá  el monto restante, en la compra de insumos que necesita para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Queta, age 53, lives in her own home with her husband David, age 54, and two of their three daughters; the eldest daughter is working in the city in search of better opportunities. Five years ago, Queta started an eatery business in her home. To achieve this, she separated a part of the living room and made it into a dining hall. This is where she serves food to her demanding clients every day starting at noon. She sells each dish for 5 sols during work days and for 7 sols during the weekend. Queta prepares her dishes with the very best ingredients she can find since she is always committed to the satisfaction of her guests; she really likes to cook and to see the enjoyment her customers get from her dishes. Queta is very selective when purchasing ingredients, and, because of this, she does not like to buy them each day, but instead buys enough to last the whole week, except for the vegetables. While Queta manages her restaurant, her husband works as a teacher; he also helps out with the restaurant. Being an entrepreneurial woman, Queta has future plans to expand her business with dessert products. This is Queta's eighth loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about continuing to work as a member of her communal bank, where she is the president of the management committee. She plans to use the loan to renovate the front side of her house in order to make the entrance to her restaurant look more appealing; the remaining amount will be used to purchase raw ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations, purchase of ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Hatun Finca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Hatún Finca inicia su primer ciclo con 17 socias, muchas D. ellas son vecinas.
Alejandrina es L. presidenta D. su Banco Comunal, Alejandrina es conviviente y tiene una niña D. 6 años que estudia en el primer grado D. primaria, lo que mas le gusto D. L. metodología D. Finca Perú son el incentivo a ahorrar.
Alejandrina viaja a las ferias 3 veces por semana en donD. venD. frutas variadas, productos que adquiere en el mercado D. abastos D. Ayacucho, y D. las ferias compra trigo, cebada entre otros cereales, que venD. luego en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. plátano, manzanas y mandarinas.
Alejandrina sueña con tener una bodega en su casa para dejar D. viajar y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
The community bank Hatún Finca are beginning their first loan cycle with 17 members, many of whom are neighbours. Alejandrina is the president of the community bank. She lives with her husband and has a 6 year old daughter who is studying first graD. at primary school. What Alejandrina likes most about the methodology of Finca Peru is its incentives to save money. Alejandrina travels to the markets three times a week where she sells various types of fruit, products that she purchases in the wholesale market of Ayacucho. At the markets she buys wheat, barley and other cereals which she later sells at the city markets in Ayacucho. Her loan will be used to buy bananas, apples and mandarins. Alejandrina dreams of setting up a stall in her house so that she can stop travelling, and she hopes that her daughter will grow up to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bananas, apples and mandarins

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 33-year-old married lady with three children. She sells food and operates a grocery shop. She has been in the business for five years with one employee. She has been an active member of a group in Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner. 

She previously took out a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) through the group. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to increase stock of beans, maize, vegetables and fruits. She hopes to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: To increase stock of beans, maize, vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. is a villager from Purak Bularan, Miputak. She is 49 years old and is married with two adult children. Emma owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Emma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Emma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley A. is a hard-working woman from the town of Talibon. She is 43 years old. Shirley is married. To make a living, Shirley owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over 6 years. 

Shirley joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley is requesting a  loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Shirley from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry S. is a married woman who lives in Tandayag, Amlan, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a dry goods business. Her husband, Ceclio S., 28 years old, works as a laborer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have a 9-year-old child. Cherry joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cherry has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living.

Cherry is borrowing 19,500 PHP for her 9th loan, which she intends to use to pay for more inventory of dry goods to resell so that she can continue to save up for her child's future education. Cherry S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor M. is 30 years old, married and the mother of one young child who is already enrolled in primary school. She used to work sewing clothes in the garment factory, but now she works farming crops to earn a living. Mrs. Sor M.'s husband works as a construction foreman in the village. This couple lives together with their parents and they hope to build a new house to live in. As they lack money, Mrs. Sor M. made the decision to take out a loan to add to her personal savings in order to start building a new small house.

loans.use: To start building a new small house.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren A. is 60 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children work as salespeople in private shops while his son works in a construction company. His wife is disabled and currently stays at home. 

Davaasuren operates a raw material trading business in the local community. He purchases a variety of plastic bags to sell at market price for a profit.  He started this business in 2000 and, since then, has slowly grown his business. Davaasuren has gained much experience and knowledge over the years. His earnings have enabled him to provide for the household's needs. He hopes to buy his own house where he will live with his family. 

Davaasuren seems to be a very hardworking and modest man. He is requesting a 750,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials to increase sales and build his own workplace.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials
